loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and replenish working capital

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es: Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta, tiene 45años y 5 hijos, es socia del FINCA Peru hace 7 años. Su negocio es una tienda de Medicina Natural en un Mercado, empezó con un pequeño ambiente donde cosía fustanes, el primer crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comparar telas y una remalladora para su taller de costura, ahora ella tiene una tienda de Medicina Natural, le va bien, gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido le han ayudado a poder administrar bien su dinero, y hacer empresa, ahora este préstamo que saco lo utilizará para poder comprar jarabes y extractos que es lo que le falta, gracias a Finca ella pudo obtener un terreno y la educación de sus hijos lo que mas le gusta es que ella aprende mucho en su Banco Comunal y eso lo valora mucho, ya que en otras Entidades Financieras solo se ocupan en dar préstamos, ella ahora desea poder tener su tienda en la Selva.
texts.en:
Joaquina is a member of the "Sumacc Huayta" Communal Bank.  She is 45 years old, and has five children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for seven years.

Her business is a Natural Medicine store in a market.  She started with a small business as a street vendor selling petticoats that she had sewn, and she used her first loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine for her workshop.  Now she has a Natural Medicine store, which is going well for her thanks to the trainings she has received, which have helped her to be able to manager her money well and create her business.

This current loan that she is requesting will be used to buy syrups and extracts that she needs. 

Thanks to Finca, she has been able to buy some land and educated her children.  What she likes most is that she learns a lot from the Communal Bank, and she values this greatly as other financing entities only bother with giving loans.

She would now like to be able to have a store in the town of La Selva.

loans.use: to buy syrups and extracts for her Natural Medicine store.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 27 and married with one infant child. He aims to improve his family's status of living to give them a better life. He has operated a motorcycle transport in his village for almost four years and usually earns a profits of 4,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. 

He requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts, and to renew his motorcycle registration. He believes that this loan will help him to make the business grow and become a viable source of income. In the future, he believes that he can uplift his family's status of living and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts, and to renew his motorcycle registration.

loans.name: Xuong

texts.en:
Xuong is 64 years old and single. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City and runs a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business seven years ago. She sells incense and worship-related products. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers needs. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different goods to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Thimothe

texts.fr:
Client de 53 marie et père de 4 enfants qui sont tous sur le banc de l'école.A la fin de la guerre qu'a connu le pays, le Congo, il perd son emploi, et avec le peu d'argent qu'il avait il ouvre une mini station de pétrole et  avec le temps, il va ajouter des cartes prépayées.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts de Hope , il a su faire preuve de bonne volonté, il a fait des remboursements constants et a des épargnes considérables.

Avec ce nouveau prêt il va acheter 8 tonneaux de 200litres de pétrole soit 1600 litres et des cartes de differents réseaux comme Airtel,MTN, Congo Telecom.
Il fait preuve de plusieurs stratégies, comme vendre a ses clients des bidons de 25l et des litres et demi litres, ses recettes ont largement augmentes et il épargne toujours, avec ses benefices , il prend soin de sa famille .
Dans l'avenir il est entrain d'investir dans l'achat des équipements pour ouvrir une station service de vente de pétrole, gasoil et essence.
texts.en:
This Client is 53 years old, married, and has four children who are all in school. At the end of the war that afflicted the Congo, he lost his job, and with the little money that he had he opened a small petrol station. Over time, he also began to sell prepaid phone cards.
Having already received several loans from Hope, he has proved his willingness by making constant repayments and managing to set aside considerable savings.

He intends to use this new loan to buy eight 200-litre barrels of petrol, for a total of 1600 litres, and also phone cards for different networks such as Airtel,  MTN and Congo Telecom.
He has several strategies, such as selling his customers 25 litre cans as well as litre and half litre bottles. His revenues have greatly increased and he is able to add to his savings regularly. He wants to use his profits to take care of his family.
In the future he is going to invest in the purchase of equipment to open a service station selling oil, diesel and petrol.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and a small kerosene station

loans.name: Yetana Trust A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Yetana Trust A Group in Western Kenya!  Mark is the facilitator of the Yetana Trust A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mark takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Mark had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mark was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mark and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Mark will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Yetana Trust A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows the members of the group, with the Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida, es viuda, y todos sus hijos ya tienen familia, pero la visitan constantemente. Vive en compañía de su sobrino y tiene su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Betty es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, e iniciando como independiente con una maquina de coser que compró con su propio capital e instalándolo en su casa desde hace 12 años. En un inicio realizó trabajos pequeños a sus vecinos y amistades, con el tiempo fue ganando más clientes a base de buen trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos personales y de su hogar ya que se encuentra sola, además de dedicarse un oficio que le gusta, lo que le permite distraerse. Su plan a futuro es instalar un taller de confección en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con los miembros de  su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsable y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará una maquina recubridora valorada en 600 soles, además de telas e hilos para costura.
texts.en:
Betty, 49 years old, is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman.  Also, she is happy and extraverted.  She is a widow and all her children have their own families but visit her constantly.  She lives with her nephew and has her own home.

Betty sews, which she learned by studying at vocational school.  She started her business independently with a sewing machine that she bought with her own money and set up in her house 12 years ago.  At first she did little jobs for her neighbors and friends and with time, her client base grew because of her good work.  What she likes about her job is being able to count on financial income to cover her personal and household expenses, since she is single.  Also, she enjoys what she does and is able to distract herself with this work.  Her future plan is to set up a workshop in her house.  

This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she hopes the collaboration will help her reach her goals.  On the other hand, she promises to be prompt with her payments just as she was with previous loans.  In addition to feeling comfortable with the members of her communal bank, she considers them responsible and caring people.  With the loan request of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy a sewing machine worth 600 soles and fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en: Mikidadi, who is in his 20's, is married and has one child. He earns a living by farming, works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Mikidadi's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy seeds. He successfully repaid these loans and is applying for a new one to expand his farm. Mikidadi will share this loan with his group, which is called "Tunaweza" and has 20 members. Each member holds the others accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to expand a farm.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in Changamwe, Kenya. Salim is married and has three school going children. He owns a three wheeler vehicle – tuktuk. The business has been in operation for the last ten years. Besides this, he also has a battery charging center. 
He is applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to repair his three wheeler vehicle. His future ambition is to acquire more three wheeler vehicles. The challenges he faces relate to high utility bills and the high cost of fuel. 
Salim will use the extra income obtained from the business to pay school fees, meet basic expenses and save for the future.

loans.use: To repair his three wheeler vehicle

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomas es casado, y tiene un hijo. Él Señor nos cuenta que tiene una despensa en su barrio de Ciudad del Este.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio, dedicación  y esfuerzo, ya que cuentan con una tapicería que le está generando más ingresos para su familia, además de la despensa que tienen.
El Señor ya es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela formada, debido a su amabilidad. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, enlatados, panificados y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tomas is married and has a son. He tells us that he has a general store in his neighborhood of Ciudad del Este.

With the help of his wife they are getting ahead with great sacrifice, putting in a lot of effort, as they have a tapestry making shop that is generating more income for the family, besides the general store that they have.

He is already a successful micro entrepreneur with an established customer base, due to his kindness. He has shown himself to be a trustworthy and honest person in his commitments. This time he wants to use the money from the loan to buy food products, drinks, canned food, baked goods and other supplies, in order to stock up and fulfill the requests from his customers.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, canned food, baked goods and other supplies

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en: Fayzeh, a 48-year-old housewife, has four sons and one daughter. Fayzeh has applied for this loan to pay for her only daughter's semester fees. Her daughter, Majd, who is shown in the photo, is studying to become a teacher. She is now in her second year. Because Fayzeh is a conservative person, Majd agreed to be in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees

loans.name: Souhair

texts.en:
Souhair is a 33 year old married woman who has 6 family members from Baqa'a Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for food stuffs for her market to sell, she have a small market in her home.In the future she wants to expand her market and she is planning on adding another floor.
Souhair prefers not to display her photo on the internet,thus the above is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for food stuffs for her market to sell

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Fidelia, se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y en tiempos libres  a realizar labores de casa y así poder mantenerse, en la anterior cosecha tuvo problemas climáticos  de heladas y en los últimos días del mes de noviembre ha sufrido escases de agua de riego por efectos climáticos, las parcelas de papa y arveja han bajado de rendimiento haciendo que la producción sea mínimo por efecto hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos a la familia que se mantenían con la producción agrícola. Cada año producen principalmente maní, papa, cebolla,  y maíz. La Sra. Fidelia es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada al trabajo de la agricultura y la producción de frutilla, con el cual saca adelante a su familia, ella  está solicitando el crédito para comprara semillas de papa, de frejol, comprara abonos y agroquímicos, para ampliar su frontera agrícola para tener mayores ingresos económicos, de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida. Trabaja en las parcelas que tiene, también tiene la clara idea de que con este crédito mejorará las condiciones de su familia y que en las próximas oportunidades realizará inversiones con créditos mayores que le permitan emprender negocios con utilidades de mayor valor económico.
texts.en:
Fidelia mainly makes a living in agriculture.  In her free time, she works in her house and is therefore able to maintain her home.  In the previous harvest, she had problems with icy weather and in the last days of November, she suffered a scarcity of water for irrigation due to effects of the climate.  

The plots of potatoes and peas have decreased in yield, causing production to be less.  Because of this, she failed in providing an economic income to her family, which she maintains through her agricultural production.  Every year, they mainly produce peanut butter, potatoes, onions, and corn.  

Fidelia is a very loved and respected person in the area where she lives, since she is dedicated to her agriculture work and in the production of strawberries.  In this, she can move her family forward.  

She is requesting a loan to buy potato and bean seeds.  She will also buy fertilizers and pesticides in order to grow her agricultural bounds and to thereby have a greater economic income.  In this way, she will improve the quality of life.  

She works in the plots that she has.  She also has the clear idea that with this loan, she will improve the conditions of her family and in the upcoming opportunities, she will be able to make investments with greater loans that will allow her to undertake business opportunities with higher profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds for potatoes and beans, chemical and organic fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YELIAN est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Apolline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Ayaba Apolline est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayaba Apolline est mariée à un agent du ministère de finance du nom de Hyacinthe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux  à leur charge. Ayaba Apolline vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison,  Ayaba Apolline vend, des produits vivriers. Ayaba Apolline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ayaba Apolline  ensemble avec les membres du groupe YELIAN, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel owns a bakery where he works from 6 in the morning to 8 at night. He is fully dedicated to the success of this business because it is the main source of income for his family. He learned the trade from his parents who were also in this line of business. He started the business by saving until he had enough to buy an oven. Although his business is doing well he is in need of a glass display case for his bread. With the loan he hopes to buy this case and the raw materials necessary to increase production. With the extra profit he hopes to fix up his home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a display case for his bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy Muthoni would like to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
G. Henriette is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her 4 children in Koumassi, a township in the south of Abidjan. Henriette sells various vegetables in the Koumassi main open market. She wants to purchase palm oil as it is the production season and prices are better now than at any other period of the year. She will stock the oil in casks and start reselling it in August, 2007 to make a profit.

G. is an enthusiastic woman. She received her first loan from AE&I in July, 2004, and we have never had any reimbursement issues with her. She significantly contributes to her family's revenue generation.

loans.use: Gauze Henriette will use the loan to purchasing palm oil.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina C. S. owns a bustling general store in Fao where she sells commodities including bread, cheese, eggs, lollipops, flip-flops, combs, hair ties, nail files, and diapers. Paulina will use this loan to expand her offerings by stocking new essential items such as rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, and sugar. The growth of Paulina's store will help her support her three children: Adelinas (13), Marinalde (11), and Miguelangel (6). Adelinas wants to work as a secretary when she's older; her more capricious sister Marinalde wants to be a model. For now, Miguelangel is content to be six years old. He spends most of his time tooling around Fao on his bicycle.

Note: Paulina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Paulina pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en: Mr. Jabir is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 29, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Jabir buys calves in one season of the year and sells bred animals in another. The more calves in his herd, the higher income he makes. That's why Jabir applied for $1000 loan to Normicro Saatli branch. After receiving the loan, he will buy four calves more, and next year in autumn his income will be much higher.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia Eziekel is 45 years old. She plats and weaves hair in her salon. She studied this business for 6 months and opened her store in 1977 after she was married to Mr. Eziekel. They have five children and live in Benin City. Mrs. E. . would like a loan of $400 loan to buy more weavon and hair cream for resale. She has been an LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more Weavon for plating hair

loans.name: San'athon

texts.ru:
San'athon M. works as an administrator and also sells on a market to fill in the gap in income to sustain her family. Before starting her business, San'athon thoroughly studied its specifics and planned out every step. San'athon planned to borrow money from her friends and relatives—a hard thing to do, because few of them had any money. Therefore, her first business loan San'athon took from MicroInvest. Today, she plans to use the money to increase sales volume and revenue.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Санъатхон работает в администратором и паралельно торгует на рынке, так как заработанные средства не хватали для ее семьи. Перед тем как начать бизнес досканально изучала, советовалась со знакомыми и просчитывала каждый свой шаг. Санъатхон рассчитывала взять деньги в долг у друзей и родственников, что тоже было непросто, так как их ни у кого не было. Первые деньги в она получила в МИКРОИНВЕСТЕ , можно сказать, с них и начал свое дело. Сегодня она планирует увеличеть свои доходы и доходы своей семьи.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
I am Naziran B., wife of Amanat Ali. I am a mother of six, one of whom is married. I live with my family in a small town, Depalpur, Pakistan. My husband operates a used clothes shop. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. He earns reasonable profits out of this business. Now, we want to expand our business and need a loan for this purpose.

My group members are also in need of loans and I request loans for them: Salma B. needs a loan for her husband’s wholesale business; Ulfat B. requires loan for her brother’s fruit business; Nasreen Anwer also needs a loan for her husband's business; Shugufta B. needs a loan for her husband who is an electrician.

loans.use: Expand used clothes shop

loans.name: Mulago A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce N.. She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 3000000 to expand her business. Joyce is 32 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 9 to 21, and her children go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Cissy Nakabuuye, Milly N., Nalongo N., and Christine N.. Cissy Nakabuuye is currently in the retail business and is requesting a loan of UGX 400000 to increase stock. Milly N. is currently in the business of fresh fruits and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to to purchase more fruit for sale. Nalongo N. is currently in the tailoring business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to buy sewing machines. Christine N. is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to buy poultry feeds.

loans.use: To invest in the stone quarry business.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 43-year-old car blacksmith. Ghassan has 4 children, and he lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. This is second time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy materials for his business so that he can support his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for his business

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla G. is marrried and mother of two small children, both still too young to go to school. Perla used to work as a employee in a supermarket in the city, where she was reponsible for events and promotions.

After a few years of sacrifice working at the supermarket with neither paid vacation days nor paid holidays, she put together some savings and decided to work independently. She began teaching crafts in local schools. Later she bought a sewing machine with a loan and began to do dressmaking in her house while still teaching at the schools.

Thanks to the fact that she maintained both jobs she was able to continue saving. Later her children were born, a change which motivated her to work more and more at home. Her husband works in the meat department of a supermarket and with his salary provides the family's income. A year ago Perla with her motivation to move ahead also opened a kiosk in her home thanks to some savings and a new loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

These days Perla would like to receive another loan, which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her kiosk and cloth and thread for her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Perla G., esta casada y es madre de dos hijos aun muy pequeños que todavía no van a la escuela. Perla trabajaba como empleada en un supermercado de la ciudad, ella era encargada de eventos y promociones.

Luego de varios años de trabajo sacrificado en el supermercado pues no tenía días libres ni feriados, ella junto unos ahorros y decidió trabajar de forma independiente. Empezó enseñando manualidades en escuelas de la zona, luego un crédito anterior compro una máquina de coser con los que empezó a realizar trabajos de costura en su casa a la par que enseñaba en las escuelas.

Gracias a que mantenía ambos trabajos pudo seguir ahorrando, luego vinieron los hijos cosa que también influyo para que cada vez trabaje más en su casa. Su marido trabaja en un supermercado en la sección de carnicería y con su sueldo aporta a los ingresos de la familia. Hace un año Perla en su afán de salir adelante también montó un kiosco en su casa gracias a unos ahorros y un nuevo crédito que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Hoy día desea adquirir un nuevo crédito, el que lo invertirá para la compra de mercaderías para su kiosco y telas e hilos para realizar sus costuras.

loans.use: Purchase of different types of thread and cloth, soft drinks, juices, sweets, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 28-years-old and is married with three children; ages 6, 4 and 1. Salama sells clothes (bedsheets), which she began in 2003. She works six hours a day and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Salama is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ajowa

texts.en:
Ajowa D. sells yams, which are very popular in Ghana. She is a widow and her income as a single mother is not enough to raise her two children.

Ajowa is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of yams for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and has six children. He had little education, as his parents could not afford to pay his school fees. He grew up in a very poor family and struggled throughout his youth. Recently, he has been facing some family problems because of a land disput which caused the death of his son.

Since joining GHAPE, Samuel has proven beyond doubt his ability to successfully invest and repay loans, and provide quality products, including piglets, manure, and food crops to his community. He has also gained respect from many people within GHAPE and his community because of his leadership qualities.

Now, Samuel would like to provide steady transportation services to his community. Given this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle, pay the registration, and obtain all the required official documents. Since the roads are not in good condition, many transport vehicles are unable to get to his community and motorcycles are the only alternative to transport people to and from the town markets. The profit from his motorcycle will enable Samuel further his children’s education and even build a better house for the family.

Samuel plans to pay back his loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle and required documents

loans.name: Chafik

texts.en:
Chafik, a 38-year-old married man with no children, lives in Beirut.

For a living, Chafik sells women's shoes. He works continually to expand his small business.

This is the second time he has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. After benefiting from the first loan last year, Chafik observed substantiA. revenue increases.

This time, he needs a loan for USD 1,000 as working capitA. to purchase shoe inventory, maintain his business and therefore ensure a better livelihood for his spouse and parents.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. started selling fish five years ago in Techiemantia, a suburb of Sunyani where she lives. Grace prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good-quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 45 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fish to increase her sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the community group called Benjamin Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: Grace would like to buy more stock of smoked fish for her fish stand.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es la coordinadora del Grupo “El Castillo”, ella inició el negocio por necesidad ya que era madre soltera y el único sostén de sus 2 hijos por eso decidió trabajar por su cuenta. Comenzó hace un poco más de 5 años ayudándole a un familiar con la venta de comida, y ahora ya tiene su propio negocio.

Blanca inició el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares dado que no era suficiente con lo que el ganaba. Comenzó hace 6 años con la venta de ropa de segunda vendiendo solo a amistades pero con el tiempo ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes y así sus ventas y pedidos.

Rosa inició el negocio para salir adelante dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años solo vendiendo ropa sobre pedidos y pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o casa por casa, ahora se estableció en varios mercados incrementando sus ventas.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo por US $1125 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y mercancía y poder así continuar con sus negocios. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante!!.
texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of the group “El Castillo” (“The Castle”). She started the business because of necessity, given that she was a single mother and the only means of support for her two children. For this reason, she decided to work for herself. She started a little more than five years ago helping an acquaintance with food sales, and she now has her own enterprise.

Blanca started in business to help her husband support their household expenses, since his wages were not enough to cover them. She started six years ago selling second-hand clothing only to acquaintances but, over time, she has increased her customer base and therefore her sales and orders.

Rosa started in business to get ahead, given that her husband’s earnings were not enough to cover their household and child-related expenses. She started three years ago selling clothing on order, giving small demonstrations at the houses of friends and neighbors or door-to-door. Now, she has established herself in several of the markets and has increased her sales.

These women need a loan of $1,125.00 USD, to be repaid over six months, in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise so they can continue with their endeavors. With your help, they will get ahead!!


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida tiene 33 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores, es conviviente, madre de  una hija, vive en el Jr. Pasco Nº 107 del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Puno y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave

Con el préstamo que obtuvo de S/. 300 compró productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes) para su tienda, posteriormente cambió al negocio de compra y venta de motocicletas junto con su esposo.

Actualmente se dedica a la artesanía y también continúa con el negocio de Motocicletas. Adicional a ello realiza trabajos de bordados y estampados en banderines, bandas, etc.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, lo invertirá en comprar material para elaborar guantes, chalinas, gorros y miniaturas para exportar al extranjero.

“Los créditos que brindan nos favorecen ya que en otra entidades financieras nos piden garantía y aquí nuestra palabra vale mas”.

Su sueño es independizarse y tener más contactos para exportar su mercadería al extranjero.
texts.en:
Nelida is 33 years old, finished high school, is married, is mother of a daughter, lives in Jr. Pasco Nº 107 of the Ilave district, province of El Collao, Puno and is a founding member of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With the loan obtained of S/. 300 she bought essential household products (groceries) for her store. Later she changed her business to the purchase and sale of motorcycles with her husband. Currently she works with crafts and she also continues with the motorcycle business. In addition to that she does embroidery and stamp projects in banners, etc. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be paid off in 3 installments, will be invested to purchase material to make gloves, shawls, hats and miniatures to export abroad. “The loans that you provide favor us more as in other financial entities that ask for collateral and her word is worth more”. Her dream is to become independent and have more contacts to be able to export her merchandise abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest it in the purchase of material to make gloves, shawls, hats, etc.

loans.name: Mr. Sophat Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Sophat S. was selected to be the village bank president of the group loan that includes eight people living in the Kampong Beong village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Mr. Sophat S. is fisherman, but he can gather only a small quantity of fish, because he does not have enough fishing equipment to catch more fish. He requests a loan to buy more fishing nets for his business; he hopes to catch more fish to support the household. His wife, Mrs. Un Sophea, owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Sophat S. is 26 years old and the father of two very young children.

loans.use: Buy more fishing nets to catch more fish

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es: La Sr. Rafaela tiene 51 años de edad, habitante de barrio Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con dos precioso hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, ambos los tiene estudiando. Sus planes en ámbito familiar es ofrecerle seguridad a su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos. Doña Rafaela se desempeña como vendedora en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cosmético y variedades. Trabaja medio tiempo como cocinera en una comediría, es un trabajo agotador pero es un ingreso más a la economía de la casa. Sus planes a futuro es tener su propia tienda con variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y ubicada en una zona en donde la comercialización este en abundantemente requerido a la necesidad del cliente este ramos de ventas. A corto plazo es construir su casa dándole seguridad as su familia. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque para darle protección a su hogar, para terminar su casa, y tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Rafaela is 51 years of age, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua, and is a single mother of two precious children of 13 and 15 years of age, both of whom are studying. Her plans in the family environment are to offer security to her home and to provide comfort for her children. Doña Rafaela works as a vendor in her small business selling clothing, cosmetics, and various other items. She works part-time as a cook in a food stand. It is exhausting work but is more income for the household. Her future plans are to have her own shop with a variety of products to offer to her clients and that is located in the commercial zone. Clients are in abundant need of these types of sales. In the short term her plan is to build her home providing security to her family. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans she has been able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, and blocks to give protection to her home, to finish her home, and to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Finish Building her House

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta B., 52 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge dont 03 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter du mil et du bois pour préparer de la bouillie et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration de l’alimentation et la santé de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fanta B., 52, is married and raising 5 children, of whom 3 are enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for 6 and a half years. Her business is buying millet and firewood to prepare and sell porridge. Her income permits her to help improve the nourishment and health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing millet and firewood to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Vajidin

texts.ru: Ваджиддин Махмадов житель города Курган-тюбе. Жеат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 35 лет. Занимается бизнесом. Завозит бананы и реализует их оптом. В данный момент хочет увеличитьб ассортимент товаров, завезти яблоки и мандарины. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Vajidin M., 35, lives in Kurgan-Tube. He is married and has 4 children. He is a bananas wholesaler. Vajidin needs this loan to add apples and mandarin oranges to his assortment. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Loliota P. is 48-years old, has five children, and, with her husband, rents a small parcel of land where she grows rice and other crops. What her family doesn't consume is sold to rice traders. She dreams of her children graduating from college so they can find better jobs to support themselves and their future children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to improve her family's standard of living

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 46 años, es una mujer muy alegre y querida por su única hija ana de 25 años, ella vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es que su hija tenga una vida feliz. La vida le ha enseñado que tiene que trabajar duro para conseguir las cosas que quiere, tiene un puesto de golosinas en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Puno, trabaja sin descanso desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche. Su trabajo no es tan fácil como parece, puesto que tiene que lidiar con las inclemencias climatológicas que nunca faltan en el cielo altiplánico, lo cual impide que sus ventas sean buenas, pero lo que sí le gusta de su trabajo es que es su propio jefe y no tiene que responder a nadie por el trabajo que realiza. Victoria lleva 28 años en este negocio y siente que todavía le quedan fuerzas para continuar, espera poner algún día, con el dinero de sus ahorros y con la ayuda nuestra, una tienda, donde pueda vender mejor sus golosinas, sin tener que para sus ventas por culpa del clima. Victoria se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy feliz obtener este crédito, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta ha hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con la cantidad que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende y mejorar así la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria, 46, is a happy woman, much loved by her only daughter, Ana, 25. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents and what she most wants in the world is to have a happy life. Life has taught her that you have to work hard to get what you want. She operates a business selling candy on a busy street in the city of Puno. She works tirelessly from 8:00 in the morning until 9:00 or 10:00 at night. Her work isn't as easy as it seems since she has to contend with the often terrible Altiplano weather. She likes being her own boss, though, and not having to answer to anyone else for her job. Victoria has operated the business for 28 years and still has plenty of energy to go on. She hopes to set up a shop one day, using her own savings and our help, where she can better sell her candy without having to stop when the weather turns bad. This is Victoria's second MFP loan and she's very happy to get it. She knows that she has to repay it on time and is committed to doing so. She doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her community bank where she is loved and valued. She plans to use the loan to increase the quantity of products that she sells and, in turn, improve the finances of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mr. Sary S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Leab Eang, 44, were married in 1993 and have one son. Their son is in grade eight. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sary has been driving a motor remoque taxi (a remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back) for twenty years. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh and back. Mrs. Leab Eang stays at home to take care for their children. The main income in the family depends on his motor taxi business, but his motor and trailer has been broken in some parts, which upsets his business. Sary is requesting a loan of $250 to make repairs to continue his business.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and a trailer.

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone F., 56, is married with 7 children. She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala. SPBD loans are Leone’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for home improvement and school needs.

loans.use: Purchase school uniform, school fees, chemicals, fertilizer, bushknives, wheelbarrow

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: Rosa Haydee M. Cojutepeque departamento Cuscatlán, Rosa es una mujer casada y madre de un hijo llamado Arquimides, Rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo, hijo, padre y hermana; en la casa de Rosa se encuentra el negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante, es una tortillería y venta de productos de bellezas como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas corporales entre otros, Rosa solicita este crédito ya que su venta de productos empieza y no tiene la capacidad económica de adquirir suficiente mercadería, es por ello que este crédito lo utilizara para comprar productos y comercializarlos ayudándola a estabilizar este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Haydee M. Cojutepeque is married and has one son, who is named Arquimides. Rosa lives in her own home with her husband, son, father, and sister. This is where she has her business, which she has been able to progress. She makes and sells tortillas and also sells beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc. Rosa is requesting this loan since she is starting to sell these products and she doesn't have enough economic capacity to acquire enough merchandise. This is why she will use the credit to purchase products and sell them to help stabilize her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Enrique P. is from the Navidad-Guayaybi district.  He has his own house and is married to Mrs. Josefina Vazquez who is 70 years old.  He is the owner of a business that sells beverages and food stuffs in general.  After 28 years of business, he has a good location and a large clintele base.  He also works with agriculture and has various crops and cattle. 

The client would like to expand his location in order to achieve a better business, and increase his sales.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique P. is from the Navidad-Guayaybi district. He has his own house and is married to Mrs. Josefina Vazquez who is 70 years old. He is the owner of a business that sells beverages and food stuffs in general. After 28 years of business, he has a good location and a large clintele base. He also works with agriculture and has various crops and cattle. The client would like to expand his location in order to achieve a better business, and increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of beverages in general

loans.name: Maria Celedoña

texts.es: Ella es originaria de la comunidad de Chipuac del Municipio de Totonicapan su activida principal es la venta de productos de consumo diario lo viene ejrciendo dicha actividad cuando tenia quince años hoy con los ingresos que obtiene los ha invertido para la educacion de su hijos hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de productos basicos de la canasta basica y para la compra de tarjeta para telefono para surtir su pequeña tiena que tiene y donde tiene demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Celedoña is a native of the Chipuac community in the Totonicapan municipality. Her principle activity is selling everyday products. She started this job when she was 15 years old. Now, with the income she has obtained, she has invested in the education of her children. Today she needs a loan in order to buy basic commodity products and to purchase telephone cards so she can stock the small store that she owns and where there is demand from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Maria, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socia,  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, hoy trajo a su menor niño de a penas unos meses de nacido, esta dormidito en su coche ella es una madre muy trabajadora y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the community bank "MOSOC KILLA", and she is from the town of Santiago in the city of Cusco.

She lives with her partner and has 3 kids. Today she brought with her her youngest son who is only a few months old and is asleep in his buggy. She is a very hardworking mother and she alternates her activities at home with business. She needs a loan for personal use.

She is very grateful for the opportunity that has been brought to her by this means, and she is committed to repaying the corresponding amount on time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use/Uso personal.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband Constrado, a laborer, and their seven children in the beautiful green farm country of the Antique province town of Hamtic. She currently has a small business buying and selling bananas and charcoal to her neighbors but it's hard to save enough to make the business grow and be more profitable. 

This loan of 6,000 Pesos as additional capital would offer her the opportunity to buy those goods in bulk for less money, make more profit and help her family rise out of poverty.

It is her dream to be a successful businesswoman and she believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed and be able to help her family rise out of poverty. Her greatest wish is to be able to afford a concrete house for her family; currently they live in a bamboo hut. Where they are there are a lot of typhoons every year and it's dangerous because their house is not very stable. She also would like to be able to start saving to send her children to college. 

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy her products in bulk

loans.name: Mirakhil

texts.en: Since he was young, Mirakhil V. has known work. His parents taught him how be successful as an farmer, and he learned very well. Now that he is a father, he still works as an farmer.  Thanks to his parents, Mirakhil now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life.  Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs. They are very expensive, and without them his production will not improve. You can help Mirakhil keep moving forward with his development plans.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rc Mabai Rowala Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the RC Mabai Rowala Primary School in the town of Magburaka. The school was built by Roman Catholics in 1968 and is now made up of six staff and 254 pupils.

This is the school's first loan from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, some members of staff will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will reinvest the funds into their existing businesses. Other staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, to fund home building projects, and to pay for education - either for themselves or their children.

Alpha S. S. (left) is the leader of this group and has been the Head Teacher at the school for ten years now. He was born in a village call Massessebeh, about thirteen miles from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with eight children – one of his children is already on his own, two are still in primary school and five are in secondary school. Mr. S. will use this loan to buy house building materials.

loans.use: To buy house building materials.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza    es socia del Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, del  distrito de Ilave, provincia el Callao, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 42                      años de edad, casada hace 25 años, ella tiene 2 hijo los cuales están a su amparo,  ella tiene estudio de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles monto que le sirvió para la compra de ropa como medias, interiores, toallas, etc. ya que ella se dedicaba a la venta de estos productos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional S/ 300.00 nuevos soles con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería en madejas de lana, ovillos de lana ya que actualmente ella se dedica  a la venta de lana los cuales los compra en Juliaca y los vende cada domingo en Ilave.

Su mayor anhelo es tener una tienda de lana y así estabilizar sus ingresos y tener mayor venta.

Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su banco comunal son las capacitaciones, los ahorros y el encuentro con las socias, ella pide que se rebaje los intereses.

loans.use: Para la comp`ra de madejas de lana.

loans.name: Galileo De Jesús

texts.es: Galileo de Jesús G. V. de 33 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, junto a su esposa y su hijo de ocho años de edad. El trabaja como vendedor ambulante, vendiendo productos varios como pegamentos, shampoo, crema para el pelo y otros productos más. Su esposa trabaja atendiendo una tienda y vende productos de catalogo, todo con la intensión de brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar. Galileo solicita un préstamo para capital de trabajo y así mismo para pagar algunos productos que comercializa.
texts.en:
Galileo de Jesus Gomez V. is 33 years old, and lives in Sensuntepeque with his wife and eight-year-old son. He works as a peddler, selling various products such as glue, shampoo, hair lotion, and other products. His wife works tending a store and sells products through catalogues, with the goal of offering help to her husband with the household expenses. Galileo is requesting a loan for working capital and to pay for some of the products he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new products

loans.name: Chimiddorj

texts.en: S. is a young single man, who lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2006, he moved to the city in the hope of finding better opportunities and improving his life. He operates a taxi service in the bustling city. He began his business in 2007 by renting a car for 450,000 tugrugs (~316 USD) per month. After two years of hard work, he eventually earned enough money to buy the car. S. earns approximately 25,000 tugrugs (~17 USD) per day and wants to be able to buy a piece of land where he can build a home. S. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan so that he can buy repair parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy repair parts for his car

loans.name: Gilda Jose

texts.pt:
Gilda U. nasceu em Xai xai, na Província de Gaza no sul de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 5 filhos de 45,40,35,30 e 24 anos de idade, o mais novo ainda vai a escola. Estudou ate 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria no bairro Luís Cabral em Maputo, para alem dos filhos sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Xai xai com os seus pais, ainda muito pequena, para Maputo. Mais tarde casou e mudou de residência para o bairro onde reside actualmente e, depois do falecimento do marido, que trabalhava nos Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique, passou a receber a pensão de sobrevivência no valor de 2.714.00mt. poupa algum através de sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Já levantou 7 empréstimos numa cooperativa de crédito (CCOM) para ampliação da sua casa. Depois de muitas conversas com amigas acerca de credito, conheceu a Sr.ª Isaura funcionaria da Hluvuku e decidiu solicitar empréstimos nesta instituição, sendo este o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro afim de poder concluir a sua obra e iniciar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Gilda U. was born in Xai Xai, in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is a 59 year old widow and mother of five children 45, 40, 35, 30 and 24 years of age. The youngest child still goes to school. Gilda studied up to the fourth grade, but didn't continue due to her parent's lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house in the neighborhood of Luis Cabral in Maputo. In addition to her children she takes care of two grandchildren who live with her.

She left Xai Xai with her parents for Maputo while she was still very young. Later she married and moved to the neighborhood where she currently lives. After the death of her husband who worked for the Mozambique Railways, she received a survivor's pension in the amount of 2714 Meticais. She saves some through the traditional "Xitique" savings system.

She has already raised seven loans with a credit cooperative (CCOM) to enlarge her house. Following many discussions about credit with her friends, she met Mr. Isaura, an employee of Hluvuku, and decided to request loans from this organization. This is her first loan, in the amount of 25,000 Meticais, with which she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, iron and others) to continue her work.

She promises to pay off the current loan in due course in order to take on additional loans in the future with the goal of completing work on her house and starting commercial activities.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, sand, iron and other materials)

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
la sra. Gumercinda C. tiene 66 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ahora que es una señora de edad es lo unico que puede hacer, antes trabajaba en varias actividades pero ahora no puede.
tiene la ayuda de su hija para la produccion de las tortillas. 
Gumercinda vende su producto en diferentes cafeterias y restaurantes de la ciudad capital, esto hace que ella tenga una buena demanda de su producto, tambien lo vende cerca de su casa de habitacion.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para fabricar las tortillas ya que sus clientes mas fuertes le estan haciendo pedidos mas grandes cada dia que pasa y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su sueño es poder remodelar su casa y dejarla como realmente ella quiere verla.
este credito mejorara las ganancias para ir ahorrando para realizar sus mejoras a la casa.
texts.en:
Gumercinda C., 66, makes and sells tortillas. Now that she is a senior citizen this is all she is still able to do. She used to be able to do various activities but now she is not able. Her daugher helps her make the tortillas. Gumercinda sells her product to various coffee shops and restaurants in the capital city. This causes her to have a good demand for her products. She also sells near her home. She now needs financing to buy materials needed to make tortillas since her main customers are placing larger orders every day and she can't meet their demands. Her dream is to be able to remodel her house leaving it the way she really wants to. This loan will improve her profits so that she can save a little to put towards her home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, firewood, lime powder, water, matches.

loans.name: Elsa Flor

texts.es:
La señora ELSA FLOR V. H., tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de cenas, salchipapa y salchipollo por las noches en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro papas, pollo, arroz, azúcar, etc. para la preparación de sus cenas y con el próximo crédito de 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas de gaseosas  por mayor, platos descartables, 2 sacos de arroz y 12 botellas de aceite. 
Hace 2 semanas ha dejado de vender porque se encuentra delicada de salud y está en tratamiento médico.
Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Elsa Flor V. H., 43, lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras II Communal Bank. She attended high school until the fifth year. She is in a common law marriage, and she has three children who are economically dependent upon her. She sells dinners, “salchipapa” (fried sausage and potato dish), and “salchipollo” (fried sausage, potato, and chicken dish) in the evenings from her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought potatoes, chicken, rice, and sugar, etc. for the preparation of her dinners. With the next loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy boxes of soft drinks wholesale, disposable plates, 2 sacks of rice, and 12 bottles of oil. She has stopped selling for two weeks because of her delicate health. She is receiving medical treatment. She dreams of expanding her business and having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of soft drinks wholesale, disposable plates, 2 sacks of rice, and 12 bottles of oil

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz A. is from the village of Labinay in Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Beatriz is separated from spouse and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Beatriz plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Beatriz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000 to expand her business. This will be Beatriz's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 43 años es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia  y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.La actividad a la que se dedica Olivia es la venta de jugos y yogurt, compra su mercadería en una ciudad  fronteriza con el país de Bolivia y la trae hasta su ciudad para distribuirla en las distintas tiendas donde ya tiene contratos anticipados. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es vender su mercadería, ya que siente que su trabajo produce, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los productos, ya que son muy frágiles. Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender en mayor cantidad  sus productosEste es el primer préstamo de Olivia con  MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre esta pendiente de  todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, ya que en la actualidad tiene mayor cantidad de  pedidos.
texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old. She is a humble and content person that lives in her own house and hopes to improve the quality of her life. Olivia sells yogurt and juices. She buys her merchandise in a border town with Bolivia and she brings it to the city in order to distribute it to certain shops that have promised to purchase her merchandise. What she likes most about her business is selling her merchandise. She feels like her work is productive. She has been doing this activity for four years. The difficult part of her work is transporting her products, as they are very fragile. With time, she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell greater quantities of her product. This is the first loan that Olivia has requested from MFP and she knows that she has to pay her payments on time. She is happy to be a member of the community bank. She knows the bank is counting on the members to meet their commitments. With the 800 new soles that she is requesting, she will buy more products. If she has more merchandise she will be able to fulfill more requests for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase more merchandise in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage children in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family currently live in a rented house. His daughter, age 19, attends a vocational training center and his son, age 15, attends a local high school while his wife helps Ganhuyag with his boot-repair business.

Ganhuyag began his business in 2006 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (approx. 69 USD) and as a result of his hard work and good customer service, his working capital now exceeds 510,000 tugrugs (approx. 352 USD). He is working hard in order to one day own his own house and workshop and buy new work equipment. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs (approx. 690 USD) in order to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for his boot-repair business.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for his boot repair

loans.name: Rommel José

texts.es: El Sr. Rommel M. H.  es conductor de buses de la ruta pochomil Managua tiene trece años de experiencia en esta actividad su familia es dueña de  rutas que viajan transportando pasajeros de pochomil  a Managua, es soltero y su objetivo con este préstamo es la adquisición de un vehículo.
texts.en:
Rommel M. H. is a bus driver on the route from Pochomil to Managua. He has thirteen years of experience in this business. His family owns a passenger transport line on the Pochomil to Managua route. He is single and his goal with this loan is to buy a new vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Nelson's Group

texts.en:
Nelson B. is from the village of Annayatan, Baggao, Cagayan. He is forty-five years old. Nelson is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nelson is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nelson owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever he sells an animal he raised.

In 2009, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Nelson's second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is an open-air hawker in Bush Town Market in Kakamega, Kenya. He sells general household and cooking ingredients such as sugar, candy, paper, padlocks, and cooking oil. He's been in the business for 3 years, and is using his KES 48,000 to purchase more stock for his business. He's single, and in the future, he'd like to own his own shop and sell wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for general store.

loans.name: Anastasia Wanja

texts.en:
Anastasia is 48 years old and a farmer. She is blessed with one daughter and two sons, aged 10, 15 and 20 years respectively. 

Anastasia was introduced to Kadet through a business seminar at Gatundu, her home town. She has been doing farming for the past five years and also operates a general retail shop as her other source of income. She plans to add another dairy cow with the loan she has applied for. With the extra profit, she intends to buy more dairy cows.

Anastasia hopes to grow her farming business, retail shop and dairy farming, and to purchase a chaff cutter. She describes herself as a hard-working farmer.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Aoko

texts.en:
Aoko is a farmer near Kitale, Kenya.  She is 32 years old and married with three children, who range in age from 4 to 11 years old. They all attend school. She's been farming for five years and sells maize, milk, and eggs at the local market. She faces a number of challenges, including poor transportation, competition, and high costs to maintain her posho mill (a machine that grinds maize into flour).

Aoko requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo.  She will use the KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will improve her life and enable her to meet her family's basic needs. In the future, she would like to be one of the main supplier of milk and eggs in her area. She hopes to purchase another three dairy cows and an additional posho mill to generate further income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian O. is married with three school-going children. She is married to Dominic Obare and the family lives in Mombasa’s Shanzu area where Lilian runs a kiosk sells home products like sugar, cooking oil,and  flour. She has operated the business for seven years and it has been a success.

Lilian got to join KADET through a member of the group she is currently in and is now borrowing her first loan. With the money, Lilian plans to purchase cooking oil, rice and sugar. She serves the residents of Shanzu, Keroport area and she says that the market is good. She hopes to go wholesale and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo R. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 22, 20, 15, 13 e 09 anos, todos vão a escola excepto o mais velho. Fez somente 4a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e para além dos filhos sustenta sua nora que vive com ele. 
Sai de Massinga para Maputo em missão de serviço em 1982, mais tarde passou para Boane onde formou seu lar. Trabalha como segurança na empresa Banalandia desde o ano de 2008, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 1.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas em conversa que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para concluir a construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 7.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Bernardo R. was born in the Massinga District, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of 5 children ages 22, 20, 15, 13, and 9. All attend school except for the eldest. He only completed school through the fourth grade, due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family, and in addition to his children he supports his daughter-in-law who lives with him. He left Massinga for Maputo to look for work in 1982, later he moved to Boane where he made his home. He has worked as a security guard for the company Banalandia since 2008. He does not have any employees and has a salary of 1.800.00mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and occasionally saves a bit in his bank account. He has never had a loan with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through word of mouth from friends who are also customers. This is his second loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt which he will use to purchase construction materials (doors, iron bars, cement, stone, etc.) to complete construction on his home. The previous loan was for 7.000.00mt for the same purpose. He promises to pay the loan on time in order to have access to others. In the future he plans to request additional loans to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials (doors, iron bars, cement, stone, etc. )

loans.name: Oam

texts.en:
Oam C., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells snacks at a primary school for an income $7.50 US per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and a mechanic, earning an income of $2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of $600 to buy car spare parts to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy car spare parts to expand the mechanic business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana L. is a married woman who supports her family with her general store. She lives in San Jose, Siaton, Ngros Oriental with her husband and their 8 children who are ages 16,17,19,22,23,26,28 and 30.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php8,000.

Juliana is now borrowing Php19,500 so that she could use it as additional working capital. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Juliana aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal Working Capital

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a young lady aged 22, living in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and her husband is a student, meaning Harriet, through her retail shop business, is charged with looking after the family in every way possible. She lives in a rented house with her husband and child. She would like to have a good home with educated kids just like any other lady at her stage with good life expectations. 

Harriet has operated her shop for one year now; she says she started so small but for now she says it has improved in terms of size, and she hopes to see it grow into a big retail shop. This is Harriet’s first loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to purchase sugar, soap, and maize flour for resale in her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, maize flour for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cover personal expenses such as purchase of medicine.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G., a married woman who lives in Brgy Zone III, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating a food vending business. Her husband, Armando G., 52 years old, works as a fish vendor and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who range in age from 13 to 29 years old.

Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

Helen's previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2000, thereby uplifting the family's standard of living. For her seventh loan, she is requesting PHP 9000 as additional working capital for her food vending business so that she can continue to save up for her children's college education. Helen G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 37-year-old lady who has been living with her family in a three-room brick house in the city of Borewala in Pakistan for the last ten years. Her husband sells clothes and she is a seamstress.
