She started this work because her husband needed her financial support in order to fulfill the basic needs of the family which consists of three sons and two daughters. All are getting their education from a local school. 

Rehana is well-known in the surrounding areas for her quality work and this becomes the source of her getting orders regularly. 

Her husband purchases clothes from Multan, which is famous for its embroidery and well-made garments, and sells them to a local market in Borewala. 

Rehana has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. To minimize his cost of travelling and the purchase price as well, he will buy clothes in bulk, according to the latest fashion and trends,

She is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business soon and that her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is a very responsible user of Asasah. She has maintained a good credit record and has never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $82 whenever she sells one of her raised pigs.

Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, red oil, pepper, salt, soap and seasoning

loans.name: Elsa Nidia

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa Nidia T. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como profesora de primaria donde ejerce el cargo de Directora en el colegio Rubén Darío de dicho municipio donde tiene 23 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su vivienda con el que compraría ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc.
texts.en: Elsa Nidia T. is a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and works as a elementary school teacher. She is the Director of Rubén Darío School.  The school is located in her hometown and she has worked here for 23 years.  This is the first loan that Elsa has requested from Ceprodel.  She will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc to complete an addition on her home.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc.

loans.name: Betsy Lourdes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Betsy, tiene 23 años de edad y esta casada hace 8 años y de esta relación tiene dos niñas de 7y 2 años, la mayor  estudia en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa recorriendo  Montecristi y sus alrededores. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza perfumería y accesorios de damas). Trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil y Ambato, ciudades a las que viaja una vez al mes dependiendo de los pedidos y ventas que realice.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en ir a comprar sus productos a Guayaquil. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son sucesivos.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa para que sus hijas tengan algo para el futuro.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi county, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized craftmanship, including the well-known straw hats. 

Here we find Betsy. She is 23 years old, has been married for 8 years and has two girls aged 7 and 2. Her husband is a bricklayer.

She sells clothes in the Montecristi area and its outskirts. She also sells Avon products (beauty, perfumes and accessories for ladies). She works on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil and Ambato, both cities where she travels once a month depending on the orders received and sales made. 

She is going to use the loan to buy merchandise in Guayaquil. She has been a member of the loan group for 5 years and likes it because she can get loans one after the other. 

Her dream is to finish her house so her children have something for the future.

loans.use: Buy clothing.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela T. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 42 years old and married. She started her fishing business when she married her husband, who is a fisherman.  She helps to operate their boat and catches and sells assorted fish at the market.  Estela works hard to pay her obligations and to provide for her family's needs.

Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Estela is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Rosa Florencia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la comunidad de Maluay que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales también salen a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades, muchos también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 13 años y su ultimo hijo de 2 meses, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo se dedica a  la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la atención de su bazar, este negocio tiene hace 5 años, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, el local en donde tiene su negocio es arrendando, a pesar que el mayor tiempo pasa en su negocio nunca descuida a sus hijos.
 
Doña Rosa se encuentra en su décimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y ha llegando a tener muy buenas amigas, el grupo Siempre Amigas esta conformado por mujeres alegres, luchadoras y trabajadoras.  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como peluches, zapatos etc., para la temporada de navidad que se acerca. Su mayor sueño es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" ["Friends Always"] communal bank. She lives in the community of Maluay, which belongs to Del Valle parish. This parish is characterized by its cold climate and beautiful natural scenery. Its people work in agriculture and raise animals, and some also go to the city to do a variety of work. Many have also emigrated in search of better jobs. 

Rosa is 33 years old and married, with 3 children: a 14-year-old, 13-year-old, and her latest child only 2 months old. Her two older children are in school. Her husband is a master mason and works in construction. They do not have their own house, so they live in the home of a family member. 
 
Rosa's work is running a small shop with assorted products. She has operated this business for 5 years, and she works from Monday through Saturday from 10 in the morning until 7 at night. The shop where she has her business is rented. In spite of the fact that she spends most of her time at her business, she never neglects her children. 
 
Rosa is in her tenth loan cycle with her communal bank, and she has developed very close friendships there. The "Siempre Amigas" group is made up of women who are cheerful, determined and hard-working. She will invest the funds from her loan in buying more merchandise, such as stuffed animals, shoes, etc., for the Christmas season which is approaching. Her greatest dream is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: Buying stuffed animals, shoes and gifts in general

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita B. is from the village of Cagay-anon Sinacaban. She is 45 years-old and married with four school-aged children.

Conchita owns and operates a seafood stall, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In March 10,2005 Conchita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for house repair.

Conchita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda C. is from the village of Rizal,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Linda is married. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the market. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Linda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina G. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Adelina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Adelina owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Irine Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Irine Jeokemoi C. is newly married to Peter Kipkorir Meli, 36 years old and a primary school teacher. Irine owns a poultry farm where she rears broilers for sale at maturity.  She has been running this business for 13 years and is really doing well as she earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000.
  
Irine has borrowed her first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She wishes to use 25,000 KES to buy 1-day-old chicks, KES 10,000 for feed and KES 15,000 for vaccines and drugs. She will save the profits she gets from the sales, hoping to expand her poultry farming to one where she can rear at least 1,000 broilers.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, poultry feed, vaccines and drugs

loans.name: Esly

texts.en:
Esly is a 38-year-old lady. She lives with her husband, Dominggus, and their son, Feto, who is 8 years old and in the third grade of elementary school. People usually call Esly “Uki” as her nickname. She has a kiosk business while her husband is a tailor.  They run the businesses at their house. Elsy and her husband are hard workers; they always work together to meet their family's needs.
  
Esly usually operates her kiosk from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. She sells variety of snack items, noodles, sugar, cigarettes, detergent, biscuits, soap and many other household needs. She started her kiosk business by using her own money as business capital.  Her money just enabled her to buy a variety of small items. She was only able to generate a meager income from her kiosk. 

Esly joined TLM’s small group lending program for two loan cycles. All loan money was used to add more items to her kiosk. She can generate a better income from the improved business stock. However, she still wants to expand her kiosk by selling basic household needs such as rice, kerosene and gasoline that are not available at her kiosk at the moment. For that reason, she is requesting an individual loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She definitely believes that loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: To add more items to her kiosk

loans.name: Con

texts.en: Con T. N., who was born in 1950, lives in Ha Lam village and is the mother of three children.  Her husband is a worker in the company near her house, while Con grows rice and raises chickens. Now raising over 200 chickens, she has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has always repaid her loans punctually. Con is now requesting a loan of 9.810.000 VND to invest in her livestock.

loans.use: To invest in her livestock.

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Alba, de 57años, es originaria del  departamento de Estelí,  es madre soltera ,tiene una hija .
De oficio comerciante y sastre al mismo tiempo,  tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual atiende ella misma y  lleva 13 años en su negocio. Comenzó a trabajar a los 20 años como costurera, aprendió sastrería con un curso que le financio su padre. En el año 1993 inicio con su negocio de pulpería, con los ingresos obtenidos de la costura, primero compro una cajita de jabón, dulces y pan.
En el año 1998 comenzó a trabajar con  su primer préstamo, que fue de  C$ 10,000 córdobas neto y lo uso para comprar vitrinas, exhibidores y productos para la venta.  La mayoría de sus clientes son los trabajadores de una fábrica de tabacos, la cual queda en frente  de su negocio. Siempre se ha dedicado a la sastrería sin dejar de lado la pulpería. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 pacas de ropa, comprar, aceite, arroz, azúcar y otros productos al por mayor para conseguirlos  buen precio. 
Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y mejorar las ventas, ya que tiene bastante solicitud de sus productos.
Tiene como plan ampliar mas su pulpería ,surtirla con mas variedad de producto  y meta próxima comprar u exhibidor de bebidas de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba is 57 years old and from the department of Estelí.  She is single and has a daughter.

She is both a seamstress and a merchant with a small grocery store that she has been running herself for 13 years.  She began to work at age 20 as a seamstress after learning the trade through a course her father paid for.  In 1993 she began her grocery business with the income she obtained through her sewing.  Her first purchases were a box of soap, sweets and bread.

In 1998 she began working with her first loan (C$ 10,000) which she used to buy display cases, counters and products.  Most of her customers are workers at the tobacco factory across the street from her store.  She has always kept up with her seamstress business while never interrupting her grocery activity.

She plans to use the loan to buy two packages of clothing as well as oil, rice, sugar and other products.  She plans to buy them wholesale to get better prices.  This loan will help her increase sales since she has many requests for products.

Her plan is to expand her grocery and stock it with a variety of products.  One of her goals is to buy a softdrink display case.

loans.use: To buy two packages of clothing, oil, rice, sugar and other products

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a businesswoman who lives in Nairobi with her husband and two children. For the past six years, she has been selling household goods to earn a living. She is also employed and therefore she has employed two people to check on her business when she is at work. Judy has gained business management skills through the trainings offered by Faulu Kenya. She hopes to develop her business into wholesale in the future. Judy has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy plates and cooking pans.

loans.use: to buy plates and cooking pans

loans.name: Philomene's Group

texts.en:
This group of seven entrepreneurs live in the same neighborhood of Toyoyome, a district in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their sixth loan with ALIDE, and they have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments.

Philomene (with her hand raised in the photo) is 56 years old. She and her husband David, a fisherman, still support one of their five children.  For the past 30 years Philomene has been selling fresh fish at the Tokpa market, Benin's largest. This loan will enable her to purchase stock in bulk to resell to individuals. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her care in growing her business, and her rigor with finances.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk for resale

loans.name: Belinda's Group

texts.en:
Belinda F. is from the village of Turod. She is 45 years old. Belinda is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Belinda F. Group.

Belinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Belinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Doña María, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, es madre soltera de un hijo de 11 años de edad, María tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al negocio de ganado, lo tiene en terreno propio y vende la leche todos los días, aprendió de su padre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado e insumos para el cultivo de maíz, como abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo ayudara a aumentar el número de ganado en sus terrenos, tendrá la oportunidad de cultivar maíz en esta temporada.
El sueño de María es apoyar a su hijo y convertirlo en un profesional, con oportunidades de superarse y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán. Her work is raising cattle. She is the single mother of an 11-year-old child. María has worked in her livestock business for more than 20 years, and she maintains it on her own land. She sells the milk every day. She learned it from her father. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cattle and supplies to grow corn, such as compost and fertilizers. This loan will help her increase the number of cattle on her land, and she will have the opportunity to grow corn during this season. 

María's dream is to support her son and make him into a professional, with opportunities to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and supplies to grow corn, such as compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kajubwe Tukore Group A

texts.en:
38-year-old A. Edson, a happily married father of two has been working at his carpentry business in Omukashenyi-Kihihi for a decade now. He makes wooden chairs, doors, and tables. Since the beginning he has banked on hard work to make headway in his operations. He began his business with savings from his tea leaves sales business. He still does sell tea leaves though it's now more of a second fiddle business. 

Monthly he says his business profits amount to shillings 420,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more timber to make more chairs and other furniture to resell.

loans.use: to buy more timber to make furniture to resell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This client is trading in clothing and shoes from a rented booth at the city market. She wishes to sell more clothes and increase her working capital. With the requested loan, the client plans to purchase clothing and increase the trade. With the loan’s help, she will get more income and will be able to pay for her daughters’ education and ensure a better future for them. The client lives together with her three daughters.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 57-year-old married woman with two children from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan. She owns a shop where she rents and sells bridal gowns. Aisha is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to purchase more wedding dresses and equipment to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wedding dresses and equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Genel's Group

texts.en:
Genel is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Genel is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Genel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Genel is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

location.town: Tudela-Sangay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 41 years old, married and has three children.  He has been operating a school for six years and has eight employees.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would get financial support. He has also benefited from the training offered by Faulu Kenya because he has learnt how to manage his business.

He hopes to grow the school and see the students excel.  He has requested 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy computers.

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a very active and nice lady. She takes care of her home by doing her household responsibilities. In addition, she works as a seamstress and embroidery expert. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. She started doing this work to support her husband financially. Now she has become renown among her community clients for her good skills and work. The income she earns helps to pay off the utilities and to manage the other household expenses.
  
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. Safia is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Only her two younger children are able to attend school and get their education. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business, the second son is a laborer and the third one is a building contractor. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery frames and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to be able to make better quality embroidered clothes and increase her income. She has been operating her business for the past eight years and is very confident that the investment will be a profitable one for her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy embroidery frames and embroidery materials

loans.name: Asghari's Group

texts.en:
Asghari is a 56-year-old widow. Her children are young and do different jobs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who is involved in an herbal medicine business. He not only sells herbal medicines but also makes medicines for his patients. He has been doing this business for the past nine years and has a good reputation among his patients. With the loan, he will buy herbs to be able to make medicines for his patients. 

Two other sons are also herbal medicines experts and one has a shoe-making business. Her other three children stay at home and do not do anything. Asghari remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She is still very active and performs her tasks very well. 

She is very confident that her son will be able to do well after the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy herbs for her son's herbal medicines business.

loans.name: Gulshanoi's Group

texts.en:
Gulshanoi, 34, is the leader of this group. Her husband went to work in Russia to make money and Gulshanoi takes care of their three children, all of whom are at school. In order to earn money and meet the family’s needs, Gulshanoi breeds cattle. She has been engaged in this business since 1994, and currently has two bull calves. 

Gulshanoi has a great deal of experience breeding cattle and is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. In the future, she plans to use the profits from her loan to repair her house. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rachael's Group

texts.en:
Rachael’s group is comprised of five hard-working women. Rachael is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in central Uganda.  She is married and has two children and one of her children is currently in school.  Rachael has had a clothes-washing business for two years.         

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase an iron box and more basins to make doing laundry easier.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Rachael hopes to own a retail shop. Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which may help her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase an iron box and more basins for washing laundry

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosario del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de refresco y un taxi negocio que tiene junto a su esposo quien es que maneja el taxi. Ella con el crédito le realizara unas reparaciones al taxi para que siempre este en buen estado y su meta es poder comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who started selling soft drinks and managing a taxi.  She and her husband both own the taxi and he drives it.

Rosario del Carmen will use her loan to have some repairs carried out on the taxi so that it is always in a good state of repair.  Her goal is to buy another taxi.

loans.use: to repair her taxi

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is married and has four children. For the past seven years, he has been a farmer and he works every day. Shafa was educated through secondary school but he had to quit because he couldn't afford to attend. Thanks to his hard work, he has become a man known for his determination who serves as an example for other farmers. His monthly income is about 160 USD and he grows vegetables and fruit.

Safa is requesting a 600 AZN loan to buy seed and fertilizer for his crops to be well-prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest. This will allow him to better meet the needs of his family and improve his working conditions.

loans.use: purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. She operates a grain business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 16 years, and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Kanze will use the Kes 60,000 loan to build a shade for her stand. She aspires to own a wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To build a shade for her stand.

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Divine est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  au Quartier Kamenge de la Mirie de Bujumbura.Elle fait le commerce de souliers pour hommes depuis 11.C'est un metier qu'elle commence apres sa sortie d'ecole qu'elle a fait jusqu'en 6e annee primaire.Elle est mariee a Willy et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l'ecole.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 400,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de souliers pour hommes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SIYONI».
texts.en:
Divine is a 30-year-old merchant who lives in "Kamenge de la Mirie", a neighborhood in Bujumbura. She's been selling men's shoes for eleven years. She started this business after finishing elementary school, which she attended until the sixth year.

She's married to Willy, and together they have six children, out of whom four attend school.

She's seeking a loan of BFI 400'000 to bolster her working capital and buy a lot of men's shoes for resale, in order to generate large profits.

She's a member of Siyoni Group.

loans.use: to buy a lot of men's shoes

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Asunta; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de papa y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de menestras como quinua,trigo y cebada,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa y negocio de venta de menestras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y menestras como quinua,trigo y cebada al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Asunta is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She continues with her business of buying and selling potatoes. Asunta also sells grains such as quinoa, wheat, and barley. By continuing to work, she wants to expand her businesses of selling potatoes and grains. She is requesting a loan to buy potatoes, as well as grains such as quinoa, wheat, and barley in bulk.

Asunta is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, quinoa, wheat, and barley in bulk.

loans.name: Daraja Mawe Farmers Group

texts.en:
Samson is the facilitator of the Daraja Mawe Farmers group. Samson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samson takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to ensure a plentiful harvest and food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samson had a good maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samson was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Samson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Daraja Mawe Farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Samson is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rey Mariano

texts.en: Rey Mariano is single. He is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rey operates a specialized retail store, which sells a variety of food products, in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for 17 years and every month he earns PHP7,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Rey Mariano has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rey Mariano hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro trabaja en una de las Compañías proveedoras de televisón por cable de la ciudad de La Paz, desempeñando las funciones en el departamento de transmisión, Energía y laboratorio. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad  que es un apoyo para su trabajo el cual lo  desempeña en las provincias de la ciudad hasta donde llega la señal. Ramiro tiene una hija la cual esta a su cargo .Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Bajo San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es  la  primera vez que solicita crédito en una institución financiera y también  en kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro works for one of the companies that provide cable television services in the city of La Paz. He works in the transmission, energy, and laboratory departments. The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle, which is a great help in his work as he travels to different areas of the city that receive a television signal. Ramiro has one daughter who is a dependent. He lives in a rented house in the District of Bajo San Antonio in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from a financial institution, as well as from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay vehicle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like peanuts, condiments and bags.

loans.name: Farrelly

texts.en:
Farrelly lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and owns a laundry and dry-cleaning business. The enterprise has been in operation for 37 years.

Farrelly was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a laundry-spinning machine. Farrelly’s main challenge is some clients not paying on time.

loans.use: to buy a laundry-spinning machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old. She is married to Ndungu, and they have 4 children. She has been running an agrovet (veterinary and agricultural supplies) business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 30,000. She will use the funds to purchase stocks of pesticides, fungicides, and fertilizers for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will expand her agrovet business.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow into a wholesale agrovet business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, fungicides, and fertilizer for her agrovet business.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Lenaa is a 24 year old married woman who has 2 family members from Marka Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for cosmetics products to sell such as makeup.In the future she hopes to increase her family income and she wants to develop her project also she would like to buy a home.
Since Leena is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: M.itiaz

texts.en:
M.Imtiaz is a 52-year-old married man who is an honest and hardworking citizen of Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. 

Since 1983, Imtiaz has been in the milk-selling business, which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he is interested in purchasing a buffalo to grow his business but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Imtiaz has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him grow his milk-selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr Felix A. was born in 1981 at Dagbati in the district of Vo. He failed to go to school because of his family’s extreme poverty. He learnt to take charge of himself very early, but in pitiful conditions. As an illiterate, he took a wife very early and now, he is father of five (05) children, which made his situation and that of his family difficult and increased the poverty. Clairvoyant and full of initiative, he is involved in the sale of cheap medicines from Nigeria (a West African country). They are obviously not the best kind of medicines available, but very appreciated by the majority of the population, because they are cheap as compared to pharmaceutical products of good quality but expensive for poor people. Advised and directed to cheap generic products, Mr Felix A. did his test with his first credit of $ 200 that was well paid back. Health being life, Mr Felix A. understood the need of a more adequate storage location for medical security. That is why he would like to have this credit of $850 which will help him rent a little store and improve the quality of his stock by the supply of generic products conform with international standards and help save human lives.

Monsieur A. Félix est né en 1981 à Dagbati dans la préfecture de Vo. Il n’a pas pu aller à l’école à cause de l’état avancé de la pauvreté de sa famille. Il apprit à se prendre en charge très tôt mais dans des conditions pitoyables. Analphabète, il se marie très précocement et est aujourd’hui père de cinq (05) enfants. Ce qui a rendu très lourdes les charges du ménage et accentué la pauvreté. Clairvoyant et plein d’initiative, il entreprend la vente des médicaments à moindre coût venant du Nigéria (un pays de la sous région ouest africaine). Ce sont des médicaments frelatés et d’origine douteuse mais très appréciés par la majorité de la population car étant moins chers par rapport aux produits des pharmacies d’Etat et Privées de meilleure qualité mais difficile d’accès pour les populations pauvres. Conseillé et orienté vers les produits génériques à bas prix, Monsieur A. Félix a fait son expérience avec son premier crédit de $200 bien remboursés. La santé étant la vie, Monsieur A. a compris aujourd’hui qu’il faut une structure mieux adaptée à la sécurité sanitaire d’où la demande de ce crédit d’un montant de $850 lui permettant de louer un petit magasin et d’améliorer la qualité de son stock par l’approvisionnement en produits génériques fabriqués sur la base des normes internationales en vue de contribuer ainsi à la sauvegarde des vies humaines.

loans.use: To rent a little store and buy the generic products

loans.name: Ayéléwa

texts.en:
Ms. Ayéléwa A. was born in 1957. She has been widowed for 10 years and has 4 children. The inheritance left by her deceased husband is not enough to meet the numerous needs of the family. However, her small animal breeding business, which she has run since a young age, allows her to more or less cover some expenses. She is now seeking a loan of $650 to build an animal enclosure and introduce a new species. Through this activity, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayéléwa est née en 1957 et veuve avec quatre (04) orphelins depuis 10 ans. L’héritage laissé par son mari défunt ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux nombreux besoins de la famille. Néanmoins, son petit élevage qu’elle exerce depuis son jeune âge l’aide à assumer tant bien que mal ses besoins. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour faire la clôture à ses animaux et introduire une nouvelle espèce de bêtes. A partir de cette activité, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Construction of an enclosure and introduction of new species of animals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has 5 children (eldest is 14 years, youngest is 4 months). They have a family business. Her husband has been working in their restaurant since he was 20 years old. Now he is 45. Besides this business, they produce cheese and ice cream.

She used her first loan to purchase the premises for their store at the local market. Now she leases it. She plans to use her next loan to extend their restaurant and establish a summer cafe.

In the future, Elena and her husband plan to sell the restaurant building.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Patricia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Patricia is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is an entrepreneurial person with a great desire to overcome. Her parents had a bread store and that experience has been useful to her in her current business. Due to the need for an extra income, because of fact that her husband’s salary is very low, they decided to open a bread store five years ago. Little by little, they have come to be preferred by their customers.

Patricia is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy ingredients, with which she expects to cover the growing demand for her products. She will return the loan in 6 months. The growth of this business and the wellbeing of this family are in your hands. Thank you very much for supporting someone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, es una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, sus padres tenían una panadería que le ha ayudado de experiencia en su actual negocio, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra porque el salario de su esposo era muy bajo, decidieron iniciar su panadería desde hace 5 años, poco a poco se han colocado en el gusto de sus clientes.

Ahora Patricia esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos, con lo que espera cubrir la creciente demanda por sus productos, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el crecimiento de este negocio, así como el bienestar de esta familia, muchas gracias por apoyar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo lives in Cadereya, Nuevo León. He's married and has five children, all of whom are also married. Due to the difficulty in finding employment, a year ago Eduardo started his own business selling clothes and shoes. He works at open markets and is helped by his wife, and together they have been able to move the business forward. It is their only source of income. The quality of their products and the good service they offer has allowed them to quickly increase their clientele.

To keep the business growing, Eduardo is requesting a loan of $275, which he will use to purchase merchandise to offer a wider variety to his clients. He plans to repay the loan within three months. Eduardo and his wife are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Cadereya, Nuevo León vive Eduardo, está casado y tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Ante la dificultad para obtener un empleo Eduardo emprendió su propio negocio hace un año, vendiendo ropa y zapatos, se instala en los mercados rodantes y recibe la ayuda de su esposa, juntos han logrado salir adelante con su negocio ya que este es su única fuente de ingresos, la calidad y el buen servicio que ofrecen de los productos que comercializan les han permitido incrementar su número de clientes rápidamente.

Para continuar creciendo Eduardo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Eduardo y su esposa agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: My name is Zubaida A. and I was born in Faisalabad, a mid sized industrial city. However, I had to move to Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan, after my marriage. I have seven children, four sons and three daughters. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes. My husband buys used and old furniture, machine spare parts etc from various factories and car workshops. He then sells these used items to different shops in the city. Earlier we took loans for this business, which yielded us better profits and we were able to repay the loan and marry two of our daughters. Now we again require a loan  which we will use to buy a large quantity of used items for the business. Buying in bulk is relatively cheaper and we will be able to secure higher profits.

loans.use: Buy used spare parts and tools in bulk

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba D. is a mother of four children. She started to work with Microinvest in 2002, and she is an active and responsible clients. She is very good at selling because she serves her clients quickly and politely, and they like her good assortment of shoes. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to further expand her business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
At about 62 kilometers from the city of Juliaca, there's a small town of Pukara. This is a very well known place because the people of this town are very well known for their beautiful pottery. Doña Luisa's family is no stranger to this gift since her and her husband have been making these pots and then sell them in the different fairs around the city of Puno. They begin working every day at 9:00am and finish at 5:00pm. They are always accompanied by their young children, who at a young age are already learning this beautiful art of making pottery. In the future they will be able to work on their own creations. Doña Luisa and her husband's wish is to increase production but in order to do this, they need more raw materials. This is why they are requesting the loan. Luisa and her hard working family needs your support in order to make their wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

A unos 62 kilómetros de la ciudad de Juliaca, está ubicado el pueblito de Pukará, este lugar es muy conocido porque en su interior alberga pobladores muy laboriosos con un don innato por la artesanía. La familia de doña Luisa no es ajena a este bello arte y junto a su esposo se dedica a elaborar una inmensa variedad de ollas de arcilla para comercializarlas en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos del departamento de Puno.Ellos inician su labor cotidiana a las 9:00 de la mañana y la culminan a las 5:00 de la tarde, acompañados siempre de sus menores niños, quienes a muy corta edad van aprendiendo sigilosamente los conocimientos de arte de sus padres, para que en el futuro puedan crear y desarrollar al máximo sus capacidades como hasta ahora vienen haciéndolo sus padres.El deseo de doña Luisa y su esposo Luis es perfeccionar este bello arte y aumentar la cantidad de su producción, para ello requiere adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima (arcilla) y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. “Luisa y su laboriosa familia requieren de tu apoyo para concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs Heng R., 38, is a widow who runs a shop at a busy market where she sells bracelets, earrings, rings, ankle rings and other jewelry made out of silver or ceramic items. On a typical day, she earns about $5. She lives with her mother and one child in Batambong province, Cambodia. Her mother sells groceries for a llving, and generally makes about $3 a day. Mrs. Heng R. has applied for a $1,200 loan to buy more fashionable jewelry to sell to her clients.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna H.  is in the business of food production and sales. She prepares rice and beans cooked together which is popularly called ‘Wakye’. She also prepares plain rice and stew for sale. Her business is doing well but she lacks enough funds to increase her production.

She is requesting $525 for additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production in order  to meet her increasing customer base.

loans.use: As  additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production in order  to meet her increasing customer base.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more store merchandise and more sawdust for making bricks

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru:
Gulom G. lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He sells fruits and vegetables for a living. Since the Rudaki region is close to Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan, Gulom can make a good profit by bringing the produce from faraway regions where it can be purchased for a low price. He then sells the produce at Dushanbe markets. Gulom wants to take out this loan to expand the amount of goods he is able to offer at his market stall. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months. Gulom lives with his young wife and parents and is the main bread winner for the family. Expanding his business will improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гафуров Гулом житель района Рудаки. Занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Район Рудаки находится рядом с городом Душанбе поэтому он привозит товар из дальных районов , где покупает по низким ценам у дехкан. А продает на рынке города Душанбе. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить его сможет в течении 10 месяцев.Гулом живет со своей молодой женой и сродителями и является основным кормильцем семьи, поэтому увеличив товарооборот он увеличит доход своей семьи.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Javlyanbek

texts.en:
Javlyanbek M. is 54 years old and married with three children. Javlyanbek provides taxi service in his vehicle. He has been in this business for ten years already. He has many years' experience driving a taxi, which he does for a living five days a week. At the same time he raises calves. Javlyanbek buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. His sons and wife help him with the feeding and looking after the calves.

Javlyanbek is trying to make his business stable. These businesses generate income that allows Javlyanbek to support his family. As long as Javlyanbek wants to provide the taxi services of high quality, he is going to have to fix his car. In order to do this he needs to purchase the spare parts. And he is also planning to purchase more calves. With this purpose he requests $1000 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Javlyanbek had already proved himself as a reliable client and today he also promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Javlyanbek would like to purchase spare parts to repair his car and also to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman is a dynamic young man with a desire to succeed. At 26 years old he has started up an computer institute. He has several computers, but needs a small injection of capital in order to increase the quantity of computers and in this way also increase the number of students. This Institute is recognised by the Minister of Education and Culture of our country, which gives the qualification that people who study there receive more worth.

He is a professional in the area of Information Technology, and aims to qualify his fellow townspeople in this area because in the world of today it is a necessary tool in any profession. His success would not only be monetary profit but also help to eliminate underemployment.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

Guzmán es un joven dinámico y con ganas de superación, hoy a sus 26 años ya tiene montado un instituto de informática, tiene varias computadoras, pero necesita de una pequeña inyección de capital para ir aumentando la cantidad de computadoras y así sucesivamente aumentar la cantidad de alumnos. Este Instituto esta reconocido por el Ministerio de Educación y Cultura de nuestro país, lo que hace valido el título que reciban las personas que estudian es su Instituto.

El es un profesional en el área de Ingeniería Informática, tiene como meta capacitar en dicha área a sus compueblanos porque en el día de hoy es una herramienta muy necesaria para cualquier profesión. Y su logro sería no solamente el lucro sino eliminar el sub - empleo.

loans.use: Purchase of three computers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 36 years old, is single. He lives in the north of Lebanon.

Mohamed owns a café in the same area where he lives. He needs a loan of $1,000 so he can purchase more goods for his coffee shop. This includes increasing his inventory of soft drinks, juices, coffee, tea, biscuits and "narguileh" equipment (hubble bubbles). With the summer season, a lot of clients from the neighboring villages come to Mohamed's café in the afternoon and at night, so he needs to expand his products.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase inventory: soft drinks, bottles of juice, coffee, tea, biscuits and "narguileh" equipment (hubble bubbles)

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es:
Ms. Estelvina M. lives in the Anexo Villa Libertad neighborhood. She is a 48-year-old woman whose husband works as a foreman. She has two children who are currently attending middle school. Ms. M. works as a seamstress and sells cosmetics. She has 5 years of experience in these disciplines, and she got started thanks to her husband’s help and her own efforts. Her cosmetics sales have been increasing since those products sell well, and she is dedicating more of her time to sell them. With this loan that she is requesting, she plans to buy new clothing, cosmetics, and gold-plated jewelry in order to offer her customers a variety of products. She hopes that by dividing her time with both businesses, she will be able to earn the income needed to help her family move forward. Above all, she wishes to be able to provide an education for her children so that they can grow up to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Estelvina habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Libertad, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, y su esposo trabaja de maestro de obras, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la secundaria. Doña Estelvina trabaja en la costura y vende cosméticos tiene cinco años de experiencia e inició con ayuda de su esposo y con esfuerzos propios. Hasta ahora ha ido creciendo en las ventas de cosmético ya que es bien vendido y le está dedicando más de su tiempo. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar ropa nueva, cosméticos, prendas de oro y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedades de productos. Espera que la división de su tiempo en estas dos actividades le puedan dar los ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante y sobre todo poder darles educación a sus hijos para que éstos sean personas de bien.

loans.use: Purchase gold-plated and silver jewelry, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son:  tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atención y administracion del negocio.  El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.
Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add products to her inventory and thus boost her sales volume.

loans.name: Nayyer Ishtiaq Hussain Khan Group

texts.en:
Nayyer baji is a wife of I. H. K. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan. She is 41 years old and a mother of three daughters. Her elder daughter sews clothes and completed her education through 10th standard. The other two are now in 10th standard. Nayyer baji’s husband grows vegetables on land he rents. He has been doing this work for the past 15 years. Nayyer baji is a seamstress and charges $3 per suit. She bears the expenses of her daughters' education and her husband bears the household expenses. They both are very happy to be dividing their responsibilities. Nayyer baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for her husband so that he can increase his vegetable yield.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Gulshan baji requests a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe-making business. Zareen kosar baji requests a loan to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her tuition center. Azizan baji requests a loan to buy animals (goats) to resell. Parveen baji requests a loan to buy another bicycle for her bicycle-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow vegetables

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos; Nelvar de 14, Rosmery de 4 y Ángel de 2. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella empieza su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde que es cuando existe venta. Sus ventas son muy buenas, especialmente en el mes de diciembre y enero por la costumbre de comprar ropa nueva para recibir el año nuevo, así que Pastora quiere aprovechar esto para aumentar sus ventas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de prendas para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pastora is 37 years old and is the single mother of 3 children; Nelvar 14, Rosmery 4 and Ángel who is 2. She works as a traveling clothes seller in the city of Juliaca. She starts her work from 8 in the morning until 5 or 6 in the afternoon which is when there are sales. Her sales are very good, especially in the months of December and January due to the custom of buying new clothes to receive the New Year, so Pastora wants to take advantage of this to increase her sales. She is in her first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money she has requested she will buy more articles of clothing to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El trabajo de ebanistería requiere de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y mucha arte para dar excelentes acabados a los trabajos llevados a cabo con la madera. En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Pedro B. se dedica a esta actividad y para ello hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado en la compra de madera y en la compra de las herramientas de trabajo.

En esta ocasión, el señor Pedro ha solicitado el crédito con el propósito de comprar la madera y para ello ha hecho uso del apoyo incondicional brindado por Ceprodel el cual espera que su crédito le sea otorgado  y así continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Working as a furniture maker requires great effort, dedication and a lot of art to carry out excellent work made from wood. In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega Mr. Pedro B. is dedicated to this activity and therefore makes use of the credits provided by Ceprodel which have been used for the purchase of wood and working tools. On this occasion, Mr. Pedro has requested the loan for the purpose of buying wood and having made use of the support provided by Ceprodel he expects that this loan for purchasing wood will be granted and that he can continue with his business that requires support.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan was born in 1985. This young man is single, lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the café business for three years. 

Now, he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary things for his café.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for café

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard P. grows rice to feed his family. He is 32 years old and has 3 children. Three years ago he worked as a driver. He was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 2000 he started managing his 1 hectare farm. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help him send his children to school.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He is also considering looking for some other line of business for his wife to manage. The loan will help him increase his yield and get started in a new business.  

CEVI provides Richard with credit assistance to manage his business. He also receives training and insurance coverage services from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo " Nuevo Renacer" esta representado por el señor Edwin y conformado por 12 miembros entre los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre el señor Diego y el señor Alex que son hermanos pero con ingresos y actividades independientes. Todos los miembros del grupo tienen actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como refrescos, cosméticos, ropa, chocolatería, comida, pan, abarrotes y empleados públicos.  Dentro del ámbito comercial existe gran competencia D. venta D. productos pero depenD. D. la calidad D. los productos y el buen trato que se le da al cliente para tener mayores ingresos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas en especial para aquellas socias que se encuentran empezando nuevos negocios como la señora Brigitte que se encuentra empezando un negocio D. chocolatería y necesita capital para emprenderlo.  Una mayoría D. las socias ya trabajaron con entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y en el manejo D. fondos para mejor su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
" Nuevo Renacer" is the name of this group, represented by Edwin and maD. up of 12 members, of whom two are related: Diego and Alex are brothers, but they have separate incomes and businesses. The members of the group are in sales: refreshments, cosmetics, clothing, chocolates, food, bread, groceries, as well as public servants. In commerce there is a great deal of competition amongst retailers but everything depends on the quality of the product and customer service if one wants to make more income. The loan will be used to buy materials, ingredients and tools, especially for those members who are starting up a new business, such as Brigitte who is starting up a chocolate-sales business and needs capital to begin. The majority of the members have already worked with financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital and therefore have experience with group loans and with money-management to improve the quality of their lives and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun P., twenty-two, and his wife, Mrs. Sokna Aun, twenty-one, live in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have a one-month-old son.

Savoeun and his wife have been weaving silk for eight years. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Savoeun is requesting his second loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for his silk-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for his weaving business.

loans.name: Fanaufouina

texts.en:
Fanaufouina F., 26, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the school children and public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~132 USD). SPBD loans are Fanaufouina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase twisties, ice cakes, lollies, German buns and cream buns

loans.name: Mwituberia Group

texts.en:
Fredrick is a single, 42-year-old man who runs a hotel and bookshop in a suburb of Nairobi. He is now borrowing his second loan from KADET, having fully serviced a first loan of US $125. Fredrick used the first loan to diversify the stock of his business and it has been successful. He has gained experience in small business management and KADET is certain he will use the new loan wisely.

David, a 45-year-old father of 6 who is married to Mary. The family runs a school and also has constructed some low-cost housing for rent. He wishes to renovate the premises where his school business is housed. David's first loan was for US $250, and he is now on his second loan of US $250.

Jackson is 48 years old. He is married to Rose and they have two children. He runs a livestock (dairy cow) enterprise. He used his first loan of US $315 to buy livestock feed for his dairy cows. He has applied for a second loan of US $500, which he will use to construct an improved livestock shed (zero-grazing unit).

loans.use: Improvement of the livestock shelter for the livestock enterprise, renovation of a school, and to buy more books for a bookshop.

loans.name: Lizett

texts.es:
LIZETH T. Q., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” su domicilio está ubicado en la Urb. Municipal MZ.A2 Lt.9, Es madre soltera, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos menores.

	Ella  se dedica a la costura, empezó con una maquina de coser antigua que había comprado con un dinero ahorrado, luego con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas, elásticos y repuestos para su maquina.  Desde hace  dos años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha ido muy bien por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de su préstamo.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo  invertirá en  la compra de una remalladora que por mucho tiempo ha sido un sueño para ella porque le servirá para mejorar los acabados de sus costuras.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
LIZETH T. Q. is a member of the "LAS DIVINAS" Communal Bank. Her address is Urb. Municipal Mz A2 Lt9. She is a 33-year-old single mother of two minor children. She sews and began working with an antique sewing machine which she had purchased with her savings. Then, with her first loan of 300 new soles she got from Manuela Ramos, she bought material, elastic and replacement parts for her machine. For the two years she has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos she has done well thus the need to increase her loan. With this new 2000 new soles loan she will purchase a new sewing machine which has been her dream for many years for she will thus be able to improve her finishing touches on her creations. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that provides community service contributing to the well-being of women in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 19 años se viene dedicando a la elaboración de calzado, incursionó en este negocio porque trabajó en un pequeño taller al lado de su esposo, quien también se dedica al mismo oficio, decidiendo entre los dos tener algo propio y los años de experiencia les dieron los conocimientos necesarios para dedicarse independientemente a ello. Felipa dice sentirse muy contenta con su negocio, ya que le gusta la libertad que tiene, puesto que puede elegir las horas en las cuales trabajar y las horas que tiene que dedicarle a su familia. Además, trabaja al lado de su esposo, quien es el que cose los zapatos dándole los acabados necesarios y por su parte ella corta el cuero con los moldes respetivos. Ambos reciben pedidos en cantidad de varios mercados del lugar y también realizan zapatos personalizados, ya que aquel cliente que en los mercados no encuentre un zapato de acuerdo a su gusto, puede recurrir al pequeño taller de Felipa, para que le fabriquen el calzado a su gusto, cobrando un mayor precio por ello. Ella y su esposo tienen mucha fe en seguir progresando, quieren comprar más cantidad de máquinas y poner un taller muy bien equipado para que se les facilite la producción de sus zapatos. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y el grupo al cual pertenece es muy unido y trabajador, es por ello que se siente feliz de pertenecer a él. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cuero, para elaborar zapatos cerrados para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Felipa, 42, lives in her own house with her husband and two children ages 15 and 12. She has been making footwear for 19 years. She started this business because she worked in a small shop by her husband’s side (he does the same work), and they decided to have something of their own. Their years of experience gave them the necessary knowledge to work at it independently. Felipa feels very happy with her business. She likes the freedom she has, since she can decide the hours she works and the hours she has to spend with her family. Also, she works at her husband’s side. He sews the shoes and gives them the necessary finishings. She cuts the leather with the appropriate molds. They both receive orders in quantities from various markets in the area. They also make custom shoes. A customer in the market who cannot find shoes they like can go to Felipa’s small shop, and for a greater charge, they will make a shoe the customer likes. She and her husband have a lot of faith that they will continue to make progress. They want to buy more machines and set up a very well equipped shop to make shoes. This is their ninth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The group they belong to is very united and hard working. That is why she feels happy to belong to the group. She will use the money to buy a greater quantity of leather to make closed shoes for the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather for making shoes

loans.name: Holnazar

texts.ru: Холназар Саидов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын работает в России. Холназар по профессии болеее 6 работает преподавателем. В данный момент он более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Клиент хочет купить крупно рогатый скот, для откармливания  и продажи.
texts.en:
Holnazar S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. His son works in Russia. Holnazar has been working as a teacher for over 6 years. Currently, he has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. Client wants to buy cattle for feeding and selling.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
It was in May 1994 that Michelle E. and her husband started a small hatchery business. They can still remember the time when they were making “balut”(egg delicacy) themselves, never worrying about the risk of biking at night, to sell their eggs for income for their family. Every day, they toil away because they like to earn enough to have savings to add to their capital. They also ensure good quality of their product and services to please their customers and sustain their business. Their experiences are really a mixture of perseverance, hard work and prayer that they continuously do until today.

Presently, the couple are the proprietors of the largest “Balut” and hatchery business in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, Mindanao. “ Balut” is a very popular delicacy in the Philippines. It is made of duck and chicken eggs. Making the eggs as their business, the couple is sure that they will have a stable income their family will enjoy.

Aiming for business growth to support their child's education, the couple finally joined the credit program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Their participation in the program was an opportunity to learn about savings and business management. During cluster meetings, they were able to market and talk about their product to other entrepreneurs who were also accessing CEVI credit services. The couple markets their eggs as well as their ducklings, always for sale.

Over years of business development, their loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI has gone far in acquiring business assets. Seventy percent of their income is reinvested in the business and the rest goes to savings.

“Some of our competitors have tried destroying us as well as our business. They are after our regular customers. Good that they never succeeded. God has helped us survive and stay in the market for so many years now. We are doing our best to make our business grow even more. In that way we would be able to employ more people in our business,” they said. The business has now reached Davao and General Santos (still part of Mindanao). They opened an outlet in these cities, hoping that more and more “Balut vendors” will be able to benefit from their high quality but less expensive eggs.
