Surprisingly, their business has turned everyone on to sell eggs in the streets to have a livelihood for their children.

Aside from the hatchery business, they have now started distributing fashion products. This business also helps them supplement their income. They hope that like their hatchery business, their engagement in fashion retail will also be a success.

Until now, the couple continues to access loans through the CEVI credit program. They like the services of CEVI because they also teach people with businesses moral standards and Christian faith. The couple believes in God, who is the center of their business success. They believe that God will always bless the works of the faithful. And with all accomplishments and compliments they receive, they will remain humble and continue to help their community, especially those who seek their aid.

Having learned about KIVA from CEVI, Michelle E. would like to borrow Php 25,000. She will use the loan to improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for sale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven de 21 años de edad, de 6 hermanos, él es el último. Hace poco falleció su padre, por lo que está muy pendiente de su madre, con la que vive, además de con uno de sus hermanos. Desde pequeño su padre le enseñó las técnicas agrícolas y por el momento está avocado en cultivar las chacras que sembró en vida su padre, hasta lograr comercializar los productos en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Eduardo considera que la agricultura es muy rentable, pero necesita de mucho trabajo y alta inversión económica en fertilizantes y fungicidas. Eduardo recuerda con gran nostalgia cada una de las enseñanzas y métodos de su padre y los aplica oportunamente en cada una de sus siembras, donde es apoyado por su madre y su hermano. Para el futuro, Eduardo desea incrementar sus cultivos, en aras de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, él ingresa en reemplazo de su padre al banco comunal, motivado por su madre y con el consentimiento de los demás integrantes. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 21 years old and has 6 brothers. He is the youngest child. Eduardo’s father recently passed away. He still lives with his mother and one of his brothers. As a boy, his father taught him farming techniques. His father made his living growing avocados, which he would sell in the market in Tarma. Eduardo considers farming to be very profitable, but it requires a lot of work and financial investment in fertilizers and fungicides. He remembers with great fondness each of the methods and pieces of advice that his father gave him for each type of crop. Eduardo has the support of his mother and brother. In the future, he would like to increase his production so that he can improve the quality of life for his family.

This is his first loan with MFP. Encouraged by his mother, Eduardo acquired his father’s membership with the communal bank and the other group members consented. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Love

texts.en: Love, 40 years old and married with six children, sells provisions. She has been in this business for the past four years and is requesting the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Bato. She is 52 years old. Erlinda is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jose Omar Vicente

texts.es: Jose Omar Vicente G. H. de 31 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposa quien es comerciante. Jose se dedica a su negocio , que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una carpintería donde el ofrece servicios de reparación hasta elaboración de muebles al gusto del cliente, Jose lleva el talento en sus manos en la zona es muy conocido por los hermosos diseños de sus muebles tallados en madera, el crédito que el solicita es para comprar madera al mayor y así poder crear diferentes muebles para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de madera al por mayor

loans.name: Ediri

texts.en: Ediri, 49 years old and married with three children, sells plastic items such as cups, bowls and plates to make a living. She is a friendly woman and she uses this skill to attract more customers to her stall. She has been in this business for a long time and is requesting  a loan of N100,000 to purchase more plastics to sell. Ediri says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Josefa Maritza

texts.en:
Josefa inherited her business and now sells red meat and pork in the Subtiava market in the city of León.

She has a good credit history with Fundación León 2000 and because of these loans, has built up her business. As a result, the Subtiava market has given Josefa a prime location.

Josefa is married and has a 17 year old son who is in high school. Josefa is determined to continue with her business in order to support her son so that he can become a contributing member of the community.

loans.use: Capital for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 28 años, vive en casa de uno familiares con sus 2 hijos.
Desde hace 6 años trabaja comprando y vendiendo animales, en su casa tiene un establo donde tiene a sus vacas, a las que engorda para ofrecerlas a mayor precio en el mercado ganadero de su localidad. Su metodología de trabajo es muy buena para ella porque recupera lo invertido en la alimentación de los animales y puede tener la disponibilidad de su dinero cuando lo necesite.
Sin embargo, algunas veces el clima lluvioso le impide transportar a sus animales hacia las ferias, pero eso no es un impedimento suficiente para concretar una venta, pues Lourdes de las ingenia siembre para vender sus animales. 
Para el futuro, ella desea tener más capital para que cuando compre animales no sea sólo una cabeza de ganado, sino más de tres.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser  parte integrante de este nuevo banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a trabajar honestamente. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de una vaquillona que hará engordar por 3 meses y posteriormente la revenderá a un precio más elevado.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 28, lives with her two children in relatives' house. For the past 6 years she has raised cattle. She has a stable where she raises her cows fattening them up for later sale at better prices at the local livestock market. Her work methodology is very good because she is able to recoup what she invests in the feed and can have money available when she needs it. Sometimes the rainy weather makes it impossible to transport her animals to market. However, this isn't an insurmountable obstacle because Lourdes always figures out a way to sell her animals. For the future, she would like to have sufficient capital available to buy animals in groups of three or more, not just one at a time. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to be a member of this new communal bank so she commits to work honestly. The funds requested will be used to buy a young heifer which she will fatten for three months to sell later at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 48 years old and lives in the island of Binangonan, an attractive province of Rizal. She and her husband have three children. Judy Ann, 12 years old, is a high school student. Jeremie, 11 years old, and Jericho, 9 years old, are both in elementary grades. She is married to Hilario, a 52-year-old construction worker (laborer) and a supportive husband.

In 1997, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap Inc.) a microfinance institution and KIVA field partner in the Philippines. Amelia makes and sells food. She has been in business for more than 10 years. She believes that her proposed loan of Php 20,000.00 will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loans funds to buy rice, sugar, and an electric coconut grinder for her business. She will also start raising hogs for additional income.  

Amelia dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that will complete a degree in college. She believes that poor families need support so that they can change their standard of living and build beautiful houses for their families to live. When she joined ASHI, she had only a "bahay kubo" (a small house made of bamboo) but with the benefit of loans and the support of ASHI in their lives, their small house of bamboo has become big one made of hollow blocks. Half of her dreams have been gradually achieved, but she is still dreaming about completing them. Amelia is a positive and optimistic mother who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and an electric coconut grinder, and to start a hog-raising business

loans.name: Jhudy

texts.es: Jhudy de 28 años es una mujer muy empeñosa y esta casada con José, también de 28 años, ambos viven en su casa propia junto a sus 2 inquietos hijos, Roselin de 11 y Anthony de 2 años.Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija, cada día es de constante lucha y sacrificio porque mantienen abierta la tienda las 24 horas del día para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que el negocio esta ubicado cerca de un puente por donde pasan los carros y éstos se detienen a comprar principalmente bebidas heladas, debido al calor que hace en la selva peruana; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer  amigos, quienes por el buen trato que les brinda regresan a comprar; la venta de sus productos le resulta bastante rentable porque el dinero que  obtiene le permite aportar en los gastos del hogar, además esta  ahorrando  para comprar un terreno, pues  desea ampliar el espacio de su negocio y vender al por mayor ,hasta sueña en convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos comestibles.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que seguirá progresando porque pagará  puntualmente sus cuotas, asimismo le entusiasma trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal.Piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de más mercadería para mejorar  su tienda y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Jhudy is 28 years old and married to José, who is also 28. She is an earnest woman who lives in her own home with her two active children, Roselin (age 11) and Anthony (age 2). For the past four years, she has been selling food products with the help of her husband and daughter. Each day is a constant struggle that requires great sacrifice because she keeps her store open 24 hours a day in order to earn the most income possible. Her business is located near a bridge where cars pass through the area. People stop to buy cold drinks in order to deal with the heat of the Peruvian jungle. What she enjoys most about her job is making friends with her customers, who return to make more purchases because of the good service they receive. Jhudy says selling her products is profitable and allows her to contribute to the household expenses. In addition, she is setting aside money to buy land so that she can have enough space to expand her business. Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor of food products.

This is her third loan with MFP. Jhudy knows that in order to make progress, she must make her payments on time. She is also excited about working with the other members of her Communal Bank. The funds will be used to purchase more merchandise so that she can improve her store and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is single. His family lives in Dushanbe where he sells assorted blankets, towels, tablecloths, shawls and many other textiles in the central city market. His business is characterized by a good selection of merchandise and affordable prices. Juma has been in this business for four years. One of his dreams is to purchase a private house and make his own family. He believes that persistent work and higher sales would help him generate enough profit and put aside enough savings to make this dream come true.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Filis Atemi

texts.en: Filis Atemi W. is 44 years of age, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Nambale, Busia district where she runs a clothing business alongside a poultry one. She started both businesses in the year 2000 in order to generate income.  She would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 which will go towards restocking her clothing business. Her future dream is to expand her clothing business into wholesale and to build rental houses.

loans.use: To restock clothing.

loans.name: Umuma

texts.en: Umuma M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, beans and rice in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Umuma is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses for renting. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old married man with two young children. He has owned a chocolate and sweets shop since 2006 and has seven years of experience in this occupation when he was working in a friend's shop. He cooperates with his wife to provide better living conditions for their kids. He presents his products on shelves so it is easy for his clients to choose. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $700 to add more merchandise to increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: To add more merchandise

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Miss Savet N. (shown in the photo), 23, is single and lives with her widowed mother on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is a silk weaver. 

Savet is a tailor and operates her business at her home. She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nelly Emerita

texts.es: Nelly Emerita A. J. de 32 años de edad, reside en Ozatlán ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar la tierra en el campo, sembrando y cultivando maíz y otros cultivos. Así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Nelly posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: leche, embutidos, leche, crema, detergentes y otros productos más los cuales son fundamentales para el hogar. El mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y de esta manera salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos, y de esta misma forma darle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder tener una mejor economía familiar. Es por esta razón que Nelly solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para realizar este sueño el cual es mejorar las condiciones del negocio y de esta manera la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Emerita A. J. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ozatlán in the Usulután region. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer who grows corn and other crops. They live with their four minor children who are all in school. Nelly has a shop where she sells milk, cold cuts, sour cream, detergent, and other household necessities. Her greatest desire is to fully stock her shop so she can get ahead financially and provide everything that her four children need. She also wants to be able to help her husband so that their household is more stable financially. For this reason, Nelly is requesting a loan from Integral. She will use the loan to realize her dream of improving her business and in this way improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple items

loans.name: Mirian Aydee

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne con 31 socias en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas. 

La señora Miriam es una de las socias desde hace 37 ciclos y nos permitió conocer más  de ella, Está casada tiene dos bebes y esta a la espera del tercero, en el grupo le va muy, en los meses que tiene de gestación la suegra ha sido quien le ha ayudado a vender.

La señora Miriam se dedica a vender productos Avon y ropa para damas caballeros y niños, siempre ha invertido todo lo que presta en la Fundación pero en época de invierno invierte poco no son iguales las ventas se gana poco, y  por medio de la revista de Avon ofrece los productos para que los clientes hagan sus pedidos, la ropa en cambio el esposo es el que viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil para comprar a los mayoristas, desde hace 3 años viene nuestra socia trabajando en sus ventas y lo hace de una manera informal visitando puerta a puerta las casas de sus clientes , se dedica a vender los fines de semana, con este nuevo crédito invertirá todo para estos meses que son buenas las ventas tiene pedidos como pantalones y perfumes por entregar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" meets with its 31 members in Bajo de Montecristi in Manabí province. This is a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation. Its residents perform different occupations: such as merchants, and factory employees. Miriam has been a member for 37 loan cycles, so we know a lot about her. She is married with 2 children, and is currently expecting her third. She does very well in the group, and in the months that she has been pregnant her mother-in-law has been helping her to sell. Miriam sells Avon products and clothing for men, women and children. She has always invested everything she has borrowed from the Foundation, but in the winter season she invests little because during these months she earns very little. Using the Avon catalog she offers products to her customers through advance orders. To obtain her clothing, her husband travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy from the wholesalers. She has been working in sales for 3 years, and she does it in an informal manner, visiting her customers door-to-door. She sells during the weekends. She will invest all of the proceeds of this new loan so that she will have products for the months when sales are high, and so that she can fill orders that she has for products such as pants and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men and children, and Avon brand perfumes

loans.name: Angelica Pedro

texts.pt:
Angélica Pedro N. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 39 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos. 
Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo com a sua família no ano de 2000, onde mais tarde fixou sua residência no Distrito de Boane. É comerciante e dona do seu negócio a mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 3° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada diversa para aumentar quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.000.00mt e 5.000.00mt ambos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Tem como sonho melhorar as condições de habitação para a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Angélica Pedro N. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 39 years old, widowed, and has six children, ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 6. All the children go to school. Angélica only finished fifth grade; she did not continue with school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone other than her children. She left Chibuto in 2000 to move with her family to Maputo, settling in Boane District. She has owned her own business for more than five years. She has no employees and earns around 6,000 meticais monthly. Angélica uses this money for household expenses and sometimes manages to save some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who is also a customer of this institution. This is Angélica's third loan. She is asking for 12,000 meticais, which she will use to buy bundles of assorted used clothing to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 3,000 meticais and 5,000 meticais, and both were used for the same purpose. Angélica promises to pay off this loan on time in order to take out other loans. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions. In the future she intends to ask for more loans to help her business grow.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en:
Joelyn D. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 23 years old, is single, and has two infant children. Joelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Joelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Joelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is a small-business married woman who lives with her family at her own house. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (kanga and vitenge) at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam.

Elizabeth purchases her business goods from Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes city shopping center from the wholesale shops and sells to retail customers at her shop. She also runs a garden from which different types of green vegetables are cultivated and sold for domestic use.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase zinc roofing & crossbeams

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie B. is from the village of Hubangon, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old and is married with five adult children. Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en: Chheun N. is 30 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells various kinds of vegetables that she buys in bulk on credit from suppliers. Chheun N. sells her items in front of her home. In addition, she farms crops on her own farmland next to her house. Her husband sells ice-cream to pupils in school to raise extra money. The couple is married and have two school-age children. Chheun Vavy will use the loan she is requesting to repair her old house that often breaks down.

loans.use: To repair her old house that often breaks down.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Mr. Sros M. (pictured above), is 29 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sarorn Leng, is 24 years old. They live in a suburb about 15 kilometers outside Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. He also has his elderly mother living with him.

Sros grows vegetables on his farmland in the village. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase cows to raise and use for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise and use for growing vegetables

loans.name: Kyamugarura Co-Operative Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Charles would like a loan to buy more maize for reselling at a profit so as to earn an income. He rides a motorcycle and buys maize which he resells to earn an income.

Charles is married with four children and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house, buying a car and educating his children.

Charles is a member of a group called Kyamugarura Co-operative where each member guarantees the others for access to credit.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Jose Lazaro

texts.es:
El Sr. P. O. es un Transportista que vive en el municipio del Viejo, 
El Tiene un camión de Carga Pesada que lo trabaja con  el Ingenio Monte Rosa.
El va a utilizar el credito para mejorar su vivienda ya que necesita construir un cuarto en su casa porque su familia se le hizo más grande y ya no caben.
Este es el quinto credito que el Sr. P. tiene con CEPRODEL, lo cual todos los anteriores los ha cancelado bien.
El manifestó estar muy agradecido con la Institución por brindarle apoyo cuando el lo ha necesitado, y gracias a ello el ha podido desarrollarse económicamente en todas sus actividades.
texts.en:
Mr. P. O. is a truck driver and lives in the municipality of El Viejo. He has a large truck that he uses to work with Ingenio Monte Rosa.

He will use the loan to make housing improvements. He needs to build another room in his house because his family grew and they no longer fit. This is Mr. P.’s fifth loan with CEPRODEL and he has paid all of his previous loans correctly. He says that he is appreciative of the institution for providing him support when he has needed it and thanks to them, he has been able to grow financially.

loans.use: Housing improvements (building a room).

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard M. was managing the catering sector of the Bayou Baglery in New Orleans until 2005 when Hurricane Katrina hit the Louisiana coast. Bernard, his wife, Charlene, and his six boys were separated during the extreme chaos the city experienced during the storm’s immediate aftermath. Charlene and the boys evacuated on a truck reserved for women and children with Texas as its general destination while Bernard made his way to the closest airport. Among the many long lines of people going to different cities, Bernard chose to go to San Antonio because he had heard its mayor, Phil Hardberger, announce on CNN that the city had sufficient resources to take care of Hurricane Katrina evacuees. Because the cell phone towers had shut down, Bernard and Charlene had a difficult time getting in touch with each other. After two weeks, Bernard learned from his mother that Charlene and the boys were in the Astrodome in Houston. Bernard went to Houston, found his family, and took them back to San Antonio. The Bayou Baglery had been forced to close and Bernard did not have a job or home to return to in New Orleans. The McGraws decided to set down their roots in San Antonio and Bernard found a run-down shack on the Southside of town and set up a kitchen with a hot plate, a refrigerator, and a deep fryer from the flea market, and tables and chairs from Wal-mart. Soon after, Bernard realized that his make-shift restaurant needed to make several changes in order to meet permit standards. Also, in that short amount of time, Bernard developed an incredibly loyal and gracious clientele from the close-by military base. They raised money at the base to help Bernard make all the required repairs and to obtain various permits and licenses. Since 2007, Bernard’s Creole Kitchen has won the San Antonio Critic’s Choice Award, the Blue Plate Award and the Talk of the Town Award. 

Bernard studies Biblical Theology at the Baptist University of the Americas and has been asked by them to open his kitchen in their dining area. There will be a lunch line for a guaranteed amount of 85 students a day (plus additional students without meal plans who will pay cash) and a restaurant with a seating area for his regular customers. With this loan, Bernard plans to stock the restaurant with enough supplies to handle the increased amount of customers. Supplies will include food, new menus, salt and pepper shakers, a new register system, and a safe. 

In addition to going to school and managing his restaurant, Bernard still makes time to give back. Five years ago, he started a program called “Gumbo Under the Bridge” feeding homeless people. He says, “After being homeless, you never judge a homeless person again.” Last year, he also started a job-start program that he participated in at his own high school where students work at large companies and learn how to fill out job applications and to dress and act in a professional manner.

loans.use: New register system, new menus, salt and pepper shakers, a safe, food

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with two children:  One attends school, and the other one is too young for school. He owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his child.

For more than eight years, he has operated a vegetable stall, selling to his neighbors and passersby.  Bakari faces the challenge of fluctuating market prices for vegetables. He hopes to expand his stall in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to improve his business. With this KSh 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, fruit, tomatoes and onions to resell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Juana. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en la universidad, mientras que los menores que son mellizos están en la escuela. Su esposo es profesor de escuela. Ella en la actualidad está estudiando para ser licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación en una Universidad a distancia y esta trabajando como profesora contratada en una escuela de la localidad.

Se dedica además de profesora y ama de casa a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, les  vende a sus compañeras de trabajo y en las tardes visita a sus clientes que tiene. Ella deja a crédito y cobra los sabados o domingos cada semana.
 
Este crédito es para comprar: perfume, cremas, cosméticos y en especial productos de promoción. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta la unión del grupo. Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother for a Better Future) community bank meets in the 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province.  The area is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, its range of fauna and its hard-working people who farm and raise animals.

Here we find Juana.  She is 41 years old and married.  She has 4 children from her marriage.  The two eldest are already grown up and study at university whilst the younger two (who are twins) are in school.  Juana's husband is a school teacher.  Juana is currently studying a degree in Education Sciences from an open university and working as a teacher in a local school.

As well as being a teacher and housewife, Juana also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every morning selling to her work colleagues and in the afternoons she visits her customers.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payments every Saturday or Sunday.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and especially sale products.  Juana has been a member of her community bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes the cohesion of the group.  Her goals are to finish her studies and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and sale products

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu V. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Marichu is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods & beverages in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050045) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to build shelter for the borrower's livestock.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050045) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để xây chuồng cho gia súc của người vay.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn T. nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: Build shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia D. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Rosalia is married and has nine children. To make a living, Rosalia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalia wishes for her children to be successful.

Rosalia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to buy farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and one child in Lebanon. He has 13 years of experience in the concrete field. In 1999, he started to work as a freelance concrete carpenter. He provides the only financial support for his family. He previously obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some wood for his projects to make them stronger and well-built.

loans.use: To purchase some wood

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Sangaré est un homme marié de 37 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Doudounina de Bougouni.
Très tôt, monsieur Seydou Sangaré commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées qu’il a appris dès son jeune âge auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de plus de 15 ans, monsieur Seydou Sangaré maîtrise parfaitement son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise il décide de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des pièces détachées. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Sangare is a married man who is 37 years old and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and children at his father's house located in the quarter of Doudounina de Bougouni. 

From a very early age Mr. Seydou Sangare started revenue generating activities, especially the buying and selling of spare parts, a business he learned as a young boy from his uncle.  With an experience of 15 years, Mr. Seydou Sangare has perfectly mastered the domain.

In order to expand his business he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). His goal is to purchase spare parts. It is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He supplies himself in Bamako. 

With this loan he expects to earn a monthly income of 40 000 FCFA. 

Through this support he foresees expanding his business and securing the ability to provide for the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchas spare parts.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea R. is a hard-working man who always tries his best to earn money in order to help support the whole family. To earn a living, he often goes to the river near his community catch fresh fish, and he sells firewood also. He can make a profit of approximately $2.80 a day from this business. Chea R.'s  wife is a local farmer. This couple has given birth to six children, five of whom are single.  The other one is married and lives away from home. Chea R. is taking out his first loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming, on which he will grow different kinds of crops. In addition, he will rent his land to another farmer for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming, on which he will grow different kinds of crops.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad T. is from the village of Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns a business comes providing general services to local community members. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Natividad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mirtha Elena

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijo menor en la parte rural del caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande. Éste es una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Tiene su casa propia pero no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o luz.

Mirtha se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Además, cría cerdos. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro. Ella cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta al público en general en el mercado local diariamente. 

Mirtha desea invertir su crédito en la compra de alimento balanceado para que sus animales puedan lograr un mejor tamaño y peso. Desea lograr mejores ingresos para seguir apoyando su familia. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 42 year-old mother who lives with her husband and one dependent child in the rural part of Pueblo Libre village, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name.  It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Mirtha owns her own home but she doesn't have basic services such as water or light.

Mirtha's business is raising poultry such as turkey and hens.  She also raises pigs.  She has 5 years experience in this field.  She raises young animals and when they have reached an ideal size and weight she sells them to the general public daily in the local market.

Mirtha would like to invest her loan in buying balanced animal feed so that her animals can achieve a better size and weight.  She would like to make better profits so that she can continue supporting her family.  In order to achieve her goals, she is requesting a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Honorine

texts.en: Honorine is 36 years old and lives in the Chogohorou district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband Elias she looks after their five children.  For the past 10 years Honorine has run a general store selling items such as food and cooking oils. This is her third loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Ouando, a large local market. Her ambition is to purchase her own piece of land. She cites her courtesy and welcoming nature as her strongest attributes.

loans.use: to restock her general store

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Ngũ Nguyễn Thị (20203020048) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Ngũ is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông Thái - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


Ngũ is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Ngũ owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Ngũ has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ngũ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ngũ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase rice as raw material  needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Ngũ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  Trương Thị Huệ (0) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Trần Thị Hà (0) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  Đặng Thị C. (0) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ngũ Nguyễn Thị (20203020048) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Ngũ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên C. thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Đông Thái - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập C. của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ngũ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ngũ kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Ngũ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài C. giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ngũ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các tH.nh phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (0) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Trương Thị Huệ (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Trần Thị Hà (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Đặng Thị C. (0) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài C. vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & C. xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to  purchase rice as raw material

loans.name: Reyna Anita

texts.es:
La señora  Reyna Anita Jiménez R., es casada con el señor Manuel Díaz Díaz y con quien procreo cuatro hijas quienes  aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Gabriela Guadalupe de doce años, Sandra Isabel de nueve años, rebeca de Jesús  de cinco y las más pequeña es Ana Paola de dos meses.

     Su préstamo otorgado por fundación realidad lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes que es la primera vez que se dedica a esta actividad ya que desde muy joven practica lo que es el bordado de mantas que es con lo que ha estado trabajando hasta el momento.

     Comenta  que por su propia creatividad decidió  emprender el préstamo en la venta de abarrotes, para poder apoyar  a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar ya  no quiere que  a sus hijas le haga falta lo más necesario para su educación.

      Lo que más desea s mejorar su calidad de vida y con el préstamo trabajar para salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Anita Jiménez R. is married to Manuel Díaz Díaz.  They have four daughters who are still in their care: 12 year-old Gabriela Guadalupe, 9 year-old Sandra Isabel, 5 year-old Rebeca de Jesús and, their youngest, 2 month-old Ana Paola.

Reyna will invest her loan from Fundación Realidad in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store.  This is the first time that she has worked in this business as she has been embroidering blankets since she was very young.  Embroidering is the activity she has been engaged in up until now.

Reyna comments that she decided to use her loan to embark on selling groceries so that she could support her husband with their household expenses as she doesn't want her daughters to be missing what they most need for their education.

What Reyna would most like is to improve her quality of life and to use her loan to work so that she can get ahead in life together with her small family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans, Mme Adolé est mère de 03 enfants. Son mari est employé au port de Lomé. Elle a débuté son activité (vente de sucre riz et huile végétale) en 1991 et s’y donne avec joie. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend de façon ambulante à Adamavo, Kagomé et Adakpamé. C’est une fidele cliente de notre institution(WAGES) qui est à son treizième prêt. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter 03 sacs de sucre,02 sacs de riz et 02 bidons d’huile pour revendre à la population de Lomé et ses environs afin d’avoir de profit pour avoir tout d’abord sa boutique pour installer son étalage, s’assurer d’un avenir radieux de ses enfants et aider son mari dans les taches ménagères
texts.en:
Mme Adolé, 40, is the mother of three children. Her husband has a job at the port of Lomé. She began her little business selling sugar, rice, and vegetable oil, in 1991 and does this work with joy. She buys her supplies in Lomé and sells her wares on foot in Adamavo, Kagomé, and Adakpamé. 

She is a loyal client of our firm (WAGES) and is on her thirteenth loan. She is asking for this sum to buy three sacks of sugar, two sacks of rice, and two jerrycans of oil to sell to the population of Lomé and surrounding areas so that she can make enough profit to be able to set herself up in a little shop with shelving, ensure a bright future for her children, and help her husband with the family chores.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat, 29, is the treasurer of this group. Her husband works as a security guard in a bank. Together they bring up four daughters. The two older daughters study at school while the others are preschool age (under seven). To earn additional money to meet the family needs Aizat, together with her husband,  cultivates agricultural products. They own one hectare of land which can be used for growing potatoes. To realize their plans, the family needs additional financial funds. With the loan, Aizat will purchase 200 liters of fuel and four tons of potato seeds. In the future, she hopes to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and potato seeds

loans.name: Leouidas

texts.en: Leouidas is 24 years old, he is not yet married. He sells cattle and he has been selling cattle for the past 5 years. This business has enabled Leouidas to meet all his needs and improve his standards of living. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for sale and make more profits. With the profits together with his savings he plans to begin his family house construction.

loans.use: Buying cattle for sale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She has a candy-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her previous eight loans with NWTF.

Trinidad is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients to make candy. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 35 años, tiene más de 8 años en su negocio. Su actividad es la venta de cosméticos, con el paso del tiempo ha logrado comprender lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Ella sale todos los días muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche que regresa a su vivienda, Luz ha sido una mujer luchadora y triunfadora que ha logrado aprender a mejorar su actividad y brindar un medio de vida para los suyos. El crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, perfumes y ropa interior.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 35 years old.  She’s been in business for over 8 years.  She sells cosmetics.  As time has gone by, she’s managed to understand what her customers request.  She goes out daily starting very early at 7am and continues until 8pm when she returns home.  Luz has been a tenacious, successful woman who has learned how to improve her business and provide a means of support for her loved ones.  She will use the loan to buy lipstick, cream, beauty treatments, perfume and underwear.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 39, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram, a business she has had for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 35 year-old married man with one child, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has been in the transportation business for five years, amidst the challenges of bad roads and unstable fuel prices.   In spite of this, he longs to have at least three motorcycles, as the business is lucrative. 

Tadeo needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle.  His dream is to construct a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Wudha

texts.en:
Wudha is a 42-year-old divorced mother of three from the Negev. She has two businesses, a small grocery shop and seamstress services such as hemming and fixing clothes. She manages the two businesses and has learned the seasonal demand in both work well to ensure a constant income. Her clients come from her neighborhood and some from the surrounding areas.

Wudha needed this loan for both businesses to purchase shelves, stock for the grocery, a refrigerator, a sewing machine, and cloth.

Wudha wants to continue and expand her businesses and increase her income but her main goal is to ensure her children stay in school and study.

loans.use: To purchase shelves, stock for the market, a refrigerator, a sewing machine, and cloth.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Raquel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres rumbo al triunfo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años y no tiene hijos. Es una mujer muy activa que trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de Yogurt por las mañanas y en su negocio de venta de salchipapas, pollo broster y salchipan por las noches. Su esposo le apoyó en la compra de un carrito salchipapero y poco a poco fue incrementado sus ventas y ganando clientela quiénes son sus familiares, vecinos, y personas transeúntes. Cuenta el apoyo de su mamá y con ambas actividades podìa mejorar su calidad de vida.
Con este préstamo de PEN 2,000.00 Raquel comprará productos e ingredientes como papas por sacos, aceite por galones, paquetes de sal, carnes de pollo, verduras y condimentos; además utensilios de cocina, baldes, y cientos de envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio. Raquel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Su sueño es tener un negocio en su propia casa vendiendo sus productos y además dedicarse a otros negocios para mejorar económicamente. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos el brindar de la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo y así poder realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Raquel belongs to the “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” (Women Headed for Triumph II) Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martin. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has no children. Raquel is a very active woman who works mornings in an enterprise that makes yoghurt, then works evenings in her own business making kebabs. Her husband helped her buy a kebab cart, and little by little her sales  grew, as she gained customers, including her relatives, neighbors, and transient people. She counts on the help of her mother and by means of both activities, she has improved her quality of life.

With this loan of 2,000 new sols, Raquel will buy products and ingredients such as potatoes by the sack, oil by the gallon, packets of salt,  chicken, vegetables, condiments; and utensils for the kitchen, pails, and hundreds of disposable bottles she will use in her business.

Raquel is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business in her own home selling her products and, in addition, dedicating herself to other businesses to improve economically. She is very grateful to the Movimiento (Movement) Manuela Ramos for offering this opportunity to receive a loan and thus, to be able to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as salt and potatoes and kitchen utensils, to use  at her kebab-vending cart.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 34 years old and he is married with six children aged between 1 and 11 years old and he takes care of three relatives. He sells various goods such as juice, water, biscuits, lotions, sugar etc and he has ten years experience in this business. He works from 7am until 8pm every day except on Saturday and he currently employs two people to help him.

Jean Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as juice, water, biscuits, lotions, sugar, rice, salt, eggs etc for sale. Once his business is expanded, Claude hopes to reinvest in this business and save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as juice, water, biscuits, sugar etc for sale.

loans.name: Maria Karina

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo es encargado de la Estación de servicios. Ella es propietaria de una mini tienda donde vende bebidas, golosinas, comidas rápidas en general.  Comenzó con un pequeño negocio y luego poco a poco y gracias a su sacrificio pudo llegar hasta donde está hoy.
Ella comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella puede mantener la casa y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Dice que le gustaría seguir con su negocio ya que tiene muchas ventas y eso le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder tener todo en el caso de que algún cliente le pida algo.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is from the city of Santaní.  She is married and has three children.  She is the proprietor of a mini-store where she sells drinks, candy, and fast food in general.  She began with a small business and later, little by little, grew to where she is today, thanks to her self sacrifice.

She comments that thanks to this work, she can keep up her home and cover the expenses that arise in her home on a daily basis.  She says that she would like to be able to continue with this business as she has good sales and it generates a good income for her.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of drinks, candy and other things, with which she will be able to stock up her business.  In this way, she will have everything in her house for any customer, whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks and other things.

loans.name: Watheq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father of one child. He lives with eight family members.

Watheq has owned a market since 2002, selling foodstuffs, household items and accessories. He has more than seven years of experience, and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to add more products for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ishaka in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Dan has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Dan has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food supplies for the business and will help Dan to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Dan hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale business in town. 

Dan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Jovy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa cuenta con 48 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo el cual se  llama óscar él se encuentra estudiando 1º grado de preparatoria.

Ella es maestra y también se dedica al comercio vende comida en el mercado santa invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carne, etc. ahora solo espera que le ayude a mejorar su negocio ya que le gustaría que su negocio creciera y  establecer una local con una fonda para vender su comida.
texts.en:
Santa is 48 years old.  She is single and has one son called Óscar who is in his first year of high school.

Santa is a teacher and also has a business selling food in the market.  She will invest her loan in buying supplies for making her food such as oil, vegetables, meat, etc.  She hopes that this will help her to improve her business as she would like her business to grow and would like to set up a small restaurant where she can sell her food.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food such as oil, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Accionistas Group

texts.es: Gloria Elizabeth:D. 46 años D. edad,ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera nececidad(tienda)desD. hace 8 años ella venD. agua gaseosas,frijol,arroz.jabon.etc ella nos comenta que desD. que inicio su negocio poco a poco a agrandado mas su negocio,y lo a surtido mas, por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas productos D. primera nececidad, ya que su clientes le piden por mayor y ella no les cumple porque no tiene en su negocio,al igual que las siguientes socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas mercaderia para su venta.
texts.en:
Gloria Elizabeth, 46, has been selling basic household necessities (store) for eight years.  She sell water, sodas, beans, rice, soap, etc.  She tells us that since she began her business she has grown little by little and she has stocked it more.  This is why she is requesting this loan, to buy more necessities, since her customers request wholesale from her and she cannot fulfill their orders because she does not have it in her store.

For the same reason, the other member is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy essential food products.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 28 years old and married.  She is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Jona sells banana cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

Jona is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP,, which she will use to purchase raw materials need to make banana cue.  Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. Jona joined GDMPC for financial assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials  need to make banana cue

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: La señora Teofila se dedica a la preparación de masitas, como alfajores, pequeños pasteles, etc., para luego ponerlas a la venta. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser harina, azúcar, polvo de hornear, huevos, etc. Teofila tiene cuatro hijos los cuales no están a su cargo. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Teofila es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Teofila prepares baked treats, such as shortbread cookies and miniature pastries, and then sells them. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, and other products. Teofila has four children, but they are no longer under her care. She lives in a rented house in the District of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz.

Teofila has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and this is the second time that her request has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina es el nombre que lleva el grupo conformado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas se encuentran actualmente en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya. Formaron parte de este desafío por sus familias, ya que quieren darles lo mejor y un futuro sin privaciones.
Ignacia es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que se dedica a la venta de leche y tiene que llevar a las mesas de sus clientes su producto, para la hora del desayuno. Una de sus metas es tener una tienda grande donde ya no tenga que salir para vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más de su producto en stock, ella agradece por la oportunidad que le da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
