Santa Catalina is the name of this group composed of 12 women from the city of Paraguarí.  They are in the first cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women’s program.  They joined this program challenged by their families because they want to provide them with a better, privation-free future.

Ignacia is a hardworking, self-sacrificing woman.  She starts very early in the morning because she sells milk and has to bring her product to her customers’ tables in time for breakfast.  One of her goals is to have a large store so that she doesn’t have to go out to sell her wares any more.

She asks for the loan to buy milk in quantity so that she can have more available in stock.  She is grateful for the opportunity she gets from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy milk for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin tiene 18 años de edad y es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, él se dedica a la construcción de casas y obras. 

Franklin pertenece al banco comunal “Mercaditos de Patria” de la ciudad de Patria. Ya son varios años que trabaja con la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Patria de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Desde la ciudad del Cusco a nuestro destino hay una distancia de 200 Km. (aproximado nueve horas de viaje) hasta llegar a la localidad de Patria. Durante el viaje cruzaremos parte de la cordillera andina Peruana, observaremos hermosos valles interandinos, comunidades indígenas andinas quechuas y camino a la Reserva de Biosfera del Parque Nacional del Manu. 

En esta oportunidad Franklin requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo ladrillos, cementos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Franklin es comprarse una casa. 

Franklin agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Franklin, 18, is single and has no children.  He works in construction of houses and other projects.

Franklin belongs to the communal bank "Mercaditos de Patria" in the city of Patria.  He has worked with the Arariwa Association for many years and it has gone well for him.  The meetings of the members of the communal bank take place monthly in Patria in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco.  From the city of Cusco to Patria there is a distance of 200 Km. (approximately nine hours of travel).  During the trip we cross part of the Peruvian Andes and we see beautiful interandean valleys, Andean Quechuan indian communites and the trail to the Manu National Park Biosphere Reserve.

On this occasion, Franklin is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement and other items.  His dream is to buy a house.

Franklin is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as bricks, cement and other items.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en: Reem is a 43 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for clothes and blankets to sell.In the future she would like to open a shop and she wants to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Sope El Hadji Ibrahima Niasse Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Sope El Hadji Ibrahima Niasse, regroupe cinq femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui s’activent dans le commerce de divers. Elles ont une bonne connaissance de leur domaine d’activité. La responsable du groupe, madame Toutane, qui se trouve au milieu de la photo, le carnet à la main, s’active dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés. Elle compte parmi sa clientèle, les gens de son entourage qui sont réguliers et qui font même la commande avant qu’elle n’amène la marchandise.
Toutane est mariée et mère de famille et appui son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Elle veut diversifier son activité en vendant du poisson frais.

loans.use: acheter du poisson fumé et séché pour revendre

loans.name: Akoua Abotsi

texts.en:
Madam Akoua Abotsi K., a woman of 42 years old is a widower with seven (07) dependants of whom three (03) of her own children respectively 9 years old, 12 years old and 15 years old. Her main activity is dressmaking and her secondary activity is the trading of haberdashery items and clothes for women. The second activity tends to override the first one. Very courageous, she plays very well her role of household manager and takes care of her orphan children all in school. The expansion of her activities to new products needs a substantial capital which she does not have. From her experience, she has a high entrepreneurial capacity which allows her to take innovative initiatives and very ambitious steps to develop at her businesses. Her attitude of a honest and trustworthy woman are among others positive features for an efficient management of her businesses. In fact she conducted a good management and prompt payment of her first credits of $ 100, $ 200 and $ 450. This allows her to secure her children’s education and greater welfare for the family. The new credit of $ 750 she requested will help purchase loincloth and haberdashery items; financing madam K. Abotsi Akoua would not only an economic action but also a humanitarian one in favour of the orphans.

Madame K. Abotsi Akoua, âgée de 42 ans est veuve avec sept (07) personnes à sa charge dont trois de ses enfants âgés respectivement de 9 ans, de 12 et 15 ans. Elle exerce comme activité principale, la couture et comme activité secondaire, le commerce des articles de mercerie et des pagnes pour femme qui risque d’ailleurs de supplanter la première. Très courageuse, elle assume tant que mal sa responsabilité de mère de famille et survient aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins tous des élèves. L’extension de ses activités à ces deux nouveaux produits nécessitent la disponibilité d’un fonds de commerce assez consistant dont elle ne dispose pas. De par son expérience, elle a une forte capacité entrepreneuriale qui lui permet de prendre des initiatives innovatrices et très ambitieuses pour développer au mieux ses affaires. Son attitude d’une femme honnête et de confiance sont autant des atouts non négligeables pour une gestion efficace de ses affaires. La preuve en est la bonne gestion et le prompt remboursement de ses trois premiers crédits respectivement de $ 100, $200 et de $450 obtenus. Ce qui lui a permis de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et du mieux-être de la famille. Le crédit actuel de $ 750 sollicité servira à acheter des pagnes et les articles de mercerie. Financer Madame K. Abotsi Akoua serait non seulement un acte économique mais aussi humanitaire en faveur des orphelins.

loans.use: To purchase loincloth and haberdashery items

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi E. is a welder by training and a merchant in the prefecture of Yoto. He was born on December 4, 1976 in Vokoutimé (in Vo prefecture). In addition to two welding shops, he has a stall, where he sells school supplies and various other items. Married with two children and with five other people to provide for, he and his family live together in a warm and inviting home. To develop the business for his stall, he is requesting $700 of help in the form of a loan, which will allow him to augment his profits and his ability to finance himself.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Monsieur E. Komi est un soudeur de formation et commerçant dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est né le 04 décembre 1976 à Vokoutimé dans la préfecture de VO. Il a deux ateliers de soudure et une boutique dans laquelle il vend des articles scolaires et divers. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants avec cinq (05) personnes à charge, il vit dans une ambiance de chaleur totale dans la maison avec sa femme et ses enfants. Pour le développement de ses activités dans sa boutique, il demande une aide de $700 sous forme de crédit.. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter son rendement et sa capacité d’autofinancement.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia  lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a vegetable and fruit stall where she sells different fruits and vegetables. She fetches some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinach from local farmers near her residence. She wants to increase the quantity of the stock to overcome shortages. She is also planning to have cases for product hygiene and attractive display. This will make her product offering more attractive and therefore increase sales. To fulfill these requirements, she is in need of USD 400 to subsidize her capital.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables and fruits and to buy display case

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband teaches at a rural school of their community. She has opened a grocery store in her house and with the loan, she hopes to keep it well supplied.

Candelaria belongs to the group Primavera 1. She and Angelina Jiménez López, who also has a grocery store, make tamales (beef, chicken or veggies wrapped in corn husks) every weekend and go around their community, offering them from door to door. With the loan, Candelaria also hopes to be able to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

CANDELARIA TIENE 28 AÑOS , CASADA 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES MAESTRO EN UNA ESCUELA RURAL DE LA COMUNIDAD . ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA ABASTECER DE MERCADERIA SU TIENDA . ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO PRIMAVERA 1 JUNTO CON ANGELINA JIMENEZ L. QUE TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA PREPARA TAMALES ( HOJAS DE ELOTE RELLENAS DE CARNES, POLLO O VERDURAS) Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA EN SU COMUNIDAD .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA TAMBIEN COMPRAR MERCADERIA PARA SU LOCAL .

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Rosi

texts.en:
Rosi F. has been in business for more than 5 years now. When she first started her business, she did not have much equipment, but still managed to start with a little production. From the small amount of income she earned, she bought ingredients for her business, leaving her with only about $20 profit a week. With her years in business, she felt that she needed to increase her production in order for her to earn a good profit, but her problem was that she did not have enough equipment.

She joined SPBD and borrowed US$300 which she used to buy the biggest pot she could find for cooking her pork buns, and also a gas stove to replace the old kerosene stove that she didn’t like because it gave her buns a kerosene smell. She is now very happy with the improvements to her business and is now looking at expanding it by making banana chips to go together with her pork buns.

Rosi sells her products at their village primary school five days a week, and she is very favored by the students because she’s a very funny lady. She explained it’s her personality that’s marketing her business. She’s a sixty-year-old mother of three grown-up children, and her husband is an engineer. She is a very active lady who is willing to stay longer in the program.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking equipment and raw materials for the business

loans.name: Meherrem

texts.en: N. Meherrem is 51 years old and the father of 4 children. He is from the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan Armenian conflict territory  in West Azerbaijan. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city. He supports his family through his taxi driving business, which he started 14 years ago. Meherrem has had a lot of experience and is good driver, but this job is very hard because he does not own a car himself, and must rent one to run his business. Mehrrem has some money saved to invest in a car but he does not yet have enough. For this reason he would like to take out the $500 loan to purchase the car and to build a garage. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business further and providing well for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car, to build garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz has been in this business for 18 years. He is 23 years old, and lives in Khaladj village. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs in order to make more income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz B., wife of Abad Ali. I have lived all my life in Multan and I am a mother of one son who studies in grade three. My husband and I both create clothes. Now, we need a loan for our business and to start our own boutique. Currently, my husband works for someone for very low pay and now we need to start our own business. We both have a strong desire to educate our son so that he can find good employment for himself.

There are a few other women who need loans for their businesses and we guarantee each other's loans. Tasleem B. needs a loan for their scrap business. Kaneez B. needs loan for their fruits business. Abida B.'s husband also has a scrap business and needs a loan to improve it. Arshad B. intends to use a loan for her husband’s ice-cream manufacturing business.

loans.use: Start a boutique

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is fifty-three-years old and an experienced and clever entrepreneur.  She makes homemade deep-fried chicken, highly spiced sausage pork, and natural juices, which she sells in the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo.  Alina has been running her business for twelve years, and now her delicious fried food  is very famous and much loved in the community.
Alina is a trustworthy person.  A few months she obtained a loan from FSMA that she invested in her business. She needed funds to buy raw materials to keep preparing her food.  The entrepreneur made a prudent use of the loan, and she can repay on time.
Now, Alina is asking for a second loan to buy meat, fresh fruits, spices, plates and other goods to continue offering tasty food to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase goods to keep producing fried food for her clientele.

loans.name: Nyai Arsih

texts.en: Nyai, 40, is married to N. and has 4 children. They produce tempe (fermented soy) at their house. They boil soybeans, put them into plastic bags, and then they sell them the next day at the market, earning $50 a day. To add to their business capital they are asking for a loan of $100. As a member of MBK, she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Lidia Victoria

texts.en:
Lidia Victoria S. C. has a business selling chicken in the city of Pucallpa. Lidia wakes up at 1 a.m. go to a market and buy live chickens from farmers. She then takes her poultry to her stand were she prepares them to sell. She has been selling chicken for many years and has plenty of loyal customers.

Lidia is 40 years old, has 5 children and is happily married. She is happy to have the support of her husband, unlike many other working women in her neighborhood. She often works side by side with these women, who all save money so their children can have more opportunities than they had.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Lidia is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She would use the loan to buy more chicken each day.

loans.use: To buy more chicken on a daily basis

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with a 3-year-old child. She works as a supplier delivering crafts, such as mats and drums, to various shops in her locality. She started this business 2 years ago and now makes about $85 a month from her work.

In the past, Rose has taken a loan to help increase her work in order to supply more crafts to more shops. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose.

She is a member of the Subira Yaritfa Heri loan group. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand her business of supplying crafts

loans.name: Hanu Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanu W. was born on December 31, 1972 in Mission Tové. She is married. She sells rice and rice porridge in the district of Agoè.

Her business consists in selling rice during the mornings and rice porridge in the evenings. Her location next to a big bar called "BAR BKS" which attracts a lot of customers permits her a good turnover.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 6 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame W. Hanu est née le 31 décembre 1972 à Mission Tové. Elle est une femme mariée. Elle est revendeuse de riz et de bouillie dans le quartier d’Agoè.

Son activité consiste à faire la restauration du riz dans la matinée et faire celle de la bouillie le soir. Son lieu d’activité est situé à côté d’un grand bar dénommé « BAR BKS » qui accueille beaucoup de personnes ce qui lui permet de bien vendre.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter Six (6) sacs de riz.

loans.use:
Purchase of 6 sacks of rice

Achat de 6 sacs de riz

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es:
Ananías is a widow and has two grown children, both of whom are in the university. She has been a merchant for 10 years. She works all week in order to provide for her family; she is the only one who works since both of her children are studying.

Ananías owns a copetín. A copetín is a place people can go to eat and buy fast food, juices, and soft drinks. She is a dynamic and hardworking person and because of that she has a good customer base.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a variety of merchandise, which would allow her to increase her sales and income from sweets, soft drinks of several brands, natural juices, and mineral water, which are the types of merchandise most-requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ananías es viuda y tiene dos hijos mayores, todos estudian en la universidad. Ella es comerciante desde hace 10 años. Trabaja durante toda la semana para conseguir el sustento de sus hijos, ya que solo ella es la que trabaja; sus hijos se dedican a estudiar.

Ananias posee un copetín. Un copetín es donde la gente puede ir a comer y comprar comidas rápidas, jugos y gaseosas. Ella demuestra ser una persona dinámica, muy dedicada a sus actividades, y es por eso que tiene buena clientela formada.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías varias que le permitirían aumentar su venta y su ingreso como golosinas, gaseosas de distintas marcas, jugos naturales, y agua mineral que son las mercaderías más solicitadas por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, juices, and mineral water.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom Y. lives in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She sells Chinese noodles to the villagers. Her business is going well, so Mrs. Sarom Y. is asking for a loan to buy more noodles to cook for her customers.

She is a 48-year-old widow with four children; two children are teachers, and the others are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sarom Y. had a loan from Acleda Bank to build a house, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy more noodles to cook for her customers

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
Rolando is 38 and lives with his wife and 11 year old son. He has livestock, for a long time stock breeding has been his way of living. This activity takes all day, by taking care of his animals and when he goes to sell meat to the cities nearby.

He likes this activity because his animals are special and taking them out every morning is very important. Without a doubt, it’s difficult to take care of sheep at night, because wolves and other wild animals can attack the area where his animals are.

Rolando hopes to provide education to his beloved son, his major motivator in life, so that he can become a professional. He whishes to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of breeding sheep to improve the quality of his stock, so he can increase the price and be the farmer with the most demand and better products in the local community.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Rolando tiene 38 años, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 11 años. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, ya que desde siempre la ganadería fue su medio de trabajo, esta actividad que le toma todo el día, el atender y cuidar a sus animalitos y sobre todo cuando va a vender carne a los mercados de las ciudades cercanas.

Este trabajo le agrada porque sus animales son muy tiernos y salir con ellos todas las mañanas es muy especial, sin duda, es difícil cuidar a las ovejas durante la noche, ya que los lobos o otros animales salvajes atacan su corral de ganado.

Rolando tiene en su hijo, su mayor motivador en la vida, desea brindarle una educación con la cual logre ser profesional. El dinero de préstamo desea invertirlo en la compra de carneros de raza para mejorar sus ganados y elevar el precio, así ser el más solicitado y mejor ganadero en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase breeding sheep to improve the quality of his livestock.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 49 años. Ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de juguetería para fiestas infantiles, negocio al cual le dedica mucho tiempo, ya que es la única actividad que le produce ingresos.
Carmen cuenta que tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. A ella le preocupa la futura educación de sus hijos.
Ella quisiera expandir su negocio, para lo cual necesita un pequeño capital que le permita comprar en mayor volumen los productos que vende y tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old. She sells children's party toys and supplies and dedicates a lot of time to it as it's the only source of income she has. Carmen has two school-aged children and worries about their future education. She'd like to expand her business and needs some capital to be able to increase the volume of product that she sells and have an increased margin of gains.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products in order to increase stock

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia de Banco Comunal Sol y Luna, está separada de su esposo tiene 51 años y 4 hijos de 35, 30, 28 y 27 años. Haydee tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años ella vende ropa, al principio tenía un bazar en el mercado , después comenzó a vender en su casa y actualmente reparte la ropa que le piden de casa en casa.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para llevar a provincia. Desde que recibe los préstamos ha conseguido tener un capital , ha mejorado y ha surtido su negocio, porque ha podido comprar más mercadería Haydee sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado cerca de su casa.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the "Sol y Luna" [Sun and Moon] Community Bank. She is 51 years old, separated from her husband, and has four children, ages 35, 30, 28 and 27. Haydee has owned her business for 10 years. She sells clothing. Early on she had a sales stall at the market, but later began to make sales out of her home. Currently she takes orders and distributes to her clients' homes. Haydee needs a loan of 2,000 soles [about US$ 650], which she will invest in the purchase of clothing for sale in the surrounding province. Since she began receiving loans, Haydee has improved and has been able to purchase more merchandise to supply her business. Haydee dreams of having a sales post at the market near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for sale

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells yams, plastic containers, and coolers of different types and sizes. Omolara has been in this business for a long time. Omolara is 40 years old and married. She has 4 children. Omolara is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is asking for a loan of N100,000 ($825) to increase her inventory of yams, plastic containers, and coolers. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase yams, plastic containers, and coolers for resale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has lived in Barangay Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela since she was born. The place is relatively peaceful and a progressive village. Agriculture is the major source of income for most of the residents here. Most of the women are engaged in other businesses as alternative sources of income.

Rosario is married to Nolie and blessed with four children: Christian, 18 years old, 2nd year college; Chester, 16 years old, 4th year high school; Nolie Jr., 13 years old, 2nd year high school; and Nolie Rose, 11 years old, a fifth grader in elementary school. Her husband works in an electronic shop in Manila, but his salary is insufficient to provide all their needs.

In order to help her husband, Rosario started to raise chickens in their backyard. After 40 days, they sell the chickens to their neighbors and regular customers. Rosario has had her poultry business for two years, and she plans to expand it by purchasing 20 chicks. This will bring in more income and savings for her family. To fulfill her plan, she requests a loan of $200 (9, 000.00 PHP) which she plans to use to buy more chicks, and feed and medicine for her chickens.

Rosario acts as the mother and father of their four children because her husband works in Manila and only goes home once every four months to minimize travel expenses. Her fellow villagers know her as a dedicated businesswoman and a responsible mother. She will sacrifice a lot for the welfare of her children and for them to have good education.

loans.use: Buy more chickd, feed and medicine for the chickens

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Leonor R. le esta haciendo falta un cuarto para acondicionarlo para  baño, ella quiere que este junto a su casa ya que el actual esta retirado de la vivienda y, es muy complicado para ella y su familia en la temporada de invierno y de lluvias, ya que tiene un niño pequeño y no quiere que se le enferme.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra y llevar acabo lo más pronto posible la mejor que desean.
texts.en:
At Señora Leonor R.’s house, they are in need of a room which they can turn into a bathroom. She would like this room to be next to her house as the current bathroom is away from the house and it’s very complicated for her and her family in the Winter and rainy season as she has a small boy and doesn’t want him to get ill.

She is asking for a loan to purchase the construction material and labor to build this bathroom as soon and as well as possible.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buildin a bathroom next to her house

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children – a boy and a girl. She says currently, both of her children are in junior high school. Alima’s husband is a cocoa and maize farmer. She lives with her family in an old family house at Koforidua, near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official professions.

Alima is a nerchant. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy from her. She also sells in the local market and treks to nearby markets. Alima has been in business for two years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. Alima desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Eighteen people living in Toeuk Nim village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use their individual loan shares for various purposes. Mrs. Dok L., 27, is the president of the village bank. She is widowed and has two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other one is still too young to work or study. Mrs. Dok L. is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a plot of land. In her vegetable farming business, she faces an obstacle, because she does not have enough money to buy seeds for planting. Therefore, she will use her share of the loan to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable seeds

loans.name: Efraín Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, el señor Efraín B. se dedica con gran sacrificio a su actividad de ganadería que posee en su municipio el cual le sirve para mantener su núcleo familiar donde diario lleva el sustento.

La razón por la cual el señor Efrain ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la mejora de la finca y el hato ganadero ya que requiere invertir en ella para así continuar mejorando sus cultivos y su ganado. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así saldrá adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the area of San Rafael del Sur, señor Efraín B. is dedicated, with a lot of sacrifice, to raising livestock that he owns in the area, which lets him support his nuclear family and provide them with food every day. The reason that Efraín has turned to Ceprodel is to be benefitted with a credit to improve his farm and livestock herd. He needs to invest in it to continue improving his crops and livestock. He hopes very confidently that his credit will be offered satisfactorily so he can get ahead in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in agricultural activities

loans.name: Filbert

texts.en: Filbert Jimutumba runs a food shop in the Mnyamani ward in Dar es Salaam, in Tanzania. He sells different types of goods including cereal crop products such as wheat flour and maize flour, as well as peanuts, sugar, cashew nuts and cooking oil. He purchases some items from the wholesale shops, and others are purchased directly from the producers. He has been in this business for three years. He is requesting a loan of $625 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Losa

texts.en:
Losa M., 28, is married with 1 child. She has 3 years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~50 USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Losa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr: CHEIKH TIDIANE S. EST NE A THIES LE 30 SEPTEMBRE 1975.IL EST MARIE ET PERE D'UN ENFANT.IL EST MARCHAND AMBULANT ET EST SPECIALISE DANS LA VENTE D'HABITS. SA CIBLE EST CONSTITUEE DE JEUNES DE MOINS DE TRENTE ANS .AVEC CE PRET IL ENVISAGE D'AUGMENTER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT DANS LE BUT DE DIVERSIFIER SES MARCHANDISES.
texts.en:
Cheikh Tidiane S. was born in THIES on September 30, 1975. He is married and the father of one child. He is an itinerant merchant and specializes in selling clothing. He targets young people under the age of 30. With this loan, he envisions increasing his working capital with the goal of diversifying his merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his working capital

loans.name: Berita Marina

texts.es:
BERITA , pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” vive en el Jr. Pucallpa. Nº 651, teléfono 961605664,  tiene 35 años de edad, 03 hijos, y su esposo trabaja como empleado de una empresa maderera.

Inició el negocio de comidas por las tardes y noches, vende  juanes, tacacho,  pescado asado , chaufa (comidas de la región) y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, se compró una parrilla e insumos, y como vive en una zona muy concurrida el negocio le esta  salido muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/ 2,000 quiere mejorar y ampliar su local, comprará mesas, sillas,  platos al por mayor, insumos para su venta y todo lo necesario para que su negocio se vea muy bien y pueda atraer mas clientes.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene, y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Berita belongs to The Divine Ones cooperative bank. She lives on Pucallpa Street, is 35 years old, has 3 children, and her husband works for a lumber enterprise. She started out selling food during the afternoons and evenings. She sells juanes, tacacho, pescado asado, chaufa (all typical regional foods). With her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, she bought a grill and supplies. Since she lives in a busy community, her business has done quite well. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, she would like to improve and expand her location. She will buy tables, chairs, dishes at wholesale, and all the necessary items so that her business runs efficiently and draws more customers. She states that Manuela Ramos is the only institution she works with, due to the low interest rates they offer and how they help to facilitate the process of obtaining credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, disposable plates, and supplies.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad H. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 53 years old. Natividad is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business selling vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of vegetables. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Natividad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Jamil Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

Ayeshan baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and mirrors) for her barber shop.

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart.

Shamim baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies who all belong to a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Shamim baji is a very active lady. She takes care of her members. Her husband’s name is M. J. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for the over three years. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for his grocery shop.

Shamim baji is seated on the right side in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a member of the Nyamhanga borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 34 year old woman, who is married with three children. Her children are aged 17,10 and 6. She also cares for four other dependents.
 
Tabu started her own shop selling soap, sugar, salt, etc. 16 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings. 
 
This is Tabu’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her shop. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Tabu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
The older woman shown in the picture is Pov R., age 57, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for farming. Pov R. is a married woman who is devoted to her two children; one is single and the other one is married.

Pov R. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited years ago from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. Her husband works with her on the farm, and he is also a domestic carpenter. Pov R. will be using her loan to buy more fertilizer and some carpentry equipment to better support her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and some carpentry equipment

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en:
Honorato P. is 62 years old. Four of his six children are married already and his new purpose now is to give his two grandchildren a good future by providing them allowances when they attend school.

Honorato is a fisherman and fish is the bread and butter in their family. Currently he is in his 3rd loan in CEVI. He requested a loan because he needs to buy new fishing equipment. Some of the loan will also be used to start a business to augment their income. 

Honorato said CEVI is a great program because it helps a lot of people like him.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 23 year old woman, she is Married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 5 and 3 years old.

Anitha has  owned a clothing business selling kanga and vitenge for 6 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Anitha first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge.


With the additional profits she gains from this loan, Anitha hopes to save money ,pay school fess and expand her  business.

loans.use: To buy more vienge for sale

loans.name: Imoya

texts.en:
Imoya M. is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has one child, who does not go to school. Imoya is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for hire.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es: La señora Merlita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 41 y es madre de 02 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.Merlita, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Merlita, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Merlita belongs to the “La Libertad” communal bank, District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martín. She is married, 41 years old and mother of 2 children, who are already independent and are her great pride. Merlita is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life path. The desire to get ahead has given her good results, and today, with the business she manages, she is very content with her achievements. She began selling cosmetics of different lines such as Unique, Esika, Leonisa and Avon, a business in which she continues today. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, she will buy beauty products for her stock such as women’s and men’s perfumes, creams, pressed powders, lip pencils, and nail enamel, as well as another case to display her products. Merlita, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women to start a business and, with perseverance, will be able to reach their dreams. This is thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for helping her start her own business and other women to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS MARAVILLAS”  se encuentra ubicada en la parte alta D. Huaycan distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima, vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace unos 5 meses, la alcancía comunal esta  conformada por 9 socios quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades como: producción, comercio y  servicio, la cual esta representado por: 
Alejandra R., quien asume el cargo D. Tesorera, tiene 35 años, madre soltera con 1 hijo D. 9 años. Alejandra se dedica  a la venta D. abarrotes desD. hace 9 meses, tiene una pequeña bodega en casa, su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en surtir los productos D. su bodega, para  poder así  abastecer a sus clientes. También se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo desD. hace 3 meses, en el futuro anhela poder hacer crecer  su negocio.

María Santos, actualmente asume el cargo D. Secretaria, tiene 41 años, conviviente, con 4 hijos, Maria se dedica al negocio D. cerrajería y ventas D. productos D. ferretería desD. hace 10 años. Empezó en este negocio por la motivación D. su cuñado que la animo,  ya que por su zona no hay este tipo D. negocio, con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra D. artículos tanto para la cerrajería y ferretería.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Maravillas" is located in the high part of Huaycan, in the Ate district of the Lima region. This group has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 months. The communal bank is comprised of 9 members who perform different types of activities such as production, traD. and services. The group is represented by Alejandra R., who is the Treasurer. She is 35 years old, and is the mother of a 9 year-old son. Alejandra has been selling groceries for 9 months; she has a small store in her house. Her new loan will be used to invest in products for her store, so that she can meet the needs of her customers. In addition, for 3 months she has been selling beauty products through a catalog. In the future she aspires to be able to increase her business. Maria Santos, who currently holds the title of Secretary, is 41 and lives with a partner and their 4 children. For 10 years Maria has had a locksmith business where she also sells hardware products. She started this business with the encouragement of her brother-in-law, since this type of business did not exist in her area. With her current loan, she will invest in the purchase of items such as locks and hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao Y. E. is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children, two of whom are married. Her husband, Pum Vuthy, 55 years old, is a radio-telephone repairman.

Mao sells costume jewelry in the local market, earning around $8 each day. Her business is running smoothly and is profitable because she is particularly able to attract customers. 

To better satisfy her customers’ desires, Mao would like a loan from Kiva through Hattha Kaksekar Limited, a partner of Save the Children. With her loan she would acquire more costume jewelry to sell. Note: Mao Y. E. was busy at her business so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To acquire more costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
Ulises A. S., tiene la edad de 69 años, es casado, y tiene 1 hijo, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia a crecer como ganadero, ya que quiere el ganado para la cría.Tambien el se dedica a la agricultura. No es la primera vez don Ulises se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. 
El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda superarse como persona y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ulises A. S. is 69 years old, married, and has one child. His family is his highest priority. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cattle. Ulises wants to start raising cattle because he believes the livestock business will help his family grow as farmers. He also produces his own crops.

This is not the first time Don Ulises has received financing from FUDECOSUR. He says the loan committee has provided him much assistance and offered many services. Ulises hopes that his livestock project will grow and help him to develop as a person. This will enable him to provide a better future, an improved quality of life, and more financial stability for his family.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Varn

texts.en: Varn N., 48, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She grows and sells vegetables at the local market to earn approximately US$3 of profit every day while her husband is a laborer and earns US$3 per day as well. This couple has five children, two of who are students and three of who are garment factory workers. Varn N. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer so that her husband can help her transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en donde vende también verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Maria siembra papa y compra y vende quesos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas y cerveza.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Fraternidad Communal Bank. Maria is 38, married, and has four children. Maria has a grocery store in her house where she also sells vegetables, fruit, and meat. She does this everyday. Maria also plants potatoes and buys and sells cheese. Maria needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy gas and beer. Maria’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas and beer

loans.name: Kikonya B Kimuli Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty K. is a businesswoman of 30. She is married with five children, three of whom are going to school. She has had a retail shop business for four years so far. 

She is using the loan to add capital into her business, as in purchasing retail items such as soap, groundnuts, paraffin, salt, flour, sugar, matchboxes and so forth. She is a creative businesswoman whose future hope is to prosper in whatever she does.

loans.use: Purchasing retail items such as soap, groundnuts, paraffin, salt, flour, sugar, matchboxes and so forth

loans.name: Richard N.

texts.en:
Richard N. W. runs a timber business at Malanga centre, Busia district. He is 25 years of age, married and the father of two children. He started his business in 2008 after having been employed at a local sugar factory. He started his timber business as a source of income for his young family. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES to be used for increasing his stock of timber. His future plan is to guarantee education for his children and economic stability for his family.

loans.use: Increase timber stock.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito R. is from the village of Cutog Grande in Reina Mercedes, Isabela. He is 43 years old. Pedrito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito plants, harvests, and sells rice. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 15 years. He earns approximately 150,000 PHP on each crop and harvests a crop every six months.

In 2008, Pedrito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. This will be Pedrito's fourth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 38 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abbass has been working as a taxi driver since 1993. When he first started his business, he faced hard competition since there were a lot of other taxi drivers. However, he is a specialist because of his punctuality. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car, such as repainting it. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Abbass' previous loan also was used to repair his car. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia S. is 46 and married with 5 children (ages 11 - 20).  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Telesia has 3 years of experience in this business.  Telesia needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Telesia joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Telesia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Telesia S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Dul

texts.en: Mrs. Dul T., 45, lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. She currently stays at home to take care of the kids and help them do their homework. The family's income is contributed by Dul T.’s husband who appears in the photo. He is a construction foreman. He has a few employees to help him provide this service and he earns at least $8 a day. This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with two young children. One grown daughter works in the garment industry. Dul T. has been purchasing a house which is still not finished. It needs to be decorated. Because Dul T. doesn't have money, she decided to look for assistance from Kiva's field partner HKL.

loans.use: To decorate a house.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La Sra. Jacinta M. 36 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 17 años tiene 3 hijos una de 15 años, 12 años y otro de 8 años, todos viven con la misma.
Desde hace 5 años atrás empezó con el negocio de venta de regalos para mercería, lo cual gracias a su empeño y dedicación fue creciendo día a día, desde hace 1 año incorporo al negocio la venta de sabanas, frazadas y edredones. 
Con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir  sabanas, edredones y ropa de interior para las damas.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya Y Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacinta is 36 years old, married for 17 years, and has 3 children, ages 15, 12, and 8. All three children live with her. Five years ago she began a business selling gift notions, which, thanks to her efforts and dedication, has been growing day by day. Then a year ago, she expanded her merchandise to include sheets, blankets, and comforters. With the loan Jacinta solicits she wishes to acquire more sheets and comforters, and women's underwear. Jacinta expresses her thanks to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SELL (SHEETS, COMFORTERS, WOMEN'S UNDERWEAR, ETC.)

loans.name: Celestes Group
loans.use: Stocking merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma B. is from the village of Baluarte Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Irma is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Irma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Irma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Irma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Doña Siomara S. A., tiene 36 años casada con tres hijos, D. los cuales  están a su cargo, se dedica a la crianza D. pollos ponedoras  D. esta forma a trabajado  durante 5 años atrás, venD. todos los días  huevos y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital D. trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Son 6 señoras y 1 señor  que conforman el grupo   denominado “primavera”, las señoras D. dedican a diversas actividades productivas tales como: la crianza D. animales, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, venta D. verduras, venta D. carne, venta D. cerdos y la venta D. artesanía. En el lugar D. San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Sololá
texts.en:
Siomara S. A., 36, is married with three children, all dependents. She has raised laying hens for 5 years. Every day she sells eggs and with this obtains her daily sustenance. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase the volume of their sales. There are 6 women and 1 man in this group called "Primavera" ("Spring"). The ladies engage in various productive activities such as raising animals, selling daily consumables, selling food, selling meat, selling pigs and selling handicrafts. They are in San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Solola.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Guadalupanas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama guadalupanas porque en la sección en la que viven es “sección de Guadalupe” aparte de que son personas muy devotas. Está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 

Margarita D. es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 38, estudió hasta el 5 año de primaria,  es comerciante y ama de casa y tiene en total 2  hijos (1 mujer y 1 varon).  Ella se dedica a la venta de Tupperware que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en producto  Sus clientes son las señoras de la misma comunidad y poblados cercanos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar más producto. También espera poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida mejor y ayudar a su esposo.

Juana G. es otro integrante de este grupo. Tiene 28 años, estudió hasta el 6 año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujeres y 1 varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de  Bolsas y carteras que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía. Sus clientes son las maestras de la escuela y las señoras que van a la iglesia los domingos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta, quiere este crédito para invertir en mas bolsas   También espera poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
MARGARITA VENTA DE TUPPER
JUANA VENTA DE BOLSAS
RITA VENTA DE COSMETICOS
TRINIDAD VTA DE ABARROTES
MARIA CLAUDIA TAQUERIA
MARIA DEL CARMEN
LOURDES VENTA DE PLATA
MA INOCENTE VENTA DE PLASTICOS
MARTHA VENTA DE CALZADO
MARIA MERCEDES VENTA DE CERAMICA
texts.en:
This group is called "Guadalupanas" because they live in the "Sección de Guadalupe" neighborhood and are very devout people. This neighborhood is in Mexico State. The group is comprised of 10 members. Margarita is the president of the group. She is 38 years old, studied until the 5th grade of elementary school, is a businesswoman and housewife, and has two children (a girl and a boy). She works selling Tupperware, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy stock. Her clients are the women of her community and nearby towns. At the time of applying for this loan, she feels happy. She wants this loan in order to buy more stock. She also hopes to be able to offer her children a better life and to help her husband. Juana in another member of the group. She is 28 years old, studied until the 6th year of elementary school, is married and has two children (1 girl and 1 boy). She sells bags and purses, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise. Her customers are the teachers at the school and the women who go to the church on Sundays. At the time of requesting this loan, she is happy. She wants this loan to buy more bags. She also hopes to be able to help her husband with the school expenses for their children. The other members of the group are: Margarita - sells Tupperware Juana - sells bags Rita - sells cosmetics Trinidad - sells groceries Maria Claudia - runs a taqueria Maria Carmen Lourdes - sells silver Ma Inocente - sells plastic goods Martha - sells footware Maria Mercedes - sells ceramic goods

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more land to farm

loans.name: Anicita

texts.en:
Anicita V. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela Mis. Occ.. She is 54 years old. Anicita is married and has six grown-up children. To make a living, Anicita plants and harvests rice for sale. Anicita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anicita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anicita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2007 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Anicita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Anicita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss. Sreymom P. (shown in the photo with her widowed mother), age 27, is a hairdresser and lives in a village along National Road Number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is engaged and will get married soon.

Sreymon is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a computer, printer and card pressing machine for her fiancé to operate his invitation publishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer, printer and card pressing machine for her fiancé to operate his invitation publishing.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20206030025) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 4 adult -aged children. N. owns and operates a business making and selling food,  primarily dried goods, in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. N. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by N. from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị (20206030025) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teresa P. y la Sra. Aurelia Bogarín, quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas decidieron invitar a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18(Díez y Ocho) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
 Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas de todo tipo, tienen almacén, despensa, copetín, tienen huertas y comercializan sus propios productos. Venden artículos de limpieza, mercería, venden carbón, mandioca, bijouterie, etc. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa quien se dedica a la confección de ropas para damas y caballeros. 
Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace varios años y cuenta con buena cantidad de clientas quienes le solicitan las confecciones de acuerdo al modelo que cada uno elija.
Esta actividad es muy sacrificada ya que desgasta mucho la vista  nos comenta la señora  Teresa, pero es la profesión que elegí y es lo que sé hacer y hasta ahora con este trabajo pudo ayudar a su familia.
Ella aparte de los pedidos que recibe también confecciona prendas que ofrece a varias tiendas.
Actualmente desea confeccionar prendas de la temporada entrante y para ello solicita el préstamo para compra de telas  y otros accesorios que ella utiliza.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Teresa P. and Aurelia Bogarín who had approached the office of “Fundación Paraguaya” (Paraguay Foundation) to find out more about the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). The ladies decided to invite their neighborhood friends to become involved in group work in order to get ahead and improve their lifestyles. They are 18 humble, but hardworking women who must earn a daily living. They each run their business independently; businesses such as clothing sales, different types of food sales, general stores, and pantry stores. They also have crops and they sell their products. They sell cleaning products, general merchandise, charcoal, cassava, knickknacks, etc. Teresa, one of the members, and she makes men’s and ladies’ clothing. She’s been doing this for several years and she has a good number of customers who solicit her services, based on their needs. This is very hard work and it causes much eye strain, but Teresa tells us, “This is the profession I chose and this is what I know how to do.” She also says that this is how she is able to help her family. Aside from the orders she receives from her customers, she also makes clothing that she offers to various

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Maritza Amparo

texts.es: MARITZA AMPARO V.,Trabaja como  Responsable de Oficina en Relaciones Publica de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. ella tiene un hijoa su cargo y este se encuntra en edad escolar, ha trabajado nueve creditops con cepordel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maritza Amparo V. works as the public relations office manager at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (National University of Engineering).  She has a school-age son under her care.  She has had nine loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to make housing improvements.

loans.use: To make housing improvements (change the electric system in the house and plaster some of the walls).

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.en:
Mirian is twenty-one years old.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with family members in Pedregal Grande in the region of Piura.  This is an agricultural region.  The majority of the population are low income agricultural workers or farmers.

For the last two years Mirian has sold clothing and beauty products from her home.  She makes sales either by anticipating the demand or by sharing the company catalog with the potential buyer and taking orders.  She feels confident in her ongoing ability to anticipate her client’s needs and continue the business.

She is therefore requesting a ten month loan of 800 PEN in order to expand her inventory and fill the additional orders of her customers.  She has a number of loyal customers and she hopes to expand her clientele.

Mirian has one outstanding credit with another institution, which the credit analysis of Alternativa deems to be reasonable and within her ability to repay.  She has a good level of liquidity and business capital which she will use along with the new loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es:
El Joven  Pedro tiene la necesidad de superarce en la vida, el tabaja de dia y
estudia de noche quire terminar su preparatoria para asi poder entra a la univercidad
y terminar una carrera por eso solicito el prestamo a fundacion para comprar una computadora y asi poder hacer con mas facilidad sus tareas.
texts.en: Young Pedro would like to better himself in life.  He works by day and studies at night.  He wants to finish his sixth form (senior high school) studies so that he can go to university and complete a university course.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FVP so that he can buy a computer and thereby be able to do his homework with greater ease.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  G. is a single woman who lives in Prk. Malasbalas, Brgy. Orong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: pig fattening, buying and selling vegetables, charcoal sales, and retailing gasoline.  Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Gina G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her various business operations

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel Z. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old. Roel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roel provides repair services for cars, jeepneys and multi-purpose cabs to local community members. He is also engaged in planting and harvesting vegetables like onions. Roel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. Roel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Roel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Rukiri Tukore Group A-Ibanda

texts.en: 42 year old T. Gaudy has been relying on agriculture for subsistence for a decade now. Her business location is Nyamkiika-Rukiri-Ibanda It is a business she says she began after she sold off her cows. The happily married mother of 5 says this business generates her shillings 20,000 a week. She also has a retail shop which she runs on the side. With this loan, she says she is going purchase manure for her gardens. She envisions this will improve the fertility of her gardens as well as her yields.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her gardens

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov P., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Nov sells fruits and vegetables, earning an income of USD 3.3 per day, while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4.3 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 90 on other necessary expenses every month.

Nov is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, she would like to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-age children. He has owned a perfume and accessories shop since 1995. He cooperates with his wife who works in a clothing store to keep the family’s financial status at a good stage. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to improve his business by increasing his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a widowed woman with six children, two of whom attend school, while four have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a vegetable-stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a clothes shop, which contributes to her other source of income. Rukia faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mahasa Bee Keepers Group-Kyenjojo
