Louella has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Louella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Louella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Louella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. is from the village of Catarman. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Imelda raises livestock, primarily pigs. Imelda has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Imelda joined PMPC to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business.  Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and supplies.  This loan will be her 17th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 
--------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo habita en la comunidad La Garza el Coral,  trabaja como consejal de la Alcaldia del Coral desde hace un año, tiene 4 hijos: dos mayores de edad y dos que tiene a cargo, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los niños, solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita hacer cambio de zinc y hacer un anexo permitiendo de esta manera tener mejores comodidades en su casa de habitación y mejor comodidad para su linda familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien, don Wilfredo es un un hombre responsable y muy querido en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in the community La Garza el Coral. He has worked as a town councillor of la Alcaldia del Coral for one year. He has 4 children: 2 older ones and 2 in his care. His wife takes charge of the housework and care of the children. He is seeking his first loan from AFODENIC to invest in home improvements. He needs to change the zinc and make an annexe, in this way permitting better comfort in his house and better comfort for his beautiful family. His dream is that his children study to that they can have a good life. Don Wilfredo is a responsible man and much loved in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof and construct an annexe

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra María G. tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos el cual tiene desde hace cuatro años en el mercado central de Chinandega. Vende shampoo, gelatinas para el cabello, talco para bebes,jabones, entre otros.También ella vende otros productos como cuadernos, lápices y mochilas.

Es madre de un niño de tres años y su conyuge le ayuda a atender el negocio. La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de cosméticos para la venta. Es por esta razón que está solicitando el crédito para surtir sus estantes y también comprará los utiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices y mochilas.

Espera que el crédito sea otorgado para así invertirlo a lo inmediato en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra María G. B. has had a business in the Mercado for four years. She sells a little bit of everything: toys, shampoo, hair gel, baby powder, records, notebooks, pencils, backpacks, etc. She has a three-year-old son. Her partner helps her see to the business. She used to work in Costa Rica with her husband, and they decided to save up to start their own business like all the boy's family. Now, she has her own business. Thanks to the funding Ceprodel has given them, her inventory has grown quite a lot. She requested this funding because she needed to supply her business more and buy school supplies for the beginning of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Vibul

texts.en:
Mrs. Vibul N. is a 33 year old married woman who lives in Prey Mien village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Monoeun Meas, is a chicken seller.                    

Mrs. Vibul N. wants to take a loan of 1,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more chickens to support her husband's business. From this business activity, Mr. Monoeun Meas can earn a small income to improve the lives of his family members. This couple has two children, one of whom is a student in the public school while the youngest one is 3 years old. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran M. is 27 years old, married has one child. He works in a school as a teacher. Kamran started his small convenience store eight years ago when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cleaning items. With the loan Kamran expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal As this business is the main source of income, Kamran applied for 1600 AZN in case to expand it. His wish in life is to see his child as professional with prosperous businesses.

loans.use: purchase  more merchanise

loans.name: Foloi

texts.en:
Folo M. is 47 and married with 4 children (ages 9 - 22).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Folo has many years of experience in this business.  Folo needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Folo joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Folo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Folo M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 30, has been a cloth-sewing worker in the garment industry for years. The job is to generate money to resolve the financial crisis of her family. S. has a life partner in her husband who is 31 years of age and who drives a truck for a small firm. S. has two school-aged kids who are under her care.

S. needs a loan to build a restroom for her family to improve their hygiene. With any remaining cash from the loan she will buy a piece of land to cover the bad conditions surrounding her house.

From the loan, S. and her family will receive health and happiness.

loans.use: To build a restroom and buy a piece of land

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Marina es Enfermera  de profesión, ejerció su carrera hasta tener su segundo hijo,  dejo el trabajo para dedicarse a su familia, en sus momentos libres  estudio corte y confección  sin pensar que algún día eso  le serviría de mucho,  ella tiene un hermano que se dedica a la confección de canguros  es así que empieza a trabajar como costurera para ganarse un dinero extra , durante algún tiempo laboro y  es su hermano  quien la incentiva para que ponga su propio taller, ahora ella confecciona y vende  canguros por su propia cuenta reparte al por mayor a los mercados ,tiendas y negocios del rubro.Con sus ganancias ha logrado ayudar en  los estudios de sus hijos y también terminar la construcción de su casa ,su negocio marcha bien a pesar que hay épocas bajas y altas pero ella logra mantener a su clientela, actualmente su taller lo tiene en su propia casa para  mas adelante quiere tener un  lugar mas grande para comodidad de sus trabajadores y  poder producir mas  ya que su meta es exportar sus productos, la Sra. .Marina es tesorera del grupo “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA” que esta conformado por 11 socias todas amigas y vecinas del barrio donde viven,  el dinero desembolsado  lo usara para comprar los insumos que necesita  para  la  confección de canguros como telas, cierres, hilos  etc. Marina sabe que en un futuro su negocio crecerá y es para eso que trabaja  incansablemente.

*Marina es la que viste polo color fuccia
texts.en:
Marina is a nurse by profession and pursued her career until she had her second child. She decided to quit her job so that she could devote herself to her family. Marina began sewing in her free time with the idea that it might prove to be useful someday. Her brother manufactures toy kangaroos, so she began working for him as a seamstress to earn some extra money. During this time, she continued to work until her brother convinced her to open her own workshop. Now she manufactures and sells toys kangaroos on her own and sells them wholesale to markets, stores, and businesses in the area. With her earnings, Marina has been able to help with her children’s education and complete the construction of her house. Even though her business experiences highs and lows, she has been able to maintain her customer base. Her workshop is currently located in her home, but later on she wants to have a larger place where her employees can work comfortably. Her goal is export her products, so she wants to be able to produce more items.

Sra. Marina serves as the treasurer for the group “Trabajando en Armonia” (Working in Harmony), which consists of eleven members who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The money she will receive will be used to buy supplies for manufacturing toy kangaroos such as fabric, zippers, thread, and other items. Marina knows that her business will grow in the future, so she continues to work tirelessly.

*Marina is the woman in the photograph wearing a fuchsia blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying calves to be fattened

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. is from the village of Tumpagon,  Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Susan is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn D. A. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Kabungahan, Fabrica, Sagay City. She earns her living by selling flip-flops (an open type of outdoor footwear) and other footwear. Jenelyn’s husband, Renato, is a laborer and they have three children who are between 9 and 18 years old. The three children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Jenelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in selling flip-flops. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities. Jenelyn is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 was used to fund operations of her flip-flops business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,500 for her 19th loan which she intends to use in her business operations. Jenelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to proviD. them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret D., 29 years old and single, is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as dodo and okra and is requesting a loan to stock beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily L. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily runs a business venture in the food sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling food in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
T. T. N. is 28 years old and is married with two children who are going to school. She sells clothes in the market where she has a shop. She has had this job for many years.

Since 2009, T. T. N. has participated in SEDA and repaid her loans punctually. For this loan, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

T. T. N. is the leader of a eight-member loan group from SEDA. The other borrowers  in her group are:

Trung Q. N. is 25 years old and sells clothes in the market. He would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

Thao T. N. is 51 years old and would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry.

Dung T. T. is 44 years old and has a store. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.

Quat T. T. D. is 28 years old and sells clothes in the market. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

Nghia T. T. N. is 38 years old and is a seamstress. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy cloth.

Mai T. N. is 51 years old and wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed poultry.

Lan T. T. is 52 years old and wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is the mother of a daughter who is already married and lives at home. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual operation with which she has had great success. 

Chan S.’s daughter proposes to work as a laborer outside of the country through a private company but she needs to pay the service fee. Because she doesn’t have money, Chan S. decided to take out a loan to meet the requirement above. Any remaining cash, she will use towards growing rice crops.

loans.use: paying job placement fee; supporting farm

loans.name: Cao's Group

texts.en: O. Cao Thị (20206020006) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). O. is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month. In 2008, O. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. O. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 4th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị Lý (0) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Nguyễn Thị P. (0) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** O. Cao Thị (20206020006) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. O. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng nhân 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. O. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, O. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, O. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. O. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị Lý (0) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị P. (0) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Favio

texts.es: Favio es habitante de la colonia los Laureles, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos dos mayores que trabajan y ayudan a fortalecer la ecomomia familiar y dos menores que coloboran en los quehaceres del hogar; Favio labora en su pequeña parcela en actividades agricolas, siembra de cultivos de granos basicos y tuberculos, siendo su principal fuente de ingreso,  requiere de este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de pasto en su pequeña parcela y poder tener condiciones para menejar su pequeño inventario ganadero, espera ser beneficiaddo con KIVA, para hacer realidad su sueño y poder vivir  en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Favio lives in the Laureles neighborhood with his family that consists of his wife and 4 children. The two oldest are working and contribute to the family income, and the two youngest help with the household chores. Favio farms a small piece of land where he grows basic grains and tubers. Since this is his principal source of income, he needs financing so that he can plant grass on his small piece of land and have better conditions to handle his small herd of cattle. He hopes to receive a loan with KIVA so that he can realize his dream and to be able to live in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant grass

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es: La Sra. Olga María C.   ella es trabajadora activa del centro de salud Masa chapa  se desempeña  como Medico General, tiene quince años de trabajar para el Ministerio de Salud, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga María C. is employed as a Physician at the Masa Chapa Health Center.  She has worked for the Ministry of Health for fifteen years.  She has a school aged son.

She has had three loans with CEPRODEL that she has used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.  Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to her because they have made improved living conditions for her and her family possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: sand, cement, paving stones, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. is from the village of Canibunga Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2004, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 19th loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosas De Sajama Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. ROSAS DE SAJAMA inicia su ciclo Nº 2 en el Centro Focal de Cascada.  Esta asociación está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva tiene a la cabeza a la señora Magaly como presidenta.

La señora  Magaly es una mujer joven de 28  años de edad, casada, madre de dos niños. Este es su segundo ciclo en esta asociación.   Con respecto a su negocio ella y su pareja cuentan con los negocios de Servicio de Tornería y macrame. Este crédito será invertido en impulsar estos negocios,pues ellos son los que dan sustento a la famlia.
  
Desde hace cinco años trabaja con su esposo en la torneria y realiza el macrame, compra los materiales por mayor de la ciudad de La Paz y el servicio de torneria y su trabajo en macrame son realizados en el mismo domicilio.
El crédito solicitado de Bs. 2000.- le serviría para aumentar el capital de ambos negocios.
 Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: tienda de barrio, venta de libros, venta de mantas, venta de verduras,  Taller de torneria, servicio de taxi, venta de fruta, tejido, venta de comida.
texts.en:
The ROSAS DE SAJAMA communal bank is starting its second cycle in the Cascada Focal Center.  This bank has nine members, eight women and one man.  The governing board is headed by Magaly as group President.

Magaly, 28, is married and has two children.  This is her second cycle within this bank.  She and her husband have two businesses:  a metal shop and macramé.  This loan will be used for both businesses because they are what support the family.

For the last five years she has worked with her husband operating a lathe and making macramé; both businesses are home-based.

The requested, Bs.2000 loan, will serve to increase capital for both businesses.

With respect to the businesses of the other group members, they are: neighborhood grocery store, book sales, blanket sales, vegetable sales, metal (lathe) shop, taxi services, fruit sales, weaving, clothing sales

loans.use: Capital for the metal shop.

loans.name: Exuperia

texts.en:
"Exuperia F. is a 49 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Barangay Lagunde, Oslob, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP6,000. Exuperia is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Exuperia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay P., 25 years old, owns a small shop in the province of Kompong Chhnang where she sells soft drinks, plastic products, and food. She typically makes a profit of around US$ 2 per day to support her family expenses. She has been married for many years, but does not yet have children. Her husband earns a living by entering battery water for his neighbors and other villagers when their batteries run out of water. Lay P.’s husband’s business is progressing well.  He wants to increase his capital to buy equipment to support his work and to earn additional profit. Lay P. wishes to help her husband’s business plan, but she does not have enough funds. Lay P. would like to request a loan to help her husband buy equipment for his battery water services.

loans.use: To buy equipment for husband's battery water services.

loans.name: Grace Wairimu

texts.en:
Grace has been operating her restaurant business for the last three years in her town Ndunyu Njeru. She is a 41-year-old single mother with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from KADET. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase food  for her restaurant and to buy furniture.

In the future she hopes to be the owner of a chain of restaurants in Ndunyu Njeru and its surrounding area.

loans.use: To purchase more food for  her restaurant and to buy furniture.

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun T., 68, sells handmade brooms, earning an income of USD 3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. 

In a typical month, the family's expenses include USD 45 for food, USD 5 for electricity, and USD 40 for other necessities. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s son appears in the photograph because T. is not available.

loans.use: To repair the family's home

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex, de 21 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.Los años le han enseñado a este laborioso hombre  que el trabajo bien realizado brinda sus recompensa, es por eso que todos los días  desde muy temprano trabaja en sus chacras, para volverlas más productivas. Sus productos naturales los lleva a vender en las cooperativas de Pichanaki y los productores  le ofrecen un muy buen precio por su café. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus plantaciones de café, ya que es el producto que le genera su principal ingreso, lleva cinco años realizando esta actividad  y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y  siente que este crédito le ayudara mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad, además en  su banco comunal es un socio, muy responsable, por  lo cual se siente muy orgulloso.Alex tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  más abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alex is 21 years old and he is a very happy and hardworking young man. He lives in his own home and his greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Time has taught this hardworking man that a job well done brings its own rewards. And this is why he sets out in the very early morning to work the fields to make them more productive.

He takes his harvest to sell in the cooperatives in Pichanaki and the distributors give him very good prices for his coffee. What he most likes about his work is to harvest his coffee plants, especially because this product is his main source of income. He has five years in the business. The most difficult part of his work is to fumigate the plantation. 

In the future he plans on purchasing more land to expand his plantations. This is his first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He believes that this loan will greatly help him in the development of his business. As a member of his communal bank he is very responsible and it is a source of great personal pride. Alex plans to invest the five hundred nuevos soles in the purchase of more fertilizer and pesticides needed to improve his harvests.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Alihon

texts.ru: Розиков Алихон житель Вахдатского района. Ему 24 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр и интернет кафе. Он в основном занимается пополнением баланса мобильных телефонов и торговлей сим-карт. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит просит для покупки компьютера и сим-карт.
texts.en: Alihon R. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 24 years old, single.  He has a secondary education and provides a service.  Alihon has a dealer center and an internet cafe.  He is mainly involved in refilling mobile phone balances and selling SIM cards.  He has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a computer and SIM cards.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and SIM cards

loans.name: Gurragchaa

texts.en:
Gurragchaa is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent on his sister’s plot of land. Gurragchaa’s wife is a waitress at café. Two of the couple’s children attend the local secondary school and youngest daughter stays at home. 

For the past three years, Gurragchaa has operated a taxi service in city. During the day, he stays at home looking after his youngest daughter and taking the older children to and from school. In the evening, he starts his taxi service. Gurragchaa is a very hardworking person who is providing income to cover his family expenses as well as giving his children a good education and instilling good morals. 

Gurragchaa is requesting a loan to increase his working capital and to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to increasing working capital and purchase spare parts

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and beverages in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as canned goods and beverages, to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Zainab. She is single, and has one child aged 18 years. She has one additional dependent, the child of her friend. In 1987, Zainab established her foodstuffs business. She opens her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. Zainab has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan Le 3,000,000 to help her buy more foodstuffs for her business. In the future, Zainab plans to complete her building project. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Yisel

texts.es: Yisel es una mujer  que se adapta rápidamente a las circunstancias, elL. nació en el Cerro D. San Antonio en el departamento del Magdalena   y  tiene 21 años D. estar viviendo en Soledad en el departamento del Atlántico;  su cónyuge también es un trabajador independiente y aunque Yisel  tiene 10 años D. experiencia comercial, solo desD. hace  cinco años empezó en firme L. venta D.   refrescos y desD. hace más D. uno,  incursionó en L. comercialización D. cosméticos, perfumes, cremas desodorantes y joyas; ambos negocios que aun tienen un gran potencial D. crecimiento. Sus principales clientes están ubicados  en su barrio y en comunidades aledañas al lugar donD. habita. ElL. cuenta con una muy buena clienteL. a quienes les venD.  los fines D. semana hasta 20 cajas D. cervezas, así mismo, tiene un stock D. productos cosméticos y joyería,  gran parte D. ellos comprado en oferta para tener alternativas D. mejores precios para sus clientes y con esto compite en el mercado.  Yisel tiene actualmente un buen nivel D. ventas, que le ha permitido cubrir los gastos operativos del negocio y  parte D. los gastos familiares, sus estados financieros registran una utilidad y un margen D. contribución muy buenos. En su balance general, se destacan los rubros D. cuenta por cobrar y el D. inventario   constituidos primordialmente por los productos cosméticos, ya que en el negocio D. L. cerveza maneja  ventas en su gran mayoría  D. contado. En L. actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, financiamiento que aplicará a L. compra D. un botellero, una vitrina y también invertirá un poco en capital D. trabajo.
texts.en: Yisel is a woman who adapts quickly to the circumstances.  She was born in the mountain of San Antonio in the department of Magdalena, and for 21 years she has lived in Soledad in the department of Atlantico.  Her partner is also self-employed and even though Yisel has 10 years of sales experience, she only began her drink business 5 years ago, and one year ago she started selling cosmetics, perfumes, deodorant creams and jewelry.  Both business still have great potential for growth.  Her main customers live in her neighborhood and in communities nearby.  She has good clientele to whom she sells up to 20 cases of beer on the weekends.  She also has a stock of cosmetic products and jewelry, most of which she bought on sale so that she could offer her customers alternatives at better prices, and therefore be able to compete in the market.  Yisel currently has a good level of sales that has allowed her to cover operating costs and part of her family expenses.  Her financial statements show a profit and good margin of contribution.  On her general balance sheet, the outstanding accounts are highlighted along with inventory, mainly maD. up of the cosmetic products since the majority of beer sales are managed in cash.   Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan, money which she will use to buy a bottle holder, a glass showcase, and also to invest in some business capital.

loans.use: to buy a bottle holder and a glass showcase, and also to invest in some business capital

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a 54 year old married man, with six children living in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda.

He is solely responsible for looking after the family, and his dream is to educate them up to university level.  He has been farming for 20 years.   Bonefance needs the loan to grow onions.  He started by harvesting one sack per season, but he can now harvest ten sacks of onions in a season.  His major challenge is price fluctuation and his dream is to  become a large scale commercial farmer.

loans.use: To grow onions

loans.name: Aligda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aligda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y crianza de cerdos, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres; Ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, comenzó por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00pm, hasta la fecha se ha mantenido en el trabajo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres cerdos, estos son para criarlos y luego ponerlos a la venta, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y generar más ganancia.
Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, contar con esta fuente de ingreso ya que tiene que estar pendiente de los gastos de su hijo y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Aligda lives in El Transito in the Salvadoran "departamento" of San Miguel.  She operates a business raising and selling pigs.  She's a single mother with an 8-year old daughter.  She lives with her parents.  She has operated the business for 5 years.  She started it on her own initiative, working every day from 6:00am to 5:00pm, for all of that time.  
Aligda is applying for a loan so that she can buy three pigs.  She will raise them for sale.  The investment will help her to strengthen her business and increase her income.
Aligda's goal is to hold on to the business because the income it generates is her means for supporting her child and helping her parents.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel W. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Samuel has a business making bricks, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for firing the bricks, which he will then sell. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Samuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for firing bricks.

loans.name: Pau

texts.en:
For three years Paul has been running a barber shop as a primary business, and he also sells shoes as a secondary business in Mathere North, Nairobi. 

He is 21 years old, single and very hardworking. He earns a profit of KES. 8,000 per month.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000, with which he plans to buy more stock of shoes for sale.

In the future, he hopes to grow his businesses and become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Benjamin Meliton

texts.es:
Benjamín, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y una hija, sus cultivos son en maíz, maicillo, frijol y tabaco, tiene muchos años de estar realizando estos cultivos, aprendió cuando era joven al lado de su padre.
Él solicita un préstamo para el alquiler de cinco manzanas de terreno más todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra (abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes), ya que se dispone a realizar la siembra de maíz, maicillo, frijol, tabaco.
Este préstamo le ayudara a seguir realizando sus labores agrícolas, él tiene mucho entusiasmo por este oficio, ya que de la producción depende los ingresos para su familia y sostenibilidad del hogar.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a farmer who lives with his wife and daughter. His crops include corn, sorghum, beans, and tobacco. Benjamin has been growing these crops for many years. He learned to farm as a young man by working alongside his father.

The loan he is requesting will be used to rent five additional plots of land and to buy the necessary supplies for planting such as compost, insecticides, and fertilizers. These items will be used for planting corn, sorghum, beans, and tobacco.

This loan will help him continue with his farm work. He has great enthusiasm for this job because his family’s income and the maintenance of his home depend on his production.

loans.use: to pay the rent on five plots of land and to purchase compost, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anteneta

texts.en:
Anteneta is 51 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 8 children.

To earn a living, Anteneta sells a variety of products from her general store. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to purchase products for her general store. Anteneta has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Yoana

texts.es:
Yoana forma parte del banco comunal “Emprendedores Unidos Punto Com” perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago. 
Ella se dedica a vender ropa interior, como pantys, calcetas, camisetas, calzoncillos largos, entre otros, ubicándose con un puesto en una persa los fines de semana y durante las mañanas de los días de la semana vende en una feria libre. Además durante las tardes se dedica a vender empanadas congeladas afuera de los supermercados. Yoana se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 4 años, su marido la apoya y acompaña los fines de semana. Sus clientes son variados, ya que también ofrece y vende sus productos a sus cercanos.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago.
Yoana comenta que durante la temporada de invierno le va muy bien en su negocio, es por esto que durante la temporada de verano continua vendiendo los mismos productos. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa para su negocio.
Sus metas son establecer su negocio en un local comercial ubicado en un persa libre. 
Sus sueños son cambiar su vehículo particular por uno más moderno y grande, ya que le sirve para trasladar su mercadería. 
Yoana vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 20 años y 7 meses de edad.
Yoana está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que es una oportunidad para invertir en su negocio, además con las capacitaciones realizadas en las reuniones ha aprendido a registrar sus gastos y organizar mejor su negocio.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
Yoana is part of the “Emprendedores Unidos Punto Com” (Dot Com United Entrepreneurs) which belongs to the Estación Central commune in the city of Santiago.

She sells underwear like panties, stockings, t-shirts and long underwear, among others in a Persian-style bazaar on weekends and during mornings the rest of the week she sells at a street market.  Also, during the afternoon she sells frozen turnovers outside supermarkets.  Yoana has been in this line of work for four years.  Her husband supports her efforts and accompanies her on weekends.  Her customers are varied since she also sells her items to her neighbors.  She buys her merchandise from a distributor in the city of Santiago. Yoana comments that during winter she does very well in her business so she continues with it in summer selling the same products.  She will use the loan to buy clothes for her business.

Her goals are to establish a business in a commercial locale located in one of the Persian style bazaars.  Her dream is to exchange her car for a more modern and larger one since she uses it to transport her merchandise.

Yoana lives with her husband and two children who are 20 years and 7 months of age respectively.  Yoana is very happy and grateful for the loan Fondo Esperanza granted her because it’s an opportunity to invest in her business.  Also, she’s learned how to keep track of expenses and better organize her business through the training sessions that take place during the meetings.

Estación Central is a commune located in the central part of Santiago (capital of Chile) that owes its name to the Central Railroad Station dating back to 1887 and declared a National Monument in 1983.  At its beginning, this station in conjunction with the Mapocho Station was the entrance to the capital on the Valparaíso-Santiago routes as well as from the south of the country.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Victorina has a food shop that sells chicken and pork adobo and afritada. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for the dishes which she serves.

Victorina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the dishes which she serves

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 66 años de edad es una mujer casada y madre de 7 hijos en las edades de 30 a 37 años; ella se dedica al tradicional oficio de la confección de ropa en todas las líneas, pero principalmente uniformes y conjuntos para damas y pantalones. Desde el año 1995, inició con su hija su negocio con 10 máquinas, y su yerno se encargaba de la estrategia de mercadeo, logrando conseguir muchas empresa como clientes; durante 5 años, el desempeño de esta unidad de negocio  fue muy bueno,  pero su hija enviudó y Maria Cristina no pudo seguir de la misma manera,  porque su hija se dedicó a otras actividades, debido a la disminución de sus ventas. Hoy   Maria Cristina, cuenta con una máquina fileteadora y una industrial,  y aunque maneja  contratos con empresas y almacenes, el mercado es más doméstico y confecciona  uniformes, multiusos y ropa sobre medidas. Su meta más adelante es expandir su mercado y generar mejores ingresos, aunque su gran desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la Razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas y una máquina para hacer ojales, mejorando con esta inversión la terminación de su tarea productiva. Mientras Maria Cristina trabaja por el cumplimiento de su sueño, se esmera por  manejar una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 26%  y por lograr con su disciplina el logro de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina, 66, is a married woman with 7 sons and daughters from ages 30 to 37.  Her business is the traditional one of making all types of clothing, but mostly school uniforms and outfits for women, and pants.  Since 1995 when she began the business with her daughter with 10 sewing machines and her son-in-law who was in charge of marketing strategy, she has succeeded in getting a lot of business from customers.  For 5 years the results of this business were very good, but her daughter lost her husband  and Maria Cristina couldn't continue working the same way because her daughter got involved in other things, so her sales dropped.

Maria Cristina has an overlock sewing machine and an industrial machine, and although she handles contracts with businesses and department stores, her market is more domestic with the making of uniforms, multiuse clothing and items taken on order.

Her goal for the future is to expand the market and generate higher earnings, although her big problem is insufficient working capital to make it happen.  This is the reason she is requesting her first Kivaloan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy basic supplies and a buttonhole maker, improving with this investment the end product of her work.  While Maria Cristina works to fulfill her dream, she hopes to manage a profit of 26% on the sales and to succeed with her dreams by the discipline in her work.

loans.use: To buy basic supplies and a buttonhole maker

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is from the village Kveda Sakara, Zestaponi district. He is 49 years old and lives with his big family: wife Mary, two sons (24 and 21 years old), daughter-in-law and 2 twin granddaughter twin, 2 years old. 

Malkhaz works as a shepherd in the village. His elder son works as a driver and the younger one works in a security service company. Along with their jobs, all family members are involved in family agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 milk cows, 2 calves and 3 sheep. Mary produces approximately 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it at the Zestaponi open market. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 0.8 hectare of land where fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold in the same place, the Zestaponi open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 laris.

Malkhaz requested credit to purchase 1 milk cow and 5-6 sheep. After the purchase of additional domestic animals, they will be able to increase cheese production and sell on average 30-35% more cheese in the market. It will positively impact the income of the family. Malkaz and Mary plan to use the increase in income for purchasing additional household goods in order to improve family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and 5-6 sheep

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El joven Oscar es una persona muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de sus padres. Hace 6 años los padres de Oscar, cuentan con un negocio denominado “Estanquillo Sarai” en la que ofrece variedad de producto para el consumidor como lo son los refrescos, botanas, tortillas de maíz, leche y más. Este negocio es parte de la  fuente de ingreso que  tiene la familia, aparte la que  gana por maquiladora Oscar,  por lo que pide el apoyo para comprar mayor producto para surtir el negocio. De esta manera Oscar ayudara a sus padres con el negocio para que sea prosperado.
texts.en: Oscar is responsible and concerned with his parents' well-being. Six years ago his parents started a small grocery called Estanquillo Sarai. They sell a variety of products including beverages, snacks, corn tortillas, milk, and more. The business helps support the family, along with Oscar's earnings from working at a factory. Oscar will use the loan to purchase merchandise to supply the business. Oscar hopes to help his parents by making the business more prosperous.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for general store

loans.name: Togouna Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe TOGOUNA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les douze prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le  bois de chauffe, les  condiments alimentaires, les fruits et légumes etc. 
Madame KOROTOUMOU qui fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe de femmes de TOGOUNA est au milieu, la vanne d’oignon en main.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 cartons de cube Maggi, 25 kg de sel  de cuisine, 100 kg d’oignons, 3 paniers de choux pommés, 2 paniers de tomates fraiches, 2 paniers d’aubergines et 1 colis de divers autres condiments piments, ails, poudre de Sounbala, au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
KOROTOUMOU  effectue ses ventes au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes,en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.500 FCFA qui sera  utilisé  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et réinvestir  dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Togouna group are married women averaging 37 years of age, with three children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.

They are on their 13th loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the gaol of satisfying the needs of their customers. All 12 prior loans have been repaid without any issues. This group of women sells various  items such as heating wood, food condiments, fruits and vegetables etc.

Mrs. Kourotoumou, who is the one selling food condiments in this group, is in the middle of the photo holding a tray of onions.
She plans to use her loan to purchase three boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, 25 kg [55 lbs[ of table salt, 100 kg [220 lbs] of onions, three baskets of cabbage, two baskets of fresh tomatoes, two baskets of eggplants [aubergines] and one pack of various other condiments, such as garlic and Sounbala powder [a traditional West African condiment] at the Grand market of Sikasso and in the nearby villages.

Korotomou sells at the Grand market of Sikasso and out of her home, to a customer ase composed of both men and women, retail, for cash and often in credit.
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 45,500 which will be used to repay the loan with interest and contribute to the family budget, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Luz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: C 1904 Turwubake Group

texts.en:
Daphrose is 44 years old and married with six children, ages eight to eighteen years old. She also takes care of two people. She is the leader of this group which is called “TURWUBAKE” in the local language.  She is in the middle in the white dress. 

Daphrose sells animals like cows, small fish, chicken, etc., and she has been working for three years. She currently employs one person to help her, and her business is open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Daphrose and her group have requested a loan from the Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase many animals such as cows, small fish, chicken, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Daphrose and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses, and start saving for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase many animals such as cows, small fish, chicken, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has two children. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which serves hot, traditional Ugandan meals to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger restaurant and start an outside catering business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies

loans.name: Suwono

texts.en:
Suwono is a 36-year-old man who is married to Asiyah, a 36-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children namely: Muhammad, 6, attending first grade of Elementary School; Firas, 4, and Nirmala, 1. 

Suwono sells cakes such donuts, fried tofu, fried bananas, bread, etc. and instant cold beverages such as milk, juice, orange juice and “es cendol” (a kind of traditional beverage made of ice, melted palm sugar, doughy rice flour droplets and coconut milk).

He has been involved in this business since 1995. He operates the business in front of his house from 6 am to 10 pm. Most of his customers are senior high school and vocational school students as his residence is located near the schools. 

Suwono would like to add more cakes such as muffins and soybean cakes and also other beverages. Therefore, Suwono is seeking a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to implement his plan. He is expecting that TLM will be willing to provide him with the loan to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase cake ingredients and instant cold beverage mixes.

loans.name: Leopoldo Arcides

texts.es:
Leopoldo, nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo porque no cuenta con dinero para invertir en el negocio, actualmente comprara una vaca, dos terneros, ya que quiere aumentar el número de ganado en el corral, la compra le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones ganaderas, dándole la oportunidad de mejorar la producción de leche.
Las condiciones de vida de Leopoldo han mejorado, esto debido a las mejoras del negocio por los préstamos.
texts.en: Leopoldo is once again requesting a loan because he doesn’t have money to invest in the business.  This time he’ll buy a cow and two calves because he wants to increase his herd size.  The purchase will help him improve his cattle raising conditions giving him the opportunity to improve milk production.  Leopoldo’s living conditions have improved thanks to the business improvements the loans brought about.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two calves.

loans.name: Hilda Angelica

texts.es: La señora Hilda tiene un puesto  donde vende desayunos por las mañanas muy tempranos tiene para la venta de té y café, cerca un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Hilda es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. Hilda les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos como azúcar, café y te por mayor para la elaboración de sus desayunos, la cliente cuenta que con mas esfuerzo piensa que se puede crecer mas y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal.
texts.en:
Hilda has a stand where she sells breakfasts; she sell coffee and tea in one of the aisles of a very busy market in San Pedro which through dedication has gradually been attaining stability and solvency as well as popularity because she’s well known among the customers because Hilda serves them kindly.

He will use the money from the loan to buy ingredients like sugar, coffee and tea at wholesale to make the breakfasts.  She tells us that with more effort she believes she’ll be able to grow more and continue building assets for her and her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her coffee and tea stand.

loans.name: Maksudakhon

texts.ru:
Максудахон 61 год, замужем и воспитала четверых детей. Максудахон работает учителем  в местной школе и известна как принципиальный и взыскательный преподаватель.
К сожалению, зарплата учителей не является высокой, поэтому Максудахон решила  параллельно с основной деятельностью заняться своим бизнесом в торговле.  Использовав в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 20,000 сом , Максудахон приложила все усилия для развития деятельности  - она заготавливает и закупает у местного населения яблоки  для последующей перепродажи. Для этих целей, был построен специально герметизированный сарай, где при определенной температуре хранятся фрукты и приобретена машина для транспортировки на местный рынок. Это позволяет Максудахон получать прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом ежемесячно. 
 В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Максудахон обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 тонн яблок. Закуп товара позволит ей увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, Максудахон планирует построить еще один большой склад для хранения фруктов.
texts.en:
Maksudakhon is 61 years old, married and raised four children. Maksudakhon works at a local school and is known as a principled and demanding teacher.

Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is not high, so Maksudakhon decided in parallel with her main work to do a trade business. Using a sum of 20,000 Kyrgyz Som (KGS) as starting capital, Maksudakhon made every effort to develop the activities -- she harvest and purchases apples from the local population for resale. For these purposes, a specially sealed barn was built, where fruits are stored at a certain temperature and a car was purchased for transportation to the local market. This allows Maksudakhon to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 som. 

In order to further develop her business, Максудахон contacted the company Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy five tons of apples. Procurement of these goods will allow her to expand the number of customers and increase sales. In the future, Maksudakhon plans to build a large warehouse for storage of fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school while 1 is still too young for school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Everline has operated a food stall for the past 6 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 35,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, cooking fat, potatoes and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, cooking fat, potatoes and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She sells smoked fish at Enyinase near Elmina which she has done for 8 years. Her desire is to increase the quantity of smoked fish she sells. The loan will aid her desire of wanting to increase the fish business by buying more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Rosy Margot

texts.es:
Rosy Margot es una mujer muy dedicada, tiene  2 hijos a los cuales quiere demasiado cuyas edades comprenden entre 15 y 17 años, ellos cursan actualmente el quinto año de secundaria por cual Rosy está muy orgullosa de ellos, junto a ella esta su esposo, el cual se dedica a la minería y quien la apoya mucho y es su mano derecha en todo, Rosy vive en Camaná, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruyendo la industria del turismo en Camaná, y eliminando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas; y lo más impactante de  Camaná son sus playas las cuales son muy hermosas, como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Rosy  le gusta mucho es el  “Pescado Frito”. Rosy  solo estudio hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medio económicos adecuados, pero a ella le hubiera gustado estudiar Cosmetología.

Rosy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diariamente, atendiendo un promedio de 40 clientes aproximadamente, en un día puede ganar hasta S/. 50 pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 60, con lo cual le ayuda con los gastos adicionales del hogar, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio gracias a su trato amable hacia sus clientes y porque ofrece productos de buena calidad.

Actualmente esta mas que agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella va poder comprar más productos para ofrecer en su negocio y ya que es temporada navideña comprar productos navideños para ofrecer a sus clientes y tener mucho más variedad, ello mejorara su negocio dándole más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, también con estos ingresos podrá ahorrar más dinero para poder lograr su más grande sueño: “Mejorar su vivienda”
texts.en:
Rosy Margot is a very dedicated woman.  She has two children between the ages of 15 and 17 whom she loves much too much.  They are now in the fifth year of secondary school, and Rosy is very proud of them.  Her husband, a miner, lives with her.  He supports her a lot, and he is her right hand in everything.

Rosy lives in Camaná, an oasis on the other side of the long and dry Sechura desert, which dominates the coast in the southeastern part of Peru. Camaná has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru. Nevertheless, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the past decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroying the tourist industry in Camaná and costing many of the residents their jobs.

The result of unemployment is that it creates an atmosphere that is ready for microfinance.  Its beaches, which are beautiful, are Camaná’s most striking feature.  As it is well-known, Perú is known for having the most delicious food in the world.  One of the dishes that Rosy likes a lot is “Pescado Frito” (fried fish).

Rosy only went to school until the fourth year of secondary school because her parents did not have adequate finances.  However, she would have liked to study cosmetology.

Rosy sells groceries.  She devotes about ten hours a day to her business, waiting on an average of approximately 40 people.  In one day she is able to earn up to 50 soles.  However on a very good day she is able to earn 60 soles.  This helps her with the additional household expenses.  She believes that her business is going well for her thanks to her friendly treatment of the customers and because she offers good quality products.

She is currently more than pleased with the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy more products to offer in her business.  Because it is the Christmas season she will buy Christmas products to offer her customers.  She will have a much greater variety, and this will improve her business.  That will give her more income and improve her quality of life.  Also, with these earnings she will be able to save more money in order to fulfill her biggest dream:  Improving her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries and Christmas products).

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es una mujer de 51 años que tiene 6 hijos, actualmente vive solo con la menor de 11 años, debido  a que todos sus hijas ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas ganas de superación y hacer de su pequeño hija un bien profesional, como apoyo incondicional se encuentra su esposo que es comerciante en un Restaurant ubicado cerca de la playa de la ciudad de Mala.

Actualmente la señora Graciela trabaja un promedio de 12 horas diarias con la finalidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para el hogar y para poder comprar nuevos y mejores productos, su hija la apoya a diario, Graciela piensa que el motivo principal por el que tiene muchos clientes es el carisma y buen humor que tiene su hija para ayudarla en la tienda de abarrotes que tienen. Este negocio le permite generar un ingreso diario de S/.50, pero si hay mucho más público, ella puede lograr una venta de hasta S/.80, esta ganancia es obtenida porque atiende en promedio a 12 clientes diarios. Y por si no fuera poco ella ayuda a su esposo en la venta del restaurant que tienen solo los fines de semana, este esfuerzo les está permitiendo salir adelante.

Una de las debilidades que afronta actualmente Graciela es que no cuenta con un monto de dinero considerable para por generar la compra al por mayor de algunos abarrotes como  arroz, aceite, azúcar, gaseosas, dulces, etc. es por eso que desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla con un préstamo de S/.1,000.00 y así ella pueda comprar los abarrotes que necesita a un precio muy cómodo. Sabe que si ella hace buen uso del dinero podrá llegar a su meta, la misma que consiste en que su hija continúe estudiando y tener una nueva y mejor bodega.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 51-year-old woman who has six children.  She currently lives just with her youngest 11-year-old because all her other daughters are adults living independently.  She is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and see her young daughter become a good professional.  Her husband, who is a merchant at a restaurant located near the beach in the city of Mala, gives her unconditional support.

Currently, Graciela works on average 12 hours a day hoping to generate the necessary income for the home and to buy new and better products.  Her daughter helps her every day.  Graciela believes that the main reason why she has so many customers is the charisma and good humor her daughter has while helping her in the grocery store they have.  This business allows her to earn a daily income of 50 soles but if there is a lot of public she can earn up to 80 soles.  This profit is attained because she tends to an average of 12 customers daily.  If that weren’t enough, she helps her husband with the sales in the restaurant which they only have on weekends.  This effort has made it possible for them to get ahead.
