One of the weaknesses Graciela faces currently is that she does not have a considerable amount of capital available to be able to buy supplies like rice, oil, sugar, soft-drinks, candy, etc. at wholesale and this is why she’d like Kiva lenders to help her with a loan of 1,000 soles so that she can buy the groceries she needs at a more comfortable price.  She knows that if she makes good use of the money she’ll reach her goal which is that he daughter continues going to school and to have a new and better store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: G.s. Montes De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montes de los Olivos, está conformado por 2 emprendedoras que se unieron para apoyarse y motivarse una a otras, ellas son clientas de Fundación León 2000, en el cual son personas responsable y con deseo de salir adelante. Sofía que es una de las miembros del grupos su actividad es la venta de frijoles cosidos en el cual está solicitando financiamiento nuevamente para comprar capital trabajo para el negocio.
texts.en: The Montes de los Olivos support group is made up of 2 entrepreneurs who got together to support and motivate each other. They are clients of Fundación León 2000. They are responsible people who want to get ahead. Sofía is one of the members of the group. Her activity is selling cooked beans. She is asking for a loan again to buy working capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy working capital for the business.

loans.name: Angela Fiorella

texts.es:
Ángela es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Ángela se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Ángela trabaja como asistente administrativo en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ángela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda; de esta manera Ángela brindar un ambiente más seguro y adecuado, con mayor bienestar para ella y su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y junto a su familia desea poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Para realizar la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 70 years old. He is married and blessed with 4 children. 

He has had a dairy business for 25 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase another dairy cow for milk production surplus.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to harvest maize. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to supply more milk to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow for milk production surplus

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena V. is 39 years old and keeps a little coffee shop in Blagoevgrad. Many years she and her husband were unemployed.

Two years ago their friend borrowed them some money and they found this coffee shop. Now both Elena and her husband work in it and the coffee shop is the only income resource for the family.

Elena and her husband need a new coffee making machine so they apply for this $ 700 loan

loans.use: For a new coffee making machine

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie L., divorced with three children, began selling in 1998 with a beginning business capital of $100. She started selling many different kinds of women’s beauty products. Informed by a friend about HOPE’s microfinance program, Sophie joined a loan group and received her first loan in 2004.  She sells mainly kitchen utensils. Sophie is planning with a $700 loan to buy a freezer and increase her inventory of utensil sets as the demand for her products is high in the community. Sophie loves her business. Her hard work in her business helped her overcome the difficulty of her divorce.

loans.use: She wants to buy a freezer which will allow her to sell drinks and cream.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is a young entrepreneur with an enormous desire for self-improvement. She is the youngest of eight children. She completed her studies in design and worked only in temporary jobs. However, the need for income to cover expenses for herself and her parents, both of whom are retired, motivated her to start her own business. She has been offering web and graphic design services for a year.

At this time, Oralia needs a loan of $275 to acquire supplies for graphic design, as well as the purchase of design software that will allow her to perform higher-quality work in a shorter time. She promises to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part of Oralia’s success. She appreciates your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es una joven emprendedora con enormes deseos de superación, ella es la menor de ocho hijos y terminó su carrera de diseño y solo tenia trabajos temporales, pero la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de ella y de sus padres, que ambos son jubilados, la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio en el que ofrece sus servicios de diseño, páginas web y serigrafía desde hace un año.

En estos momentos, Oralia requiere de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compara de insumos de serigrafía y la compra de un software de diseño que le permita realizar un trabajo de mayor calidad y en menor tiempo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante de los logros de Oralia, ella agradece tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire supplies for graphic design and design software

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona and her husband have a dairy, producing cows’ milk which is sold through PIL Andina (an Industrialized Milk Plant). This business is their primary source of income. They support three children who are attending elementary school. Petrona lives in the Laja-Ninachiri community (an hour and a half outside of La Paz). They will use this loan to purchase a mid-size breed of milk cow to increase their milk production and to raise their level of income. This is their first loan with Impro, and the social and economic evaluation that has been done indicates that their project is viable.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona y esposo son productores de leche de vaca, la que es comercializada a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta actividad es su fuente principal de ingreso con que cuentan; tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos y están cursando el nivel primario de la escuela. Petrona vive en la Comunidad de Laja - Ninachiri (A una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo usara en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y así mejorar su nivel de ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada, tanto social como financiera, muestran que el proyecto que tiene es rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Mrs. Albertina C., divorced, mother of two daughters ages 5 and 7, lives in her house located in the Pasankeri area, on the west hillside of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Albertina works as an assistant for a micro-construction company in this city. She has been a customer of our institution since 2003, and with three previous loans she built a room, a bedroom and a bathroom, as well as the first part of a retaining wall, that will prevent any sliding problems with her house. The loan requested will be used for finishing the second stage of the cement and iron retaining walls. This is the fourth time that they are applying for a loan, and their socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably for new credit. For general information, building houses on the hillsides of the city presents sliding problems that require retaining walls. This is the result of the topography of the terrain in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Albertina C. es madre divorciada, vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus dos hijas de 7 y 5 años de edad; la señora Albertina trabaja como ayudante en una microempresa de construcción de nuestra ciudad. Es cliente antigua de nuestra institución desde el año 2003 y con los tres créditos anteriores realizó la construcción de una habitación, dormitorio, y un baño, así como la primera etapa de muro de contención que evitara problemas de deslizamiento en su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión en segunda etapa de los muros de contención de fierro y cemento. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Para vuestro conocimiento, en la ciudad de La Paz, la construcción de casas en las laderas de la ciudad presenta el problema de la necesidad de muros de contención para evitar posibles deslizamientos. Esto es así debido a la topografía de los terrenos en nuestra ciudad.

loans.use: Building a retaining wall

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena, 49, is a resident of Yombo Vituka. She has been in business for the past ten years. She sells used and new clothes in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam.

Her business always increases during the holiday seasons. She requests a loan of $325 to purchase clothing to sell to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en: Afolabi I. is a widow with 2 children. She is 50 years old. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is also a fashion designer. She has been in her business since 1996, and she is in need of a loan to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and materials for sewing.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to stock the store shelves.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 30-year-old trader who owns a small store in a village of the Imishli region. He has five years of experience in selling goods. He had a store prior but because of a very difficult financial situation in his family, he was forced to sell it. He has started this new business form nothing. He purchased his first consignment of goods from savings and now he requests 1200 USD to finish purchasing the remainder of goods such as spices and beverages. Hasan currently sells candies and tea.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as spices and beverages

loans.name: Uen

texts.en: Uen, 40, is the mother of 2 children. She sells traditional food called 'doclang' at her house, earning about $3 a day, while her husband, A., sells the food door-to-door around the villages and earns about $5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her food business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Banco Maranatha Group

texts.en:
Maria M. is a 44 year-old woman who lives with her husband, Israel, and her three children (ages: 19, 20, 22). She runs a small grocery store that provides staple items for her community such as rice, toilet paper, water, and candy. We asked Maria to tell us something about herself, and she told us that her favorite food is pork, and during her free time she loves going to church. She is a vivacious and active woman who is looking forward to the opportunity of improving her business and helping her children live better lives.

This will be the first loan for this bank of women, and they have already developed a strong community environment and interdependence. On behalf of these women and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for contributing to this loan!

loans.use: To purchase food staples and household goods.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz S. from Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of five: three daughters and two sons. My eldest daughter is 15 years old and studies in grade eight; the next to her is 11 years old and attends grade six. Then comes my nine-year-old son who studies in grade four. The daughter next to him is seven years old and studies in class one, while the youngest of all is too young to attend school. My husband is a welder and manufactures objects such as iron window frames and doors and I sew clothes for my neighborhood clients on order. I need to buy computerized sewing machines so that I can hire a few girls and thereby expand my business.

There are four other women who are also in need of loans and they are: Naseem R., who requires a loan for her vegetable business; Koser P., who runs a boutique; Shamim S., who will buy a dairy cow; and Ayesha K., who runs a canteen in a school.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the group's businesses and improve living standards

loans.name: Comité San Miguel Group

texts.es:
A group of women in the city of Luque decided to form a committee of female entrepreneurs with the goal of improving their lives. They hope to work hard for a better future so they named their group “Allied to Work.” Their name describes the hope of these women to improve the quality of their lives.

The members of the group are more than just partners, they are also very good friends. During this period, each member of the group has learned a lot and the group has overcome many difficulties. Currently the group consists of 16 members.

The women of the group are involved in diverse commercial activities such as: sale of fast food, clothing, medicinal herbs, cosmetics, lingerie, fruit, cell phone accessories, and candy. The loan will provide for the purchase of various products related to the aforementioned activities.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Un grupo de mujeres en la ciudad de Luque decidió formar un comité de mujeres emprendedoras con el objetivo de salir adelante. Con muchas ganas de trabajar duro por un futuro mejor se formo el comité “aliadas al trabajo”. Su nombre describe la esperanza de estas mujeres de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los integrantes del grupo estrecharon lazos de amistad, a parte de ser socias son muy buenas amigas. Durante este periodo cada integrante aprendió mucho y el grupo supero varias dificultades. Actualmente el comité esta conformado por 16 señoras.

Las señoras que conforman el comité se dedican a diversas actividades comerciales como por ejemplo: venta de comidas rápidas, ropas, hierbas medicinales, cosméticos, bijouterie, lencería, frutas, accesorios para celulares y golosinas. El dinero del préstamo será destinado a diversos productos relacionados con las actividades mencionadas.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, blouses, shorts, workout pants, women's underwear, oil, napkins, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, carrots, bananas, apples, oranges, pears, pineapples, caramels, suckers, cookies, gum, cases for cell phones, earphones, soft drinks, beer, etc.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom V. is widowed and works as a grocery-seller in a market in the Sangke Meanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. She has three children, two of whom are married. Mom would currently like to expand her business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$150 to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Mpenami's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Mpenami is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 4 and 22. She entered the clothing industry in 2007, and opened her own small store. Everyday, she works from 10:30 AM to 3:30 PM. On average, Mpenami can earn a monthly profit of $125 from her sales.

Mpenami now hopes for a loan that would enable her to purchase more clothing and more items for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling fish, charcoal, coconuts, cakes, and firewood.

loans.use: To increases her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for her store; also to buy vegetables and meat to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano A. was born in 1965 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Rano is engaged in commerce selling food products. She has been working in this business for 6 years.

Mrs. Rano A. has a stall in the local bazaar and she has a good assortment. Selling at prices that are very low, she has a lot of customers. Rano is applying to KIVA for financial support, in the form of a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, cuenta con 42 años de edad, él y su esposa de dedican a la chacra y su tres hijos también desarrollan la actividad de la agricultura. De padres agricultores, su única fuente de trabajo ha sido la chacra y lo será por siempre, nos dice. Su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan en el cultivo, siembran de 4 a 6 hectáreas de papa con la ayuda de los peones que contrata cada temporada. Aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana ya está en su chacra, también cultiva habas, maíz y arveja, pero en mayor cantidad, es la papa con la finalidad de comercializarla y de ello cubrir sus gastos, en cambio los otros productos son para su consumo personal. Le agrada mucho su labor, pero para que sea pareja y produzca buena cantidad, tiene que fumigar y abonar en las fechas exactas. En esta temporada están sembrando en grandes cantidades, con la ayuda del préstamo comprará unos toros para el arado, además de abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 42 years old. He and his wife are farmers, and their three children also work in agriculture. As his parents were farmers, his only source of income has always been farming and it will aways be farming. His wife and children help him in the harvest. He sows 4 to 6 hectares of potatoes with some hired help, on contract every season. At around 6a.m. he's already in his fields. He also sows fava beans, corn, and sweet peas, but the greatest in quantitiy is potatoes. He sells his potatoes to cover the expenses but his other products are for their own consumption. He loves his work, but for him to break even and to have a good quality crop, he needs to fumigate and fertilize at very precise dates. During this season they are sowing in great quantities, and with the help of this loan he will purchase a bull to help with the tilling. He will also purchase fertilizer for his fields.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bulls to help till the fields.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria owns a restaurant where she sells cooked food and has owned this business for a long time. Victoria is 48 years old and married with nine children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425 USD) to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. Victoria is a LAPO Microfinance client. Victoria says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Hawa A., a 26-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has two children, who are 2 and 4 years old, respectively.

Hawa has been running a cosmetic sales business since 2006. In particular, she sells women’s cosmetics. She works at her business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. By doing so, Hawa is able to earn approximately $300 per month from her business operations. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to buy more women's cosmetics for resale purposes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Hawa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normA. make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typicA. receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specificA., when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional women's cosmetics

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Antonia is 49 years old and married with two children. Antonia has a store in her home where she sells general dry goods and beer in bulk. She also distributes beer to stores in different districts (like Muyurina and Chacco). She works with her husband and one employee.

Antonia needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of building on a plot of land she owns so that she can open a chicken restaurant there, and hopes that her youngest son will finish his studies. 



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 
Antonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, cerveza al por mayor y también reparte la cerveza a las tiendas D. diferentes distritos como Muyurina, Chacco, actividad que realiza con su esposo y la ayuda D. un personal. 
Antonia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar. 
Los sueños D. Antonia son construir un local en el terreno que tiene para implementar una polleria y que su hijo menor culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Greetings from Vincent N. in Nyakabanda Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Vincent is 29 years old and still single.

Vincent operates a jewellery shop in town where he sells various sorts of jewellery such as finger rings, toe rings, necklaces, chains, earrings, bracelets, and much more. He employs 2 people in his business.

This Entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business by buying various pieces of fashion jewellery. This loan will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expand his jewelry business

loans.name: Khurhseed Faryad Masih Group

texts.en:
Khurhseed baji is a 49 years old married lady and has been a resident in the Ismail Nagar neighborhood of Lahore city, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband name is F. M. and he has a sanitary supply selling business. He runs a shop in the community and people come to him to buy sanitary supplies. Khursheed baji is the mother of eight children: seven sons and one daughter. Her elder son is an electrician. The next two work in a factory. The others are being educated at a school located near their house. Khurhseed baji is a very hardworking and caring lady. She sews clothes day and night to make a good income because her daughter is 22 years old and she wants to marry her off. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy electric tools for her elder son, so that he will be able to start a shop repairing electric items (fridge, television and sound system). 

Khurhseed baji is a loan group leader of some women of her locality. Irshad baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy henna (coloring for palms and feet) to sell. Bashiran baji and Tariq baji each want a loan to buy blankets to sell.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric tools to repair electric items

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc 27 ở Hưng Nguyên , Nghệ An. Gia đình chị có 2 con nhỏ và đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị là từ công sửa xe máy của chồng và từ chăn nuôi, làm ruộng của chị với thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 để mua thêm phụ tùng đầu tư cho cửa hàng sửa xe của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc is 27 yrs old and lives in Hung N., Nghe An. Her family has 2 children who are still in school. She joined TYM fund in 2007. Her family's income currently comes from her husband's motorbike repair shop, and from her business of raising animals and farming, with total income of 260 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to buy spare parts for her family's motorbike repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mponela

texts.en: Mponela S. is a married man who has a business in Tanzania. He runs a food shop at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of groceries including cereal crop products such as wheat flower and maize flower, as well as groundnuts (peanuts), beans, cashew nuts, cooking oil and sugar. He purchases his goods from wholesale shops and also directly from producers. Mponela meets his family's daily needs from his business income. He is requesting a loan of $775 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Bennah's Group

texts.en: A. Bennah is the leader of Luwayo group in Lugazi, where she has been a member for 9 years. She is one of the founding members of the group, with 8 years experience in her local brew making business. Her first loan was 50,000 shillings which she was able to invest in her current business to the extent that now it has grown to a profitable level. Bennah is a married mother with 1 child still in school as she cares for 3 dependents. Her success story is so much related to her continued hard work and good character. She still has a dream of expanding her business and also to be able to own a personal house. She has acquired a new plot of land and plans to have construction started on it. Bennah needs a new loan to be able to buy more materials for making her local brew.

loans.use: Buying more bananas and yeast for making local brew.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Thịnh Trần Thị owns and operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Thịnh is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has four adult children. Thịnh has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.
In 2002, Thịnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Thịnh has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Thịnh is now requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund.  Thịnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.
No. 237021186.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida R. manages a small piggery. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children. She sold ready-to-wear (RTW) products when she was younger, but stopped trading RTW and decided to raise pigs instead.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed. The loan will greatly help her grow her piggery business. She is also planning to venture to another line of business in the future to supplement her income.

CEVI has been providing financial services to the rural poor. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama is the group leader of the Fatama group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress her business, so they have requested a group loan of 40,000 afghani. 

Fatama wants a loan for her husband, who has a metal-working shop. Sabera wants a loan for her son, who is a taxi driver. Raema wants a loan for her husband, who has veil-selling shop. Salma wants a loan for the business of carpet weaving. They are very happy to have this lending process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Kimsreav

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreav S., 26, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Say, 29, were married in 2000 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both children are in primary school. The family lives a long National Road Number six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimsreav has been selling soft drink since she was married. Mr. Vannak Say is assisting his wife in the business and has been a house constructor for seven years as well. The couple is in the process of building their new house, but they don’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, Kimsreav is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to finish her house.

loans.use: To finish her house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is 26 years old and married with two children. She sells VCDs and electrical bulbs. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more VCDs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda S. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily preparing and selling banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José B. de 50 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapán en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, los cuales en sus tiempos libres colaboran con el negocio. Juan José posee un comedor y una tienda, él se dedica a tiempo completo a sus negocios, y es por esto que  desea mejorar las ganancias, puesto que es la única fuente de ingresos que el posee para sustentar de todo lo necesario a su familia. Juan solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar materia prima para la elaboración de la comida que comercializa, y así mismo desea aumentar los productos de su tienda, de manera que tenga muchos más que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Jose Beltran is 50 years old, lives in San Pedro Perulapán in the departments of Cuscatlán. He lives with his life partner and their three children, who help in the business in their free time. Juan Jose has a dining hall and a store. He works at his businesses full time and for this reason wants to increase his income. This is the only source of income for the support of all the requirements of his family. Juan is requesting a loan for the purpose of buying raw materials for the food that he will sell and also increase the inventory of products in his store, thus having more to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the production of food and supplies for his store.

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Lumwago borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 9 years old.

Rose has owned a shop business selling sods, salts,beans, rice for 12 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rose`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 TSh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Rose hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Maximeno

texts.en:
Maximeno F. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. He is 69 years old. Maximeno is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maximeno owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Maximeno has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maximeno joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximeno has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fish feeds. Maximeno is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Maximeno from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana,Cagayan. She is 59 years old, married and blessed with four children: Merlita 39, Frederick 38, Marites 36 years and Manuel 34 years old.  All of them are married and live in their separate homes. 

Dolores owns and operates a farming business and her crops are rice and bitter gourd that she sells in their village.  She has been in this business for over ten years.

Her need of financial assistance has encouraged Dolores to request a loan from the KIVA lenders for the amount of PHP22,000.  This loan will be used to pay for the labor of the farmers who will assist her with the farming and also to purchase farm equipment.  She hopes that through her income her business will improve and expand.

loans.use: To be used to pay for farm labor and equipment

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.en:
Aboubakar H. is 27 years old, single, and he takes care of one dependent who is 7 years old. Aboubakar lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Aboubakar is a true entrepreneur and has been operating his business successfully since 2004. He owns a house where he has sewn different models of clothes since 2004. His business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day and he employs two people in his business. 

Aboubakar is now requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more sewing machines as well as creating more jobs for more people, which will help him to increase the profit. Then, through that profit, he will be able to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines and equipment

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida J. of Tala, Caloocan City. She is 45 years old. Her husband Gerry, 48, is a carpenter. They have five children, one each in college, high school and grade school. The rest stay at home.

Zenaida is into a variety of business. She gets herself into anything that is in demand at the moment. But she indulges herself and makes more money on rag making. She buys scrap fabrics from neighboring garment factories and tediously sews each small piece to become round rags.

Zenaida said she feels like just playing with the fabric. She has been in this industry for more than a year now. She earns 18000 PHP a month.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only last year but is already impressed at how the cooperative takes care of its members. She has just finished repaying her 3rd loan with CCT. On her 4th cycle, she has applied for 10000 PHP to purchase more colorful fabric trimmings from the nearby factories.

Someday, she hopes to see her life literally improve from “rags to riches”.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap fabric trimmings for rag making.

loans.name: Viviana Janet

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Vive junto a su familia en el sector Ucupe, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica al comercio de patos. Compra patos, los cría y luego los vende a sus clientes. Este negocio es una fuente importante de sostenimiento familiar ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola. Hace poco compró algunos patos pequeños y ya los está empezando a alimentar para que su venta resulte exitosa. 

Viviana es muy entregada a su trabajo, pero los pocos ingresos que perciben no son suficientes para lograr todas sus metas, una de ellas es terminar de techar su casa, esta acción es urgente ya que la temporada de lluvias propias del verano se acerca, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella es una madre responsable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Viviana, 30, is married and the mother of two sons, 8 and 4 years old. She lives with her family in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, located 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold ducks for the last year. She buys ducklings, raises them, then sells them to her customers. This is an important source of income for her family since her husband works as a temporary agricultural laborer. A short while ago she bought a few ducklings and she has begun to feed them so that their sale will be successful. Viviana is very dedicated to her work but the small income earned is not enough for her to reach her goals, one of which is to finish roofing her house. This is an urgent need because the usual rainy Summer season is fast approaching. This is why she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time requesting a 500 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to offer her children a good education and to see her business grow. She is a responsible, very hard-working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building her roof.

loans.name: Tabitha Group

texts.en:
Josephine is thirty–eight years old. She is married and has three children in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coast in the western region of Ghana and the major occupation of the people in this area is fishing businesses.

Josephine is a fish monger. She makes income mainly from this business to support her family. She is the leader of a village trust bank group called Tabitha. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Djamela

texts.en: Djamela K. is 52 years old. She is divorced and has three adult children. Djamela has a grocery store where she sells foodstuffs of different types and tastes. She has been in this business for 14 years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Djamela is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Djamela is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Djamela reach all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing stock of food to sell

loans.name: Keki Group

texts.en:
Jambo from Tanzania!

This is Mariam S. and the Keki loan group. At Tujijenge Tanzania, the groups name themselves. "Keki" is the Kiswahili word for "cake"! Many words in Kiswahili have been borrowed from English and the spelling is changed to reflect the Tanzanian pronunciation. 

Mariam S., a member of the Keki group, is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages 5 and 2. She has been running a food shop ("duka" in Kiswahili) since last year. The shop is open from 6 am until 10 pm daily, and Mariam manages to make a profit of about $150 per month.

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. She would like to use it to purchase more food to sell in her shop, as well as to buy kanga and vitenge to add to her offerings. Kanga and vitenge are the colorful, patterned sarongs and fabrics worn by many Tanzanian women. Mariam believes that selling these fabrics in her store will greatly improve her business by attracting many new customers.

In the photo, Mariam is seated in the front row wearing the yellow-green dress (which happens to be tailored from vitenge cloth!). She is seated with the members of her group. They will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. The Keki group in Dar es Salaam thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: sarongs and fabrics and foodstocks for shop

loans.name: Carlos Benito

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada con una de sus hijas y su nieto. Carlos 
de dedica a la ventas,  en su bodega. El inicio el negocio con un capital pequeño obtenido 
a través de sus ahorros y créditos, el negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y hace 2 años 
comenzo con la  venta de pan teniendo buena acogida e incrementando sus ingresos. Carlos 
atiende el negocio de manera amable y amena lo que ha permitido fidelizar a sus 
clientes, Carlos viene apoyando a su hija en la educación de su nieto, ya que ella es 
madre soltera, el sueño de Carlos es que su hija pueda tener su casa propia y que su 
nieto tenga una mejor educación,por ello requiere el crédito para comprar su mercaderia e iniciar con la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 59, lives in a rented house with one of his daughters and his grandson. Carlos works in sales in his convenience store. He started the business with a small amount of money he had through savings and loans. He has had the business for three years. Two years ago he started selling bread. That was well received and increased his earnings. Carlos takes care of his business in a friendly and pleasant way. That has allowed him to gain loyal customers. Carlos is helping his daughter with the education of his grandson because she is a single mother. Carlos’s dream is that his daughter will be able to have her own house and that his grandson has a better education. To do so he needs a loan to buy merchandise and start off the school season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Claudia Abadia's Group

texts.en:
Claudia A. is from the village of Makawa. She is 65 years old. Claudia is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Claudia is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Claudia owns & operates a pig raising business.  Aside from pigs, Claudia also has other sources like snack vending & nipa hut making business. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claudia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase feed & other supplies and additional capital for nipa. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Claudia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies and additional capital for nipa

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 36-year-old married lady with two children. She owns and manages rental houses in Dandora Estate which is a low income area. She has been in business for the last sixteen years and her houses are normally very strategically placed due to the population. Her husband Simon is a businessman.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan. She had initially borrowed from another microfinance institution before joining Kadet.

Elizabeth plans to purchase scrap metals and plastic ware worth Ksh 10,000 and plastics worth Kshs 5,000 for resale.These scrap metals and plastics are used for recycling purposes and this will also enable her get more income to support herself and her family.

She hopes to venture further into real estate in the near future.

loans.use: purchase scrap metals and second-hand plastic ware

loans.name: Leutogi

texts.en:
Leutogi  A. is 42 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Leutogi  has 2 years of experience in this business.  Leutogi  needs a loan of WST $1250 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Leutogi  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leutogi 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Leutogi  A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Adolphus

texts.en:
Adolphus D. is a high school graduate who sells new mobile phones and prepaid phone cards. He sells from a small stand on a street in busy downtown Monrovia, Liberia's capital. With the 71,000 Liberian dollars from this individual loan from Kiva field partner LEAP, Adolphus plans to buy more unlocked GSM mobile phones to resell.

Adoplhus says he's had the business for three years now, and that business is fairly good, except towards the end of each month when potential customers run low on funds as they await payday.  He buys his phones from a Nigerian wholesaler, and says that one day he'd like to be able to import phones from China himself and sell them wholesale.

Adolphus is 32 years old and married. He has two sons, aged 3 and 10. His older son is in the 4th grade. Adolphus also helps to care for his sister.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and prepaid mobile phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Mariela tiene 29 años y tiene un hijo, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes, gallinas, etc. ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Su actividad económica complementaria es producir y vender queso. 

Mariela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo leche, sal y muchas cosas más que se necesitan para producir queso.    
 
Mariela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mariela, 29, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She has a son and they live in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is raising small farm animals like, pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, etc. She sells her products at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market; she also makes and sells cheese. Mariela is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and provide the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funding to buy cheese-making ingredients like, milk, salt and many other items. Mariela is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese-making ingredients.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 50 years old. Herminia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Herminia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to plant and harvest rice for sale. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Herminia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Mrs. Vivian S. B. is from the village of P1 Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Vivian is married and has five children -- three are grown up and two are teenagers. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a business making and selling snacks. She makes a snack called "Biko," which is a rice cake made from Malagkit rice. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her work. In 2007, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her family's riceland. The remaining amount will be used as additional capital for her Biko-making business. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. She will use some of the revenue to meet her family's basic needs, and save some for future use and house renovations. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing snack vending  (Biko, Malagkit rice cakes) business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 28 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 3½ years old. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Reuben is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for four years and has one employee. His product is milk which he sells to the tea estate. He also earns income from the sale of tea to the local market.

Reuben’s biggest challenges in farming are the constant fluctuation in milk prices and inadequate artificial insemination services.

Reuben has requested this Kes 45,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will assist him in meeting the basic needs of his family and in paying school fees for his children.

In five years time, Reuben hopes to acquire more quality dairy cows and build a dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: L. Marie est née en 1949 à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Marie vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DANSOU Avocè, Marie est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marie n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Marie mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, conserves, huile de palme) et du charbon de bois en détail à son domicile. Marie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marie exerce cette activité depuis vingt deux ans, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un troisième prêt pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marie L. was born in 1949 in Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. She has been living for some twenty years in Agblangandan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Married to Avocè Dansou, marie is the mother of two children, both of whom go to schol. Marie lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various family expenses jointly. Marie did not attend school. In order to provider for her own and her children’s needs, she retails sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, canned foods, palm oil) as well as charcoal out of her home. She stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for 22 years, and had previously obtained two credits from ALIDé, both duly repaid. Facing ever increasing customer demand, she is seeking a third loan in order to expand her activities and to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers etc) and charcoal

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon P. is 39 years old and is the group leader, having been selected by its four members located in Ampil Toek village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Thon P. is a farmer and she also is a vegetable seller who works very hard to support her four children. Her husband, Mr. Phouk Soun, is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family's living costs. For vegetable selling, Mrs. Thon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business activities. This couple has four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business activities.

loans.name: Jessie Leo

texts.en:
Jessie Leo J. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 19 years old. Jessie Leo is married and has one infant child. Jessie Leo owns  a business which provides motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jessie Leo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service and motorcycle maintenance. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jessie Leo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Hima Agahikaine Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
K. Bonefance, aged 43, is married and has a family of 4 children. He has been operating a retail shop from Munobwa trading centre, Kyenjojo for over 10 years. In his business, he trades in a variety of products such as commonly used household items like sugar, salt, soft drinks, sodas, water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. He does this business alongside his other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops in Uganda. His main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop. He find that his current stock cannot satisfy the customers demands. Therefore he is looking forward to increase stock in his business, when he gets this loan, and also to expand into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and to sustain his daily life needs and to further the educate of his children. 

K. Bonefance belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like sugar, salt, soft drinks like sodas, water, cooking oil and much more for resale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita M. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old and widowed, with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Clarita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Clarita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to build a shelter for her livestock. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.
texts.en: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.use: augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.name: Melba Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Melba S. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Secretaria del vice alcalde de dicho municipio donde tiene dos años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos de piso, cemento y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Ms. Melba S., a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, is currently working as secretary to the town's vice-mayor, a she has been working in this capacity for two years. This is the first loan she is requesting to Ceprodel: she will use it to buy flooring bricks and concrete and to pay workers to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy flooring bricks and concrete and to pay workers' wages.

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane C. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Daisy Jane is an employee in a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes primarily from accept encoding and printing services in the local community. Daisy Jane is just starting this business.

In 2010, Daisy Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital of her business. Daisy Jane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better services. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Daisy Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is a 17-year-old living in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. Single and with no children, for the past two years Teddy has operated a poultry and pig production business.

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase chickens and pigs. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees, and in the future hopes to become a businesswoman.

Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to become independent and responsible.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarem Y. (shown in the photo) has been running a grocery store at home for more than 10 years. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. 

Sarem asked for a Kiva loan one previous time already. She is now requesting another loan of $600 to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and to continue expanding her grocery store.

The family lives in a small village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and to continue expanding her grocery store.

loans.name: Djiwonou Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier adakpamé.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de produits génériques.  Elle s’approvisionne dans une pharmacie villageoise et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. En plus, elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 7 ans. L’objet du crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de nouveaux produits pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjo is married and has 3 children in her care. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Adakpamé area. To contribute to her household, she sells generic drugs. She gets her supplies at a village pharmacy and displays her various products in front of her house. She has run this business for 7 years. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy new products to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Alice Wangithi

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old, a widowed mother of three children. She lost her husband through a traffic accident in 2006. She has been operating her rice farm for eight years now with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

She is taking a third loan with KADET LTD and she intends to use the loan to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses.  She hopes to provide a higher level of education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses

loans.name: Baktybek

texts.en:
Baktybek C. is 29 years old, married and has three children. He was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in cultivating vegetables, which his family sold at the local market. After finishing school, Baktybek moved to the capital city Bishkek and started his business of reselling vegetables. Thanks to his wide experience in cultivating vegetables, he was able to open a selling point at the local market, which became known for its high quality products. With the starting capital of 5,000 KGS, he managed to earn about 15,000 KGS in a month.

Now Baktybek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods by purchasing garlic and cucumbers. With the revenues, he plans to open a second selling point with fruits and vegetables. In the future, he dreams of building a house for his family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sangaré  est un homme marié de 43 ans qui est un polygame vivant au village N’Tjinina,  dans une grande famille traditionnelle,  avec ses  six  enfants, préfecture de  Kolondièba,    troisième région administrative de la République du Mali. 
Moussa Sangaré fait l’achat vente de céréales de toutes sortes depuis maintenant deux ans.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt. Le premier a été bien remboursé. 
En ce moment où les céréales sont chères, Monsieur Sangaré fait ses achats à un prix très abordable. Pendant  la saison sèche  il vend ses articles aux revendeurs et consommateurs.
Il compte acheter, 10 tonnes de maïs  céréales à  Kolondièba auprès des producteurs et dans les villages environnants.     
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice bimestriel de 50.000FCFA.
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans la nourriture et dans les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Sangare is a 43-year old married man who is polygamous and who lives in the village of N'Tjinina. He lives in a large traditional family, including six children, in the prefecture of Kolondieba, the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 

Moussa Sangare's business has been to buy and sell cereal grains of all sorts for the past two years. In order to supplement his capital he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his second loan. The first loan was successfully repaid. 

At this moment when cereal grains are abundant, Mr. Sangare makes his purchases at a very affordable price. During the dry season he sells his product to retailers and to consumers. He plans on purchasing 10 tons of corn in Kolondieba from the producers in the surrounding villages. 

He expects to make a bimonthly profit of 50.000FCFA. The profits will be invested in the purchase of food and to pay for schooling fees.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael W. is married and has eight children. He has been working as a farmer for 20 years, producing goods such as bananas, avocados and milk for sale. The main challenges he faces in running his business are the cost of purchasing pesticides and the lack of rain.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES in order to drill for water, which will be used to irrigate his farm. 

In five years, he hopes to have expanded his business through the purchase of more dairy cows. 

With the potential increase in income from the loan, he hopes to further expand his farming business.

loans.use: To drill for irrigation water

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam M. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Mirriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mirriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the market. Mirriam has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mirriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mirriam is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mirriam from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
