Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years-old. Grace is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling home products such as plastic plates, trays, glasses, spoon and forks in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over one years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Grace joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a first loan from HSPFI in the amount of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as porcelain plates and mugs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as porcelain plates and mugs.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 45, single and has three children. Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest is 3. For the last 24 years, she has made a living by selling goats. She has applied for this loan to buy more goals to sell, and is very committed to continue expanding her business by reinvesting her profits in it.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson, de 37 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Irene de 25 años y sus 2 hijas Lizeth de 5 y Jenifer de 3 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas Gerson se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su café y plátano, productos que posteriormente cosechará para llevarlos a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que es su propio jefe, sin embargo el cuidar sus plantas de café de los insectos y el clima le resulta muy trabajoso. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gerson is 37 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 25 year-old Irene, and his two daughters, 5 year-old Lizeth and 3 year-old Jenifer, who are the main motivation behind all his efforts.

Every morning, Gerson takes great care in working his land and making it fertile since he knows that the quality of his coffee and bananas depends on it.  After he has harvested his crops, he takes them to sell in the market in the town of Pichanaki.  What Gerson most enjoys about his work is the great freedom that he has to work on his land since he is his own boss. Nevertheless, he considers the most difficult part of his work to be weeding his coffee plantations.  Over time, Gerson would like to buy new land, in order to increase his production.

This is Gerson's second loan from MFP and he feels capable of making all his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  He will use the 600 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa Q. is a 48-year-old married woman, who used to do her own house decoration. Her husband Ali and her children noticed that she is artistic and had a sense of creativity in doing that, so they encouraged her to start her own business.

Asmaa started 5 years ago, making beautiful baskets and painting frames at her house using straw and other materials. Over these five years she was able to gain more customers by word of mouth.

Since Asmaa’s business is growing, she applied for this loan so she can open her own independent store and to buy more materials to have more variety of products.

loans.use: to open her own independent store.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos, ella vende tirgo, cebada y maíz, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesusa, age 54, is married and has four children. She is a member of the communal bank  “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” located in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Jesusa divides her time between her daily activities with her business of selling dry products -- she sells wheat, barley, and corn. She sells them in the street, working from 8am until 6pm. Jesusa would like to expand her business of selling dry products. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase dry products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase dry products wholesale

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette M. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Rosette has a stationery shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Rosette has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more printing paper for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rosette hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more printing paper for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the village of Pahindong, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 31 años, reside en la localidad de Puente Capelo (selva central peruana). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Nilton, con quien convive desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas Tatiana y Jocelyn. Desde muy joven comenzó a producir la tierra, ya que la principal actividad económica del lugar es “la agricultura”. Pero desde hace 12 años viene sembrando de forma independiente café, palta y plátanos. Los cuales lo realizan con el apoyo de su esposo. Juntos todas las mañanas se dirigen a sus plantaciones donde limpian, podan y cosechan sus sembríos. Cuando ya están listos los comercializan a la señora Alicia, quien tiene un depósito en la localidad. Llevando así los frutos a diversos lugares del país. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte del día con su familia. Más le desagrada tener que ver los productos malogrados por las inclemencias del tiempo. Actualmente  empezará con la cosecha de café, pues con el dinero que obtenga en esta campaña podrá mejorar su casita y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de café” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elsa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café y plátanos de la variedad “isla”.
texts.en:
Elsa, 31, lives in Puente Capelo (in the Central Peruvian forest).  She lives with Nilton, her partner of 12 years.  They have two daughters, Tatiana and Jocelyn. She started farming at an early age, since "agriculture" is the main economic activity in the area.  But for the last 12 years, she and her husband have been farming coffee, avocados, and bananas independently. Every morning, they drive to their fields, where they clean, plant, and harvest their crops.  When the crops are ready, they sell them to Alicia, who has a depot in the area.  From there, their fruit is taken around the country.   What they like about the work is that they can be together as a family for most of the day.  But they hate seeing their crops ruined by the weather.  At the moment, they have begun the coffee harvest; they will use the money they get to improve their home and thereby give their children a better quality of life.  

Elsa is a member of the "Flor de café" community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She promises to pay her installments on time, as she has always done before.  She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and very friendly people,  She will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer to spread around her coffee plants and "island"-variety bananas.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and is 47 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and products for daily use, such as soap and shampoo, as well as instant noodles, cigarettes, soft drinks, condiments and eggs. Susan has had this business for five years. 

Susan is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods, and condiments to increase her sales.
In the future, Susan would like to increase her profit and be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods and condiments.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
EL señor Marvin José  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una empresa ubicada en Managua desempeñándose como analista de cartografía digital,  el señor es una persona responsable, honestos.
El señor solicito su crédito para hacer mejoras en su Vivienda,   para comprar materiales de construcción
Como verjas.
Las mejoras que   El señor va hacer es la instalación de verja para darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
   Manifiesta que con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado en ceprodel los va utilizar en hacer mejoras de su vivienda  y así mejoras las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marvin José lives in the city of Managua and works in a company located in Managua working as a digital map analyst. He is a responsible and honest person. He requested his loan to make improvements to his house and to buy construction materials such as gates. The improvements that he is going to make are the installation of the gate to give his house greater security. He states that, with the loan that Ceprodel has granted him, he is going to make improvements to his house and therefore improve the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lina has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Lina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 40 years-old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 22, 25 and 29.  

In 1999, Nirmala established her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La señora Rufina se dedica a la venta de comida específicamente sopa de pescado y su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil. Ambas activididades combinadas son la fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de papa, chuño y pescado, que son los ingredientes principales para su sopa de pescado. Es casada y no tiene hijos; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Rufina sells food, particularly fish soup, while her husband works as a masonry assistant. Both of these combined activities are the source of income by which they have to maintain their family. Rufina needs this loan to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish since these are the main ingredients used in preparing her fish soup. She is married and has no children. Rufina lives in her own home in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine earns a living through farming. She is 49 years old and married.

Josephine owns and tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where she and her family also live. Josephine primarily grows rice crops to sell. She said she wakes up early in the morning to attend to her farming duties. Josephine does her best to be a good wife and mother. She wants a happy family.

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necklaces, chains, bracelets, gold earrings and gold-plated jewelry.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a 67-year-old married woman with 8 children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Fe helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. She also raises pigs to fatten and sell. Fe works hard to help improve her family's living situation. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. Fe hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as silk and hemp thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Jean Damasene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children ages 2 and 5.

He  has been operating a well-organized business selling shoes for five years. It is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily, and he employs one person to help him. 

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. He plans to save for his family's future and to reinvest in his business with his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married to Philomena, and together they have one child. He distributes bread, and he raises livestock and poultry. He has been in the farming business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 from the business.


This is his first loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase animal feed and more poultry.


With the expected profit, he will rear pigs at his farm. His dream is to have a stable income to support his young family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, oil and instant soups.

loans.name: Tania Doris

texts.es: Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 27 años, tiene 1 hijo, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 3 años. Tania se dedica a L. venta D.  abarrotes, galletas y los reparte a las zonas D. Tambillo, Checco, YanamilL., con los créditos que L. Institución le otorgó lo invirtió en su negocio y gracias L. rentabilidad obtenida ahora tiene su panadería, le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseña a saber dirigir su negocio. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en L. compra D. insumos para hacer panteones y bolsas naviD.ñas. Su sueño es comprar su terreno y construir su casa y abrir su panadería en su local propio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Generosidad” (Generosity). She is 27 years old and has one child. Tania has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She sells groceries and cookies and distributes her products in the districts of Tambillo, Checco, and YanamilL.. With the loans from the organization, Tania has been able to invest in her business. Thanks to the profits she has earned, she now has a bakery. She enjoys the training seminars because they have taught her how to manage her business.

The loan she is requesting now will be used to buy supplies for making panettone and Christmas baskets. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house and operate her bakery from her own location. This will help her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making panettone and Christmas baskets.

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
 
Rizan has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Rizan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rizan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, tiene 42 años de edad, casada desde hace 16 años, tienen 3 hijos de 10, 12 y 15 años de edad, quienes están estudiando, vive en una aldea de  San Manuel, Cortes. Su esposo trabaja en empresa privada en área de mantenimiento.

Ana Julia, una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de vender mercadería nueva como camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y trajes. Anteriormente, trabajaba en una empresa privada pero decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa porque obtiene mejores ingresos. 

Inicio su negocio con fondos propios, lleva  dos prestamos solicitados a ODEF para incrementar su inventario, con el préstamo actual va surtir mas de ropa como blusas, faldas, jeans, pantalones y ropa para niños. Ella vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante.

Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el mercado de  San Pedro Sula, donde incrementaría sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 42 years old. She has been married since the age of 16. She has 3 kids that are 10, 12 and 15 years old who are in school. She lives in a neighborhood called San Manuel Cortes. Her husband works in maintenance for a private company  

Ana Julia is a very hard working woman. She has been selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans and pants for 15 years. Before that she worked for a private company but decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing because she receives a better income. 

She began her business with her own capital. She has received two loans from ODEF to increase her business inventory. With this loan she will obtain more clothing such as blouses, skirts, jeans, pants and clothing for children. She sells from her home and also door to door. 

Her dream is to open a store in the market of San Pedro Sula where she could increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy new clothes for her store such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and has five children. She sells pepper at Eyinase. She has been selling pepper for the past six years now. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more pepper for sale. 

With the new profit, Ama will buy pepper in sacks for resale.

loans.use: to buy more pepper for resale.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is from Calabayan, Ozamis City.  She is a 28 years old widow and has four children. 

To make a living, Jonalyn runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in her local community.  Jonalyn has been in business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Jonalyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, to purchase new items to expand product offering.  

In 2007, Jonalyn joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el Distrito de San Juan Bautista, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años y todo este tiempo pudo aprender cosas que le ayudaron en su vida personal como en su negocio, gracias a Finca pudo educar a sus hijos y criarlos de una buena manera, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad son valores que aprendió por la capacitaciones que le brindaron, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella communal bank. She makes a living selling vegetables and fruits in the District of San Juan Bautista. She has been a member of Finca Perú for five years, and during this time she has learned things that have helped her both in her personal life and in her business. 
Thanks to Finca she could educate her children and raise them well. She learned the value of responsibility and punctuality through the training they offered. 

She will put this loan towards the purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo que está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Yesenia que tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años en su domicilio, tiene 22 años y es una mujer soltera, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de inventario de pulpería como granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Rosa vende pan y repostería ambulante y María de Jesús mercadería en general.
texts.en: This communal bank is made up of three members, one of whom is Yesenia.  She has had a small grocery in her home for 10 years.  She is 22 years old and single.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of inventory for her grocery, like basic grains, such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oils, dairy products, beef, chicken etc.  Among the other two members, Rosa sells bread and pastries as a street vendor and María de Jesús sells general merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of grains, like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken and dairy products.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is 25 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

This is Thủy's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women 

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well and to be able to maintain it, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Mitoumide Group

texts.fr: MITOUMIDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Marguerite n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marguerite  est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Théophile. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marguerite et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marguerite vend des boules d'akassa(pâte de maïs fermenté) et des bouteilles vides de façon ambulante depuis une vingtaine d'années, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MITOUMIDE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et des bouteilles vides.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
For 15 years Maria had made ends meet with her job as a seamstress but about 8 months ago she decided to venture into a new line of business. Maria saw a great opportunity in her community to open a phone center, where the locals could go to her phone booths and make calls. This is a particularly good business in these sectors of Guayaquil because people cannot afford to install phone lines in their homes. Therefore, these phone call centers are very popular throughout Guayaquil, especially because they also offer the ability to make international calls to family members who are overseas which can be very expensive, even for those who do have phone lines.

Maria’s husband has been extremely supportive in this new venture. They slowly accumulated their savings in order to buy the substantial start up investments necessary to launch this business. Maria now wants to put in two computers that have internet connections. Before she can do this she has to add a gate to her entrance and put in an alarm system in order to deter criminals from robbing her.

Maria has four children, one of which works at the business at night. Their family ties are very strong and they all do their part to help the business. Maria’s goals include continuing to improve her house which she always tries to keep up.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in security for her phone call center and possibly put in a computer with internet access

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Kossi M. is married to a woman who is a farmer like he is. His wife only draws a meager income from her work. In his household are three people, including two children, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, something he had formal training in. And it has done the trick for him financially. But the soil is poor, and it must be fertilized and otherwise treated. This requires money he does not have. And so he is requesting a loan of $950 to stock fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1962, Monsieur M. Kossi est un homme marié. Cultivatrice comme lui, sa femme n’a que le maigre revenu de son travail. Il est instruit de niveau secondaire. Monsieur M. compte à sa charge trois (3) personnes dont deux (2) enfants. Faisant de l’agriculture son activité principale, il a fait une formation en agriculture qui lui permet de tirer son épingle du jeu mais les sols étant pauvres, il est nécessaire de les fertiliser par des engrais et autres intrants. Ceci demande des moyens dont il ne dispose pas.. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $950 pour s’approvisionner en intrants afin d’enrichir le sol pour une bonne réussite des cultures. Les revenus de cette activité permettront à Monsieur M. de prendre mieux en charge ses enfants en matière de santé, de nourriture, de scolarité.

loans.use: To stock soil amendments for growing crops

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: This young man was born in 1982 in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is single. He has run this business for three years. He has a plot of land where he grows grapes. Elshan works very hard to get a rich harvest. He needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en:
Eliana A. is the proud owner of Venta de Comestico, a general store in La Union, a quaint community in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. Although she is without a physical storefront, Eliana provides an additional service to her customers by faithfully delivering her customer’s orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand her inventory of cosmetic and hygienic supplies to better meet the needs of her community. Originally from Haiti, the 38-year-old Eliana enjoys spending time with her husband, Ambrody, when she is not tending to her business.

Note: Eliana A. is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $725 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase hair coloring, cosmetic, and hygienic supplies.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero U. is 57 years old and is happily married with 8 children. She hails from an urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. Vero has been with LAPO for 7 years as a union leader. She has been running her business for 10 years and she needs a loan of US$ 800 to buy more drinks and food ingredients to enable her to prepare more food for sale in her little restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for her little restaurant

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a 61-year-old father of four, is a retired civil servant. He has been running a grocery store and restaurant from his home for the past seven years. He also received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

William requests a loan of $550 to purchase supplies to expand his grocery store and restaurant.

loans.use: Expand store and restaurant

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. is a carpenter who manufactures all kinds of furniture. He is married with five children. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, and soaps. He works very hard to support his wife since her income is low. He also makes coffins and supplies organizations with all kinds of furniture.

Isaac is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group.” The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – on the Accra Highway.

One challenge that Isaac faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them, but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers, and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from financial organizations. As a result, Isaac needs a loan of US $1,100 to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools, and the material used to manufacture furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools, and the material used to manufacture furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness, age 22, lives with her husband. She has a business of selling clothes which she started in 2005. She works daily from 8am to 4pm and makes a monthly profit of about $165. Happiness is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is forty years old. She and her husband have five children, four of them boys, that range from ten to twenty years old.  Miguelina owns and operates a tailoring shop in the community of Altagracia in Santo Domingo.  She learned to sew at the age of twelve.  The entrepreneur has three different sewing machines that she works with.  Miguelina explains that she mostly prepares party and wedding dresses.   Sometimes she offers her services to school-going children.
Miguelina is requesting a loan to by a lot of material such as cloth, sewing thread, and zippers in other to keep preparing dresses for her customers.  Miguelina’s business supports her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to satisfy the needs of her numerous customers

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa, 32, lives in Managua's Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She's married and her husband earns a modest wage working for the Nicaraguan army. They have two young children, a one-year old and a three-year old. With their senior years in mind, they've set up a business, started by Elsa, selling light meals: fried pork, hamburgers and cold drinks. She's managed to operate the business for 8 years now. With the income from the business, Elsa has been able to improve her house little by little. It's walls aren't made of concrete, though, and the makeshift electricals are old. This loan will help her make additional improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa Núñez de 32 años de edad habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el ejercito en el cual gana un modesto salario con el cual asume los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijos pequeños uno de 1 año y el otro de 3 años de edad. Juntos lograron poner un negocio pensando en su vejez el cual inicio doña Elsa N. vendiendo carne de cerdo frito con toritilla, hamburguesas y Refrescos. Logró montar un pequeño negocio de venta de comida casera desde hace ya 8 años. De este negocio ha podido doña Elsa mejorar su vivienda de poco a poco, sus paredes no son de concretos y el sistema eléctrico es improvisado y viejo, este prestamos le ayudara a mejorar su hogar.

loans.use: Build cement walls, install new electricals and new floors.
